analyzed: rajjumālā ati mama vidunti kese gahetvā ākaḍḍhana parikaḍḍhana dukkhena muṇḍake kate
translated: I was called Rope-mat means my head was shaved by pulling out the hair with a rope.

original: punapi tadatthameva sīse daḷhaṃ bandhitvā ṭhapitarajjukuṇḍalakavasena “rajjumālā”ti
analyzed: punar api tadattham eva sīse daḷham bandhitvā ṭhapita rajju kuṇḍalaka vasena
translated: and again, because of the meaning of that, they knew me as “Rajjumālā” (the Rope Garland),

original: maṃ manussā jāniṃsu.
analyzed: mam manussāḥ jāniṃsu
translated: like a firm-bound earring placed on the head.

original: 834. Vadhānanti tāḷanānaṃ. Tajjanāyāti bhayasaṃtajjanena. Uggatāti uggatāya domanassuppattiyā. Udahāriyāti udakahārikā, udakaṃ āharantī viya hutvāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: vadha ānam tajjanāya ati bhaya saṃtajjanena uggatā ati uggatāya domanassa uppattiyā uda hāriyā ati udaka hārikā udakam āharantī viya hutvā iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: . “Killings” means the killings of the Tāḷa-kaṅkas. “To be ashamed” means to be frightened. “Uggat” means because of the arising of grief. “Udaka-hārī” means a water-carrier, the intention is: as if she were carrying water.

original: 835. Vipatheti apathe, maggato apakkamitvāti attho. Kvatthoti ko attho. Soyeva vā pāṭho.
analyzed: vipathā iti apathe maggataḥ a pakkamitvā ati attho kvattho iti kaḥ vā pāṭho
translated: . “Vipathe” means on a path, the meaning is: having gone away from the path. “Kvattha” means what is the meaning? This is the reading.

original: 836. Daḷhaṃ pāsaṃ karitvānāti bandhanapāsaṃ thiraṃ acchijjanakaṃ katvā. Āsumbhitvāna🔽pādapeti viṭape lagganavasena pādape rukkhe khipitvā. Tato disā vilokesiṃ, ko nu
analyzed: daḷham pāsam karitvāna ati bandhana pāsam thiram acchijjanakam katvā  pādapa iti viṭape laggana vasena pādape rukkhe khipitvā tatas disā vilokesim kaḥ nu
translated: . “Having made a firm noose” means having made a firm binding noose that is hard to break. “Having seized”🔽means having thrown the tree, having placed it in the branch, as if it were a foot. Then I looked around, thinking: “Who is it

original: kho vanamassitoti imaṃ vanaṃ pavisanavasena assito nu kho koci atthi, yato me maraṇantarāyo siyāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: kho vanam assito ti imam vanam pavisana vasena assitaḥ nu kho koci atthi yatas me maraṇa antarāyaḥ siyāti adhippāyaḥ
translated: that has entered the forest?” the intention is: is there anyone who has entered this forest, so that I may have an obstacle to my death?🔽.

original: 837. Sambuddhantiādi tadā tassā tādise nicchaye asatipi sabhāvavasena vuttaṃ. Tassattho🔽– sayameva sammadeva ca sabbassāpi bujjhitabbassa buddhattā sambuddhaṃ, mahākaruṇāyogena
analyzed: sambuddha ntiādi tadā tassā tādise nicchaye asati pi sabhāva vasena vuttam  sayam eva sammat eva ca sabbassa api bujjhitabbassa buddha ttā sambuddham mahā karuṇā yogena
translated: “The Sambuddha” and so on: this was said by way of individual essence, although at that time there was no such definite knowledge in her. The meaning is as follows:

original: hīnādibhedabhinnassa sabbassāpi lokassa ekantahitattā sabbalokahitaṃ, ubhayalokaṃ
analyzed: hīna ādi bheda bhinnassa sabbassa api lokassa ekanta hitattā sabbaloka hitam ubhaya lokam
translated: He is the Sambuddha because of the state of being awakened to all that is to be awakened to, by himself and in the right way. He is the welfare of the whole world because of the state of being the sole benefit of the whole world, consisting of the low, the high, and so on, by the union with great compassion. He is the Muni because of the state of being the sage of the two worlds,

original: munanato muniṃ, nisajjāvasena kilesābhisaṅkhārehi ṭhānā cāvanābhāvena ca nisinnaṃ,🔽ārammaṇūpanijjhānena lakkhaṇūpanijjhānena ca jhāyantaṃ, bodhimūleyeva bhayahetūnaṃ
analyzed: munanataḥ munim nisajja avasena kilesa abhisaṅkhārehi ṭhānā cāvana abhāvena ca nisinnam  ārammaṇa upanijjhānena lakkhaṇa upanijjhānena ca jhāyantam
translated: by way of sitting down and by way of the state of being seated without moving from one’s place because of the destruction of defilements and of the formations.

original: samucchinnattā kutocipi bhayābhāvato akutobhayanti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: samucchinna ttā kutocipi bhaya abhāvataḥ akutobhayanti veditabbam
translated: He is the one who is meditating because of the state of being one who is meditating by way of the reflection on the object and by way of the reflection on the characteristics. He is the one who is without fear from anywhere because of the state of being the one who is without fear from anywhere, because of the state of being the one who has cut off the causes of fear right at the root of the Bodhi tree.

original: 838. Saṃvego nāma sahottappaṃ ñāṇaṃ, so tassā bhagavato dassanena uppajji. Tenāha “tassā me ahu saṃvego”ti.
analyzed: saṃvegaḥ nāma saha uttappam ñāṇam so tassā bhagavataḥ dassanena uppajji tena āha tassā me ahu saṃvegaḥ ti
translated: The state of being alarmed is the knowledge accompanied by the state of being ashamed. It arose in her because of the vision of the Blessed One. Therefore she said: “I was alarmed.”

original: 839. Pāsādikanti pasādāvahaṃ, dvattiṃsamahāpurisalakkhaṇaasītianubyañjanabyāmappabhāketumālālaṅkatāya
analyzed: pāsādikam ti pasāda āvaham
translated: The state of being inspiring confidence is the state of being confidence-inspiring. She was inspired with confidence because of the state of being adorned with the thirty-two marks of a Great Man, the eighty minor characteristics, the radiance of the body, and the garland of light.

original: samantapāsādikāya attano sarīrasobhāsampattiyā rūpakāyadassanabyāvaṭassa janassa
analyzed: samanta pāsādikāya attano sarīra sobhā sampattiyā rūpa kāya dassana byāvaṭassa janassa
translated: The meaning is that it increases the confidence of people who are engrossed in seeing the beauty of the physical form, which is the beauty of the body that is lovely in all aspects.

original: sādhubhāvato pasādasaṃvaḍḍhananti attho. Pasādanīyanti dasabala-catuvesārajjachaasādhāraṇañāṇa-aṭṭhārasāveṇika-buddhadhammapabhutiaparimāṇaguṇasamannāgatāya🔽dhammakāyasampattiyā sarikkhakajanassa pasīditabbayuttaṃ, pāsādikanti attho. Vanāti
analyzed: sādhu bhāvato pasāda saṃvaḍḍhananti attho pasādanīyanti  dhammakāya sampattiyā sa rikkhaka janassa pasīditabba yuttam pāsādikanti atthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is fit to be trusted by people who are similar to it in the possession of the Dhamma body endowed with such and such immeasurable special qualities as the ten powers, the four kinds of fearlessness, the six kinds of knowledge not held in common , and the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha.

original: kilesavanato apakkamitvā. Nibbanamāgatanti nittaṇhabhāvaṃ nibbānameva upagataṃ adhigataṃ.
analyzed: kilesa vanataḥ a pakkamitvā nibbanam āgatanti nittaṇha bhāvam nibbānam eva upagatam adhigatam
translated: The meaning is that it is lovely. Vananti means that it has gone out, having turned away from the hearing of defilements. Nibbanamāgataṃ means that it has reached, has attained, the state of being without cleaving, nibbāna itself.

original: Yādisakīdisoti yo vā so vā, pacurajanoti attho.
analyzed: yādisa kīdisaḥ iti yaḥ vā saḥ vā attho
translated: Yādisakīdisaṃ means whatever kind it is. The meaning is that it is ordinary people.🔽Guttindriyo means that he is one who guards the sense doors by guarding the mind as the sixth sense faculty.

original: 840-41. Manacchaṭṭhānaṃ indriyānaṃ aggamaggagopanāya gopitattā guttindriyo. Aggaphalajjhānābhiratiyā
analyzed: indriyānam agga magga gopanāya gopita ttā gutti indriyaḥ agga phala jhāna abhiratiyā
translated: Jhānarato means that he delights in the jhāna that is the highest fruit.

original: jhānarato. Tato eva bahibhūtehi rūpādiārammaṇehi apakkamitvā visayajjhatte nibbāne
analyzed: jhāna rataḥ tatas eva bahi bhūtehi rūpa ādi ārammaṇehi a pakkamitvā visaya jjhatte nibbāne
translated: Having turned away from the external objects of sense pleasure such as visible forms, etc., he has gone out to the object of jhāna, nibbāna, which is the opposite of those.

original: ca ogāḷhacittatāya abahiggatamānaso. Micchāgāhamocanabhayena vipallāsavantehi micchādiṭṭhikehi
analyzed: ca ogāḷha citta tāya a bahiggata mānasaḥ micchāgāha mocana bhayena vipallāsavantehi micchādiṭṭhikehi
translated: And because of his mind’s lack of concealment and his mind’s lack of outwardness,🔽and because of his being afraid of the fear of being bound by wrong views, and because of his causing fear in those who are bound by wrong views by means of the perversions,

original: bhāyitabbato tesañca bhayajananato bhayabheravo. Payogāsayavipannehi anupagamanīyato
analyzed: tesam ca bhaya jananataḥ bhaya bheravaḥ payoga āsaya vipannehi anupagamanīyataḥ
translated: and because of his being unapproachable by those who are confused about the means and the goal,🔽and because of his being unassailable by anyone, he is the one who is unassailable.

original: ca kenacipi anāsādanīyato ca durāsado. Dullabhāyanti dullabho ayaṃ. Dassanāyāti daṭṭhumpi.
analyzed: ca kenacipi an āsādanīyato ca durāsadaḥ dullabhāyanti dullabhaḥ ayam dassanāya ati daṭṭhum pi
translated: Rare to see is rare to see. To see is to see.

original: Pupphaṃ odumbaraṃ yathāti yathā nāma udumbare bhavaṃ pupphaṃ dullabhadassanaṃ, kadācideva
analyzed: puppham odumbaram yathā iti yathā nāma udumbare bhavam puppham dullabha dassanam kadācid eva
translated: Like the flower of the udumbara tree is like the flower of the udumbara tree. Just as the flower that exists in the udumbara tree is rare to see, sometimes

original: bhaveyya, na vā bhaveyya, evaṃ īdisassa uttamapuggalassāti attho.
analyzed: bhaveyya na vā bhaveyya evam īdisassa uttama puggalassa ati attho
translated: it may be, sometimes it may not be, so is such a supreme person.

original: 842. So tathāgato mudūhi vācāhi saṇhāya vācāya “rajjumāle”ti maṃ ālapitvā āmantetvā
analyzed: saḥ tathāgataḥ mudūhi vācāhi saṇhāya vācāya rajju mālā iti mama ālapitvā āmantetvā
translated: That Tathāgata, with soft words, with gentle words, addressing me as “Rāma,” inviting me,

original: saraṇaṃ gaccha tathāgatanti “tathā āgato”tiādinā tathāgataṃ sammāsambuddhaṃ saraṇaṃ
analyzed: saraṇam gaccha tathāgata iti tathā āgata uti ādinā tathāgatam sammāsambuddham saraṇam
translated: “Go for refuge to the Tathāgata” thus, with the meaning “gone thus,” etc., to the Tathāgata, the Fully Enlightened One,

original: gacchāti maṃ avoca abhāsīti yojanā.
analyzed: gaccha ati mama avoca abhāsi iti yojanā
translated: he spoke, he said, is the construction.

original: 843-4. Tāhanti taṃ ahaṃ. Giranti vācaṃ. Nelanti niddosaṃ. Atthavatinti atthayuttaṃ
analyzed: tāhanti tam aham giranti vācam niddosam atthavatinti attha yuttam
translated: Tāhaṃ: I, that one. Girā: speech. Nelā: free from defilements. Atthavatī: meaningful, profitable.

original: sātthaṃ, ekantahitaṃ vā. Vacīsoceyyatāya suciṃ. Akakkhaḷatāya saṇhaṃ. Veneyyānaṃ🔽mudubhāvakarattā mudu. Savanīyabhāvena vagguṃ. Sabbasokāpanūdananti ñātibyasanādivasena
analyzed: sāttham ekanta hitam vā vacīsoceyyatāya sucim a kakkhaḷa tāya saṇham veneyyānam  mudu bhāva karattā mudu savanīya bhāvena vaggum ñāti byasana ādi vasena
translated: Suci: pure, by virtue of verbal purity. Saṇhā: gentle, by virtue of being free from harshness.🔽Mudū: flexible, because it causes the disciples to become flexible. Vaggu: charming, by virtue of being pleasant to hear.

original: uppajjanakassa sabbassāpi sokassa vinodanaṃ giraṃ sutvāna pasannacittā ahosinti sambandho.
analyzed: uppajjanakassa sabbassa api sokassa vinodanam giram sutvāna pasanna cittā ahosin ti sambandho
translated: Sabbasokāpanūdananti: the speech that dispels all sorrow, having heard the speech that dispels all sorrow that arises through such things as the loss of relatives, they became pleased in mind.

original: Sabbametaṃ dānakathaṃ ādiṃ katvā ussakkitvā nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ vibhāvanavasena pavattitaṃ
analyzed: sabbam etam dāna katham ādim katvā ussakkitvā nekkhamme ānisaṃsam vibhāvana vasena pavattitam
translated: All this is said with reference to the Blessed One’s gradual talk, which is given by way of showing the benefits of renunciation, having begun with the talk on giving.

original: bhagavato anupubbikathaṃ sandhāya vadati. Tenevāha “kallacittañca maṃ ñatvā”tiādi.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ anupubbi katham sandhāya vadati tena iva āha kalla cittam ca mama ñatvā atiādi
translated: Therefore he says, “Having known my mind to be ready,” and so on.

original: Tattha kallacittanti kammaniyacittaṃ, heṭṭhā pavattitadesanāya assaddhiyādīnaṃ cittadosānaṃ
analyzed: tattha kalla cittam ti kammaniya cittam heṭṭhā pavattita desanāya
translated: There, ready mind means a mind that is fit, because the mental defilements of lack of faith, etc., that occurred below

original: vigatattā uparidesanāya bhājanabhāvūpagamanena kammakkhamacittaṃ, bhāvanākammassa
analyzed: vigata ttā upari desanāya bhājana bhāva upagamanena kamma kkhama cittam bhāvanā kammassa
translated: have disappeared, and because the mind has become a fit vessel for the teaching above by way of its attainment of the state of being a vessel. The mind that is fit for the practice

original: yoggacittanti attho. Tenevāha “pasannaṃ suddhamānasa”nti. Tattha “pasanna”nti iminā🔽assaddhiyāpagamamāha, “suddhamānasa”nti iminā kāmacchandādiapagamanena muducittataṃ
analyzed: yogga cittanti attho tena iva āha pasannam suddha mānasam ti tattha pasannam ti iminā  assaddhiyā apagamam āha iminā kāmacchanda ādi apagamanena
translated: “The mind of one who is devoted” is the meaning. Hence he said “clear and pure-minded.” Herein, by “clear” he shows

original: udaggacittatañca dasseti. Anusāsīti ovadi, sāmukkaṃsikāya dhammadesanāya saha upāyena🔽pavattinivattiyo upadisīti attho. Tenevāha “idaṃ dukkha”ntiādi. Anusāsitākāradassanañhetaṃ.
analyzed: udagga citta tañca dasseti anusāsīti ovadi sāmukkaṃsikāya dhamma desanāya saha upāyena  pavatti nivattiyaḥ upadisī ti attho tena iva āha idam dukkham ti ādi anusāsita ākāra dassanam ha etam
translated: that he is free from faithlessness; by “pure-minded” he shows that his mind is malleable and wieldy through being free from lust, hate, etc.;

original: 845. Tattha idaṃ dukkhanti maṃvocāti idaṃ taṇhāvajjaṃ tebhūmakaṃ dhammajātaṃ bādhakasabhāvattā
analyzed: tattha idam dukkham ti maṃvoca ati idam taṇhā vajjam tebhūmakam dhamma jātam bādhaka sabhāva ttā
translated: “He instructed” means he advised; the meaning is that he taught the Dhamma together with the means, showing the turning away from the occurrence of the round of rebirths. Hence he said “This is suffering,” etc. For this is a showing of the way in which he instructed.

original: kucchikaṃ hutvā tucchasabhāvattā tathattā ca dukkhaṃ ariyasaccanti mayhaṃ abhāsi.🔽Ayaṃ dukkhassa sambhavoti ayaṃ āmataṇhādibhedā taṇhā yathāvuttassa dukkhassa sambhavo
analyzed: kucchikam hutvā tuccha sabhāva ttā tathattā ca dukkham ariya saccanti mayham abhāsi  ayam dukkhassa sambhavaḥ ti ayam āma taṇhā ādi bhedā taṇhā yathā vuttassa dukkhassa sambhavaḥ
translated: Herein, he said “This is suffering” means he said to me “This is suffering, the noble truth, which is the various kinds of states in the three planes of becoming, which is a burden, because it is a state of oppression, and which is a void, because it is a state of emptiness.”

original: pabhavo uppatti hetu samudayo ariyasaccanti. Dukkhanirodhoti dukkhassa santibhāvo
analyzed: pabhavaḥ uppatti hetu samudayaḥ ariya saccanti dukkha nirodho ti dukkhassa santi bhāvo
translated: “This is the origin of suffering” means this craving, which is of the nature of desire and lust, is the origin, the source, the arising, the cause, the condition, of the suffering stated thus.

original: asaṅkhatadhātu nirodho ariyasaccanti. Antadvayassa parivajjanato añjaso nibbānagāminipaṭipadābhāvato
analyzed: asaṅkhata dhātu nirodhaḥ ariya saccanti anta dvayassa parivajjanataḥ añjasas nibbāna gāmini paṭipada abhāvato
translated: The Thread’s meaning is this: because of the avoidance of the two extremes and because of the presence of the way leading to extinction,

original: amatogadho maggo ariyasaccanti maṃ avocāti sambandho.
analyzed: amatogadhaḥ maggaḥ ariya saccanti mam avoca ati sambandho
translated: the path is the noble truth of the way leading to extinction.

original: 846. Kusalassāti ovādadāne veneyyadamane chekassa, appamādapaṭipattiyā vā matthakappattiyā
analyzed: kusalassa ati ovāda dāne veneyya damane chekassa appamāda paṭipattiyā vā matthaka ppattiyā
translated: “ The profitable” : in the giving of advice and in the taming of those to be tamed, or else in the practice of heedfulness that reaches its culmination in the profitable,🔽is blameless.

original: anavajjassa. Ovādamhi ahaṃ ṭhitāti yathāvutte ovāde anusiṭṭhiyaṃ sikkhāttayapāripūriyā
analyzed: anavajjassa ovādamhi aham ṭhitā ati yathā vutte ovāde anusiṭṭhiyam sikkhā ttaya pāripūriyā
translated: “ I am established in the advice” : I am established in the realization of the truths by fulfilling the three trainings in the advice and instruction stated thus.

original: saccapaṭivedhena ahaṃ patiṭṭhitā. Tenāha “ajjhagā amataṃ santiṃ, nibbānaṃ padamaccuta”nti,🔽idaṃ ovāde patiṭṭhānassa kāraṇavacanaṃ. Yā niccatāya maraṇābhāvato amataṃ, sabbadukkhavūpasamatāya
analyzed: sacca paṭivedhena aham patiṭṭhitā tena āha ajjhagāḥ amatam santim nibbānam padam accutam ti  idam ovāde patiṭṭhānassa kāraṇa vacanam yā niccatāya maraṇa abhāvataḥ amatam sabba dukkha vūpasama tāya
translated: Hence he said “ I have discovered the deathless, the peace, The state that is without affliction “ .🔽This is a statement of the reason for the establishment in the advice.🔽The state that is without affliction since it is the extinction of the permanent,🔽the peace since it is the stilling of all suffering,

original: santiṃ, adhigatānaṃ acavanahetutāya accutaṃ nibbānaṃ padaṃ ajjhagā adhigañchi, sā
analyzed: santim adhigatānam a cavana hetu tāya accutam nibbānam padam ajjhagāḥ adhigañchi sā
translated: the deathless since it is the cause of the non-wasting of what has been reached, he discovered,

original: ekaṃsena satthu ovāde patiṭṭhitā nāmāti.
analyzed: ekaṃsena satthu ovāde patiṭṭhitā nāma ati
translated: he attained, and he is therefore called “ established in the advice of the Teacher once and for all “ .

original: 847. Avaṭṭhitāpemāti daḷhabhattī ratanattaye niccalapasādasinehā. Kasmā? Yasmā dassane
analyzed: daḷha bhattī rata nattaye niccala pasāda sinehā kasmai yasmai dassane
translated: “Without wavering in their devotion”: with strong devotion, with unshaken confidence and love for the Triple Gem.

original: avikampinī, “sammāsambuddho bhagavā, svākkhāto dhammo, suppaṭipanno saṅgho”ti etasmiṃ
analyzed: avikampinī sammāsambuddhaḥ bhagavā su ākkhātaḥ dhammo su paṭipanno saṅghaḥ ti etasmiṃ
translated: “I am unshakable in my faith”: I am unshakable in my strong faith, in my unwavering confidence and love for the Triple Gem. Why? Because “I am unshakable in my vision” means that I am unwavering in my right view, which is expressed thus: “The Blessed Lord is fully enlightened, the Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Blessed Lord, the Sangha is practising the good way.”

original: sammādassane acalā kenaci acālanīyā. Kena panetaṃ avikampananti āha “mūlajātāya saddhāyā”ti.
analyzed: sammādassane acalā kenaci a cālanīyā kena pana itam a vikampanam ti āha mūla jātāya saddhāya ati
translated: I am unmoved by anyone, I cannot be led away from this right view by anyone. But why is it that I am unshakable? “Because my faith is rooted in the Buddha’s teaching.”

original: Ayaṃ “itipi so bhagavā araha”ntiādinā sammāsambuddhe, “svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammā’tiādinā
analyzed: ayam so bhagavā arahanti ādinā sammāsambuddhe su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhamma ati ādinā
translated: This shows that my faith is rooted in the realization of the Truths, which is expressed thus: “The Blessed Lord is fully enlightened,” “The Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Blessed Lord,”

original: tassa dhamme, “suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho”tiādinā tassa saṅghe ca saccābhisamayasaṅkhātena
analyzed: tassa dhamme suppaṭipannaḥ bhagavato sāvaka saṅghaḥ uti ādinā tassa saṅghe ca sacca abhisamaya saṅkhātena
translated: “The Sangha is practising the good way.”🔽It is rooted in the realization of the Truths, and therefore I am unshakable.

original: mūlena jātamūlā saddhā, tāya ahaṃ avikampinīti dasseti. Tato eva dhītā buddhassa
analyzed: mūlena jāta mūlā saddhā tāya aham avikampinī iti dasseti tatas eva dhītā buddhassa
translated: “I am the Buddha’s daughter” means that I am the daughter of the Buddha, the Fully Enlightened One,

original: orasāti sammāsambuddhassa ure vāyāmajanitābhijātitāya orasaputtī.
analyzed: orasā ati sammāsambuddhassa ure vāyāma janita abhijāti tāya orasa puttī
translated: “I am the Buddha’s bosom-born son” means that I am the son of the Buddha, the Fully Enlightened One, born of his breast-milk.

original: 848. Sāhaṃ ramāmīti sā ahaṃ tadā ariyāya jātiyā idāni devūpapattiyā āgatā maggaratiyā
analyzed: sā aham ramāmi iti sā aham tadā ariyāya jātiyā idāni deva upapattiyā āgatā magga ratiyā
translated: “I rejoice” means that I rejoice in the noble birth I had then and in the divine rebirth I have now, and in the excellent pleasure I have in the Buddha’s Dispensation.

original: phalaratiyā ca ramāmi, kāmaguṇaratiyā kīḷāmi, ubhayenāpi modāmi. Attānuvādabhayādīnaṃ
analyzed: phala ratiyā ca ramāmi kāma guṇa ratiyā kīḷāmi ubhayena api modāmi atta anuvāda bhaya ādīnam
translated: and I delight in the delight of the fruit, I play in the delight of the five strands of sense pleasure, I rejoice in both.

original: apagatattā akutobhayā. Madhumaddavanti madhusaṅkhātaṃ maddavakaraṃ, naccanagāyanakālesu🔽sarīrassa sarassa ca mudubhāvāvahaṃ gandhapānaṃ sandhāya vadati.“Madhumādava”ntipi
analyzed: apagata ttāḥ akutobhayāḥ madhu maddavanti madhu saṅkhātam maddava karam naccana gāyana kālesu  sarīrassa sarassa ca mudu bhāva āvaham gandha pānam sandhāya
translated: I am without fear from any quarter because of the absence of self-reproach and fear of others.🔽I drink the honey and the fresh honey, he says referring to the drink of scent which causes the softness and suppleness of the body and mind🔽at the time of dancing and singing. “Madhumādava” is also read.

analyzed: atha revatī pana pāsādam abhiruhitvā dvāram thaketvā nisīdi sattame divase tassā  pāpa kamma sañcoditena vessavaṇena raññā āṇattā jalita kapila kesa massukā cipiṭa virūpa nāsikā
translated: Then Revati ascended the palace, closed the door, and sat down. On the seventh day,🔽at the command of King Vessavaṇa, who was urged on by her evil deeds, two Yaksas, their hair and beards blazing like fire, with ugly, misshapen noses,

original: pariṇatadāṭhā lohitakkhā sajaladharasamānavaṇṇā ativiya bhayānakarūpā dve yakkhā🔽upagantvā “uṭṭhehi, revate, supāpadhamme”tiādīni vadantā nānābāhāsu gahetvā “mahājano
analyzed: pariṇata dāṭhā lohitakkhā sa jaladhara samāna vaṇṇā ativiya bhayānaka rūpā dve yakkhā  upagantvā uṭṭhehi revate su pāpa dhamma iti ādīni vadantā nānā bāhāsu gahetvā mahājanaḥ
translated: with protruding teeth, bloodshot eyes, and a complexion like that of a rain cloud, with a form that was extremely terrifying,🔽approached her. Saying, “Get up, Revati, you of evil conduct,” and so on, they grabbed her by her various limbs. “Let the people

original: passatū”ti sakalanagare vīthito vīthiṃ paribbhamāpetvā ākāsaṃ abbhuggantvā tāvatiṃsabhavanaṃ
analyzed: passatu uti sakala nagare vīthitaḥ vīthim paribbhamāpetvā ākāsam abbhut gantvā tāvatiṃsa bhavanam
translated: see her!” they paraded her through the streets of the entire city. Then they rose into the sky and went to the realm of the Thirty-three gods.

original: netvā nandiyassa vimānaṃ sampattiñcassā dassetvā taṃ vilapantiṃyeva ussadanirayasamīpaṃ
analyzed: netvā nandiyassa vimānam sampattim ca assā dassetvā tam vilapantiṃyā iva ussada niraya samīpam
translated: and after taking her to Nandiya’s mansion and showing her his glory, they led her, still lamenting, to the vicinity of the Ussada hell.

original: pāpesuṃ. Taṃ yamapurisā ussadaniraye khipiṃsu. Tenāha –
analyzed: tam yama purisāḥ ussada niraye khipiṃsu tena āha
translated: The wardens of hell threw her into the Ussada hell. Therefore it is said:

original: “Uṭṭhehi revate supāpadhamme, apārutadvāre adānasīle;
analyzed: uṭṭhehi revate su pāpa dhamme a pāruta dvāre a dāna sīle
translated: “Rise up, Revate, you of evil conduct, you who have not opened the door to giving, to virtue!

original: Nessāma taṃ yattha thunanti duggatā, samappitā nerayikā dukhenā”ti.
analyzed: nessāma tam yattha thunanti duggatā samappitā nerayikāḥ dukhena ati
translated: We will lead you to where the wretched ones, the hell-beings, are assembled in pain.”

original: Tattha uṭṭhehīti uṭṭhaha, na dānesa pāsādo taṃ nirayabhayato rakkhituṃ sakkoti, tasmā
analyzed: tattha uṭṭhehi iti uṭṭhaha na dāna isa pāsādo tam niraya bhayataḥ rakkhitum sakkoti tasmā
translated: Herein, rise up means rise up, this mansion is not able to protect you from the fear of hell, therefore

original: sīghaṃ uṭṭhahitvā āgacchāhīti attho. Revateti taṃ nāmena ālapati. Supāpadhammetiādinā
analyzed: sīgham uṭṭhahitvā āgacchāhi iti attho revata iti tam nāmena ālapati su pāpa dhamma iti ādinā
translated: you should rise up quickly and come. Revate means he addresses her by name. You of evil conduct means

original: uṭṭhānassa kāraṇaṃ vadati. Yasmā tvaṃ ariyānaṃ akkosanaparibhāsanādinā suṭṭu lāmakapāpadhammā,
analyzed: uṭṭhānassa kāraṇam vadati yasmai tvam ariyānam akkosana paribhāsana ādinā suṭṭu lāmaka pāpa dhammā
translated: he states the reason for rising up. Because you are very much of evil conduct, of bad behaviour, by abusing and reviling Noble Ones,

original: yasmā ca apārutaṃ dvāraṃ nirayassa tava pavesanatthaṃ, tasmā uṭṭhehīti. Adānasīleti
analyzed: yasmai ca apārutam dvāram nirayassa tava pavesana attham tasmai uṭṭhehi iti a dāna sīlā iti
translated: and because the door to hell has been opened for you to enter, therefore rise up. You who have not opened the door to giving, to virtue means

original: kassaci kiñci na dānasīle kadariye maccharinī, idampi uṭṭhānasseva kāraṇavacanaṃ.
analyzed: kassaci kiñci na dāna sīle kadariye maccharinī idam pi uṭṭhānassa iva kāraṇa vacanam
translated: you who have not given anything to anyone, you who are miserly and greedy, this too is a statement of the reason for rising up.

original: Yasmā dānasīlānaṃ amaccharīnaṃ tava sāmikasadisānaṃ sugatiyaṃ nivāso, tādisānaṃ pana
analyzed: yasmai tava sāmika sadisānam sugatiyam nivāsaḥ pana
translated: “Because those who are not niggardly in generosity and virtue, who are like you, my lord, live in a happy destiny, but those who are niggardly in generosity and virtue live in a miserable destiny.

original: adānasīlānaṃ maccharīnaṃ niraye nivāso, tasmā uṭṭhehi, muhuttamattampi tava idha🔽ṭhātuṃ na dassāmīti adhippāyo. Yattha thunanti duggatāti dukkhagatattā duggatā. Nerayikāti🔽nirayadukkhena samappitā samaṅgībhūtā yasmiṃ niraye thunanti, yāva pāpakammaṃ na🔽byanti hoti, tāva nikkhamituṃ alabhantā nitthunanti, tattha taṃ nessāma nayissāma
analyzed: a dāna sīlānam mad śarīnam niraye nivāsaḥ tasmai uṭṭhehi muhutta mattam pi tava idha  ṭhātum na dassāmi iti adhippāyaḥ yattha thunanti duggatā ati dukkha gata ttā duggatā nerayikā ati  niraya dukkhena samappitā samaṅgībhūtāḥ yasmin niraye thunanti yāva pāpa kammam na  byanti hoti tāva nikkhamitum a labhantā nitthunanti tattha tam nessāma nayissāma
translated: Since those who are not miserly in generosity and virtue, who are like you, live in the happy destinies, but those who are not generous and virtuous, who are miserly, live in the hells, therefore get up, I will not allow you to stay here even for a moment.

original: khipissāmāti yojanā.
analyzed: yojanā
translated: The intention is this: “Where they boil, the ill-gone” : because of the state of suffering, they are ill-gone. “The hell-bound” : in the hell where they boil, they are bound, they are united, with the suffering of hell, as long as their evil kamma does not become exhausted, they do not get out, they boil there, we will lead them there, we will take them there, we will throw them there.

original: “Icceva vatvāna yamassa dūtā, te dve yakkhā lohitakkhā brahantā;
analyzed: iccā iva vatvāna yamassa dūtā te dve yakkhā lohitakkhā brahantā
translated: “Having thus spoken, Yama’s messengers, two blood-red, terrifying demons,

original: Paccekabāhāsu gahetvā revataṃ, pakkāmayuṃ devagaṇassa santike”ti. –
analyzed: pacceka bāhāsu gahetvā revatam pakkāmayum deva gaṇassa santike iti
translated: Seizing Revata by his arms, took him away in the presence of the assembly of gods.”

original: Idaṃ saṅgītikāravacanaṃ.
analyzed: idam saṅgītikāra vacanam
translated: This is the statement of the compilers of the canon.

original: Tattha icceva vatvānāti iti eva “uṭṭhehī”tiādinā vatvā, vacanasamanantaramevāti attho.
analyzed: tattha iti ca iva vatvāna ati iti eva uṭṭhehi iti ādinā vatvā vacana samanantaram eva ati attho
translated: Herein, “Having thus spoken” : having thus spoken “Get up,” etc., immediately after the words, is the meaning.

original: Yamassa dūtāti appaṭisedhaniyatassa yamassa rañño dūtasadisā. Vessavaṇena hi te pesitā.🔽Tathā hi te tāvatiṃsabhavanaṃ nayiṃsu. Keci “na yamassa dūtā”ti na-kāraṃ “yamassā”ti
analyzed: yamassa dūtā ati appaṭisedha niyatassa yamassa raññaḥ dūta sadisāḥ vessavaṇena hi te pesitā  tathā hi te tāvatiṃsa bhavanam nayiṃsu keci na yamassa dūta ati nakāram yamassa ati
translated: They were like messengers of the king of Death who cannot be disobeyed. For they were sent by Vessavaṇa.

original: padena sambandhitvā “vessavaṇassa dūtā”ti atthaṃ vadanti, taṃ na yujjati. Na hi na
analyzed: padena vessavaṇassa dūtā ti attham vadanti tam na yujjati na hi na
translated: For they led him to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven. Some people, taking the negative na in the phrase na yamassa dūtā as belonging to the word yamassā, explain the passage to mean that they were messengers of Vessavaṇa, the king of the Yāma gods. But this is not correct. For it is not proper to say that they were messengers of Vessavaṇa because they were not messengers of Yama.

original: yamadūtatāya vessavaṇassa dūtāti sijjhati. Yajanti tattha baliṃ upaharantīti yakkhā.
analyzed: yama dūta tāya vessavaṇassa dūtā ati sijjhati yajanti tattha balim upaharanti iti yakkhā
translated: The yakkhas are so called because they sacrifice , that is, offer oblations, there.

original: Lohitakkhāti rattanayanā. Yakkhānañhi nettāni atilohitāni honti. Brahantāti mahantā.
analyzed: lohitakkhā ati ratta nayanā yakkhānam hi nettāni ati lohitāni honti brahantā ati mahantā
translated: The red-eyed ones: their eyes are very red. For the eyes of the yakkhas are very red. The huge ones: the big ones.

original: Paccekabāhāsūti eko ekabāhāyaṃ, itaro itarabāhāyanti paccekaṃ bāhāsu. Revatanti revatiṃ.
analyzed: pacceka bāhāsu iti ekaḥ eka bāhāyam itaraḥ itarabāhāyanti paccekam bāhāsu revatanti revatim
translated: The one on each arm: the one on one arm, the other on the other arm. Revati: the Revati .

original: Revatātipi tassā nāmameva. Tathā hi “revate”ti vuttaṃ. Pakkāmayunti pakkāmesuṃ, upanesunti
analyzed: revatā atipi tassāḥ nāmam eva tathā hi revatā iti vuttam pakkāmayunti pakkāmesum upanesunti
translated: Revati is also her name, for it is said, “Revati.” They led him: they led him away; they brought him, is the meaning.

original: attho. Devagaṇassāti tāvatiṃsabhavane devasaṅghassa.
analyzed: atthaḥ deva gaṇassa ti tāvatiṃsa bhavane deva saṅghassa
translated: To the assembly of gods: to the assembly of gods in the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.

original: Evaṃ tehi yakkhehi tāvatiṃsabhavanaṃ netvā nandiyavimānassa avidūre ṭhapitā revatī taṃ sūriyamaṇḍalasadisaṃ ativiya pabhassaraṃ disvā –
analyzed: evam tehi yakkhehi tāvatiṃsa bhavanam netvā nandiya vimānassa avidūre ṭhapitā revatī tam sūriya maṇḍala sadisam ativiya pabhassaram disvā
translated: Thus, after being taken to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven by the yakkhas, Revati, who was placed not far from the Nandana Pleasure Garden, saw the palace, which was very bright, like the orb of the sun.🔽“This palace is radiant, beautiful, and bright as the sun,

original: “Ādiccavaṇṇaṃ ruciraṃ pabhassaraṃ, byamhaṃ subhaṃ kañcanajālachannaṃ;
analyzed: ādicca vaṇṇam ruciram pabhassaram byamham subham kañcana jāla channam
translated: covered with a golden net, and crowded with people.

original: Kassetamākiṇṇajanaṃ vimānaṃ, suriyassa raṃsīriva jotamānaṃ.
analyzed: kassa itam ākiṇṇa janam vimānam suriyassa raṃsīḥ iva jotamānam
translated: It shines like the sun’s rays. Whose is it?🔽“The women, anointed with sandalwood cream,

original: “Nārīgaṇā candanasāralittā, ubhato vimānaṃ upasobhayanti;
analyzed: nārī gaṇā candana sāra littāḥ ubhatas vimānam upasobhayanti
translated: adorn the palace on both sides.

original: Taṃ dissati suriyasamānavaṇṇaṃ, ko modati saggapatto vimāne”ti. –
analyzed: tam dissati suriya samāna vaṇṇam kaḥ modati sagga pattaḥ vimāneti
translated: It shines like the sun. Who rejoices, having attained the palace in heaven?”

original: Te yakkhe pucchi. Tepi tassā –
analyzed: te yakkhe pucchi tepi tassā
translated: She asked the yakkhas. They told her:🔽“In Bārāṇasī, there was a lay disciple named Nandiya,

original: “Bārāṇasiyaṃ nandiyo nāmāsi, upāsako amaccharī dānapati vadaññū;
analyzed: bārāṇasiyam nandiyaḥ nāma asi upāsakaḥ amaccharī dānapati vadaññū
translated: who was generous, a donor, and charitable.🔽This palace is crowded with people,

original: Tassetamākiṇṇajanaṃ vimānaṃ, sūriyassa raṃsīriva jotamānaṃ.
analyzed: tassa etam ākiṇṇa janam vimānam sūriyassa raṃsīḥ iva jotamānam
translated: shining like the sun’s rays.🔽“The women, anointed with sandalwood cream,

original: “Nārīgaṇā candanasāralittā, ubhato vimānaṃ upasobhayanti;
analyzed: nārī gaṇā candana sāra littāḥ ubhatas vimānam upasobhayanti
translated: adorn the palace on both sides.

original: Taṃ dissati sūriyasamānavaṇṇaṃ, so modati saggapatto vimāne”ti. –
analyzed: tam dissati sūriya samāna vaṇṇam saḥ modati sagga pattaḥ vimāneti
translated: It shines like the sun. He rejoices, having attained the palace in heaven.”

original: Ācikkhiṃsu.
analyzed: ācikkhiṃsu
translated: They explained.

original: 868. Tattha candanasāralittāti sārabhūtena candanagandhena anulittasarīrā. Ubhato vimānanti vimānaṃ ubhato anto ceva bahi ca saṅgītādīhi upecca sobhayanti.
analyzed: tattha candana sāra littā ati sāra bhūtena candana gandhena anulitta sarīrāḥ ubhatas vimānanti vimānam ubhatas antar ca iva bahi ca saṅgīta ādīhi upecca sobhayanti
translated: Both mansions are resplendent means the mansions are resplendent both inside and out with singing and so on.🔽Then Revati

original: Atha revatī –
analyzed: atha revatī
translated: said:

original: “Nandiyassāhaṃ bhariyā, agārinī sabbakulassa issarā;
analyzed: nandiyassa aham bhariyā agārinī sabba kulassa issarā
translated: “I was Nandiya’s wife, the mistress of the house, the ruler of all the family.

original: Bhattu vimāne ramissāmi dānahaṃ, na patthaye nirayaṃ dassanāyā”ti. –
analyzed: vimāne ramissāmi dānaham na patthaye nirayam dassanāya ati
translated: I shall enjoy myself in my husband’s mansion, I do not long to see the hell.”

original: Āha. Tattha agārinīti gehasāminī. “Bhariyā sagāminī”tipi paṭhanti, bhariyā sahagāminīti🔽attho. Sabbakulassa issarā bhattūti mama bhattu nandiyassa sabbakuṭumbikassa issarā
analyzed: āha tattha agārinī iti geha sāminī bhariyā sagāminī iti pi paṭhanti bhariyā sahagāminī iti  attho sabba kulassa issarā bhattūti mama bhattu nandiyassa sabba kuṭumbikassa issarā
translated: Herein, the mistress of the house means the head of the house. Others read “bhariya sagāminī” , the meaning of which is “the wife who goes with her husband.”

original: sāminī ahosiṃ, tasmā idānipi vimāne issarā bhavissāmīti āha. Vimāne ramissāmi dānahanti
analyzed: sāminī ahosim tasmai vimāne issarā bhavissāmi iti āha vimāne ramissāmi dāna hanti
translated: I was the ruler, the mistress, of all the family, of my husband Nandiya, the head of the family, therefore I shall be the ruler now in the mansion too, is what she meant. I shall enjoy myself in my husband’s mansion means

original: evaṃ palobhetumeva hi taṃ te tattha nesuṃ. Na patthaye nirayaṃ dassanāyāti yaṃ pana
analyzed: evam palobhetum eva hi tam te tattha nesum na patthaye nirayam dassanāya ati yam pana
translated: they went there to tempt her in this way. I do not long to see the hell means

original: nirayaṃ maṃ tumhe netukāmā, taṃ nirayaṃ dassanāyapi na patthaye, kuto pavisitunti vadati.
analyzed: nirayam mam tumhe netu kāmā tam nirayam na patthaye kutas pavisitunti vadati
translated: “You want to take me to hell. I do not even wish to see hell, much less to enter it.”

original: Evaṃ vadantimeva “tvaṃ taṃ patthehi vā mā vā, kiṃ tava patthanāyā”ti nirayasamīpaṃ netvā –
analyzed: evam vadantim eva tvam tam patthehi vā mā vā kim tava patthanāya ati niraya samīpam netvā
translated: “Whether you wish it or not, what is the use of your wishing?” So saying, they took him to the vicinity of hell and recited the following Stanza,

original: “Eso te nirayo supāpadhamme, puññaṃ tayā akataṃ jīvaloke;
analyzed: esaḥ te nirayaḥ su pāpa dhamme puññam tayā a katam jīva loke
translated: “This is your hell, O you of evil conduct. You have not performed works of merit in the world of men.

original: Na hi maccharī rosako pāpadhammo, saggūpagānaṃ labhati sahabyata”nti. –
analyzed: na hi mad śarī rosakaḥ pāpa dhammaḥ saggūpagānam labhati
translated: For the miser, the angry man, the man of evil conduct, does not attain companionship with those who have gone to heaven.”

original: Gāthamāhaṃsu. Tassattho – eso tava nirayo, tayā dīgharattaṃ mahādukkhaṃ anubhavitabbaṭṭhānabhūto.
analyzed: gātham āhaṃsu tassa atthaḥ esaḥ tava nirayaḥ tayā dīgharattam mahā dukkham anubhavitabba ṭṭhāna bhūto
translated: The meaning of this Stanza is as follows: This is your hell, the place where you must suffer great sorrow for a long period of time.

original: Kasmā? Puññaṃ tayā akataṃ jīvaloke, yasmā manussaloke appamattakampi tayā puññaṃ
analyzed: kasmā puñam tayā a katam jīva loke yasmā manussa loke appamattakam pi tayā puññam
translated: Why? Because you have not performed works of merit in the world of men. You have not performed even the smallest work of merit in the world of men.

original: nāma na kataṃ, evaṃ akatapuñño pana tādiso satto maccharī attano sampattinigūhanalakkhaṇena
analyzed: nāma na katam evam akata puññaḥ pana tādisaḥ satto maccharī attanaḥ sampatti nigūhana lakkhaṇena
translated: Such a man, who has not performed works of merit, is a miser, for he is characterized by miserliness, which is the concealing of one’s own possessions.

original: maccharena samannāgato, paresaṃ rosuppādanena rosako, lobhādīhi pāpadhammehi samaṅgībhāvato
analyzed: maccharena samannāgato paresam rosa uppādanena rosakaḥ lobha ādīhi pāpa dhammehi samaṅgībhāvato
translated: He is angry, for he causes others to be angry. He is a man of evil conduct, for he is associated with evil conduct such as covetousness, etc.

original: pāpadhammo saggūpagānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ sahabhāvaṃ na labhatīti yojanā.
analyzed: pāpa dhammaḥ saggūpagānam devānam sahabyatam sahabhāvam na labhati iti yojanā
translated: He does not obtain the company, the companionship, of the gods who have gone to heaven.

original: Evaṃ pana vatvā te dve yakkhā tatthevantaradhāyiṃsu. Taṃsadise pana dve nirayapāle saṃsavake nāma gūthaniraye pakkhipituṃ ākaḍḍhante passitvā –
analyzed: evam pana vatvā te dve yakkhā tattha iva antaradhāyiṃsu tad sadise pana dve niraya pāle saṃsavake nāma gūtha niraye pakkhipitum ākaḍḍhante passitvā
translated: Having said this, the two spirits disappeared right there. But when she saw two hell wardens dragging two beings to the same hell, she asked:

original: “Kiṃ nu gūthañca muttañca, asuci paṭidissati;
analyzed: kim nu gūtham ca muttam ca asuci paṭidissati
translated: “What is this foul-smelling slime,🔽this filthy mess that I see here?

original: Duggandhaṃ kimidaṃ mīḷhaṃ, kimetaṃ upavāyatī”ti. –
analyzed: duggandham kim idam mīḍham kim etam
translated: “What is this foul-smelling slime? What is this that is oozing out?”

original: Taṃ nirayaṃ pucchi.
analyzed: tam nirayam pucchi
translated: She asked about that hell.

original: “Esa saṃsavako nāma, gambhīro sataporiso;
analyzed: esa saṃsavakaḥ nāma gambhīraḥ sata porisaḥ
translated: “This is the hell called Saṃsava,🔽deep and full of water,🔽where you will boil for a thousand years, Revate.

original: Yattha vassasahassāni, tuvaṃ paccasi revate”ti. –
analyzed: yattha vassa sahassāni tuvam paccasi revatā iti
translated: Where you will spend a thousand years, Revate.”

original: Tasmiṃ kathite tattha attano nibbattihetubhūtaṃ kammaṃ pucchantī –
analyzed: tasmim kathite tattha attanaḥ nibbatti hetu bhūtam kammam pucchantī
translated: When that was said, she asked about the deed she had done in a previous state of existence that caused her to be reborn there:🔽“What evil deed was done by me

original: “Kiṃ nu kāyena vācāya, manasā dukkaṭaṃ kataṃ;
analyzed: kim nu kāyena vācāya manasā dukkaṭam katam
translated: in thought, word, or bodily action?🔽What did I do that I should have🔽to go to this deep hell?

original: Kena saṃsavako laddho, gambhīro sataporiso”ti. – āha;
analyzed: kena saṃsavakaḥ laddhaḥ gambhīraḥ sa taporisaḥ iti āha
translated: “By whom was he taken as a disciple, this deep, true man?”

original: “Samaṇe brāhmaṇe cāpi, aññe vāpi vanibbake;
analyzed: samaṇe brāhmaṇe ca api aññe vā api vanibbake
translated: “You deceived ascetics and brahmans,🔽and other people as well, with lies.

original: Musāvādena vañcesi, taṃ pāpaṃ pakataṃ tayā”ti. –
analyzed: musā vādena vañcesi tam pāpam pakatam tayā ati
translated: That is the evil you did.”

original: Tassā taṃ kammaṃ kathetvā puna te –
analyzed: tassā tam kammam kathetvā puna te
translated: After telling her that, they said to them:

original: 886. Tattha yoti aniyamitavacanaṃ, tassa “ta”nti iminā niyamanaṃ veditabbaṃ. Vadatanti
analyzed: tattha yaḥ ti aniyamita vacanam tassa tanti iminā niyamanam veditabbam
translated: Herein, yo is an indefinite term; its definition is to be understood as “that” with the “ta” .🔽Vadataṃ : among those who speak.🔽Pavaro : the best, the most excellent speaker among speakers. The meaning is: the foremost speaker.

original: vadantānaṃ. Pavaroti seṭṭho, kathikānaṃ uttamo vādīvaroti attho. Manujesūti ukkaṭṭhaniddeso
analyzed: vadantānam pavaro ti seṭṭho kathikānam uttamaḥ vādīvaro ti atthaḥ manujesu iti ukkaṭṭha niddeso
translated: Manujesu : this is a term of superlative designation,

original: yathā “satthā devamanussāna”nti. Bhagavā pana devamanussānampi brahmānampi sabbesampi
analyzed: yathā satthā deva manussānanti bhagavā pana deva manussānam pi brahmānam pi sabbesam pi
translated: like “teacher of gods and men.” But the Blessed One is the teacher of gods, men, and Brahmas, of all beings.

original: sattānaṃ pavaroyeva, bhagavato ca carimabhave manussesu uppannatāya vuttaṃ “manujesū”ti.🔽Tenevāha “sakyamunī”ti. Sakyakulappasutatāya sakyo, kāyamoneyyādīhi samannāgatato
analyzed: sattānam bhagavato ca carima bhave manussesu uppanna tāya vuttam manujesu iti  tena iva āha sakya muni iti sakya kula ppasuta tāya
translated: and because he was born among human beings in his last existence, he is called “the chief of men.”

original: anavasesassa ca ñeyyassa munanato muni cāti sakyamuni. Bhāgyavantatādīhi catūhi kāraṇehi
analyzed: anavasesassa ca ñeyyassa ca ati sakya muni bhāgyavanta tā ādīhi catūhi kāraṇehi
translated: Hence he is called “the sage of the Sakyans.” He is a sage because he is a muni, that is, because he has attained the state of a muni by being endowed with the qualities of body, speech, and mind that are worthy of worship, and because he has attained the state of a muni by being endowed with the four kinds of perfect knowledge.🔽He is a Sakyan because he was born into the Sakyan clan. He is the Blessed One because he is endowed with the four kinds of blessings,

original: bhagavā. Catūhi maggehi kātabbassa pariññādipabhedassa soḷasavidhassa kiccassa katattā
analyzed: bhagavā catūhi maggehi kātabbassa pariññā ādi pabhedassa soḷasavidhassa kiccassa kata ttā
translated: and because he is the one who has done what was to be done by means of the four paths, which are of sixteen kinds, distinguished as full understanding, etc.,

original: nipphāditattā katakicco. Pāraṃ sakkāyassa paratīraṃ nibbānaṃ gato sayambhuñāṇena🔽adhigatoti pāragato. Asadisena kāyabalena, anaññasādhāraṇena ñāṇabalena, catubbidhasammappadhānavīriyena
analyzed: nipphādita ttā kata kicco pāram sakkāyassa para tīram nibbānam gataḥ sayambhu ñāṇena  adhigataḥ ti pāra gataḥ asadisena kāya balena anañña sādhāraṇena ñāṇa balena catubbidha sammappadhāna vīriyena
translated: and because he has reached the other shore, that is, Nibbāna, by means of his own knowledge.🔽He is endowed with strength and energy because he is endowed with the strength of body, which is unequalled by anyone else’s, with the strength of knowledge, which is not shared by others, and with the energy of the four right strivings.

original: ca samannāgatattā balavīriyasamaṅgī. Sobhanagamanattā, sundaraṃ ṭhānaṃ gatattā, sammā
analyzed: ca samannāgata ttā bala vīriya samaṅgī sobhana gamana ttā sundaram ṭhānam gata ttā sammā
translated: He is the one who has gone well because he has gone in a lovely way, because he has gone to a lovely place,

original: gatattā, sammā ca gaditattā sugato. Taṃ sugataṃ sammāsambuddhaṃ saraṇatthaṃ saraṇāya🔽parāyaṇāya apāyadukkhavaṭṭadukkhaparittāṇāya upehi upagaccha, ajja paṭṭhāya ahitanivattanena
analyzed: gata ttā sammā ca gadita ttā sugataḥ tam sugatam sammāsambuddham saraṇa attham saraṇāya  parāyaṇāya apāya dukkha vaṭṭa dukkha parittāṇāya upehi upagaccha ajja paṭṭhāya ahita nivattanena
translated: He is “well-gone” because he has gone to the far shore of the ocean of excellences, and because he has gone well by means of the four kinds of perfect knowledge.🔽Go to that Well-Gone One, the Fully Enlightened One, for refuge, for the sake of refuge, for the sake of protection, for the sake of shelter, for the sake of safety, for the sake of emancipation, for the sake of release from the suffering of the states of loss, the suffering of the round, and the suffering of the breakup of what is dear.

original: hitasaṃvaḍḍhanena “ayaṃ me bhagavā saraṇaṃ tāṇaṃ leṇaṃ parāyaṇaṃ gati paṭisaraṇa”nti
analyzed: hita saṃvaḍḍhanena ayam me bhagavā saraṇam tāṇam leṇam parāyaṇam gati
translated: Go to him, approach him, from today onward by turning away from what is unbeneficial and by increasing what is beneficial, thinking: “This Blessed One is my refuge, my support, my place of safety, my final relief, my progress to the goal, my support.”

original: bhaja seva, evaṃ jānāhi vā bujjhassūti attho.
analyzed: bhaja seva evam jānāhi vā bujjhassu iti attho
translated: Serve, attend upon, and honor him. Know this to be the meaning.

original: 887. Rāgavirāganti ariyamaggamāha. Tena hi ariyā anādikālabhāvitampi rāgaṃ virajjenti.🔽Anejamasokanti ariyaphalaṃ. Tañhi ejāsaṅkhātāya taṇhāya avasiṭṭhānañca sokanimittānaṃ
analyzed: rāga virāgam ti ariya maggam āha tena hi ariyāḥ anādi kāla bhāvitam pi rāgam virajjenti  ariya phalam tat hi ejā saṅkhātāya taṇhāya soka nimittānam
translated: The noble path is called “the fading away of lust.” For by means of it the noble ones cause lust, which has been present since beginningless time, to fade away.

original: kilesānaṃ sabbaso paṭippassambhanato “anejaṃ asoka”nti ca vuccati. Dhammanti sabhāvadhammaṃ.
analyzed: kilesānam sabbaso paṭippassambhanato anejam asokam ti ca vuccati dhammam ti sabhāva dhammam
translated: The noble fruition is called “the state without suffering and grief.” For it is said that it is “without suffering” because it is the complete subsiding of the defilements that remain after the fading away of the craving called “suffering,” and that it is “without grief” because it is the complete subsiding of the defilements that remain after the fading away of the grief called “the cause for suffering.”🔽The Dhamma is the natural state .

original: Sabhāvato gahetabbadhammo hesa yadidaṃ maggaphalanibbānāni, na pariyattidhammo viya
analyzed: sabhāvataḥ gahetabba dhammaḥ ha isa yat idam magga phala nibbānāni na pariyatti dhammaḥ viya
translated: For this is the natural state that should be grasped, namely, the path, the fruition, and Nibbāna, and not the doctrinal teaching, which is the natural state that should be taught.

original: paññattidhammavasena. Dhammanti vā paramatthadhammaṃ, nibbānanti attho. Samecca sambhuyya
analyzed: paññatti dhamma vasena dhammanti vā paramattha dhammam nibbānanti attho samet ca sambhuyya
translated: and by way of the ideas of the description. Or else “idea” is ultimate-reality idea, the meaning being “extinction.”🔽“Having met” means having come together.

original: paccayehi kataṃ saṅkhataṃ, na saṅkhatanti asaṅkhataṃ. Tadeva nibbānaṃ. Natthi ettha
analyzed: paccayehi katam saṅkhatam na saṅkhatanti asaṅkhatam tat eva nibbānam na atthi ettha
translated: “Conditioned” is what is made by conditions; “unconditioned” is not that. That itself is extinction.

original: kiñcipi paṭikūlanti appaṭikūlaṃ. Savanavelāyaṃ upaparikkhaṇavelāyaṃ paṭipajjanavelāyanti
analyzed: kiñcipi paṭikūlanti a paṭikūlam savana velāyam upaparikkhaṇa velāyam paṭipajjana velāyanti
translated: “Nothing disagreeable” is what is not disagreeable. “Sweet” is what is always desirable at the time of hearing, at the time of investigating, and at the time of practice.

original: sabbadāpi iṭṭhamevāti madhuraṃ. Sabbaññutaññāṇasannissayāya paṭibhānasampadāya pavattitattā🔽suppavattibhāvato nipuṇabhāvato ca paguṇaṃ. Vibhajitabbassa atthassa khandhādivasena
analyzed: sabbadā api iṭṭham eva ati madhuram sabbaññu taññāṇa sannissayāya paṭibhāna sampadāya pavatti tattā  su pavatti bhāvataḥ nipuṇa bhāvataḥ ca paguṇam vibhajitabbassa atthassa khandha ādi vasena
translated: It is “well-spoken” because it occurs by means of the excellence of ready speech, which is based on the knowledge of omniscience, and because of its subtlety.🔽It is “well-analyzed” because of the good analysis of the meaning to be analyzed by way of the categories such as the aggregates, etc.,🔽by way of the wholesome, etc., and by way of the summary, etc. He speaks of only the ideas of the scriptures

original: kusalādivasena uddesādivasena ca suṭṭhu vibhajanato suvibhattaṃ. Tīhipi padehi pariyattidhammameva
analyzed: kusala ādi vasena uddesa ādi vasena ca suṭṭhu vibhajanato su vibhattam tīhi pi padehi pariyatti dhammam eva
translated: by means of all three terms. For just as at the time of the passage of the text, so also at the time of the investigation,

original: vadati. Teneva hissa āpāthakāle viya vimaddanakālepi kathentassa viya suṇantassāpi
analyzed: vadati tena iva hi ssa āpātha kāle viya vimaddana kāle pi kathentassa viya suṇantassa api
translated: he who speaks and he who listens

original: sammukhībhāvato ubhatopaccakkhatāya dassanatthaṃ “ima”nti vuttaṃ. Dhammanti yathāvapaṭipajjante
analyzed: sammukhībhāvataḥ ubhatas paccakkha tāya dassana attham iman ti vuttam dhamman ti yathā avapaṭipajjante
translated: “This” is said for the purpose of showing by direct experience the Dhamma that is to be relied upon as the refuge, since it is the means for attaining the supramundane state.

original: apāyadukkhapātato dhāraṇatthena dhammaṃ, idaṃ catubbidhassāpi dhammassa sādhāraṇavacanaṃ.🔽Pariyattidhammopi hi saraṇesu ca sīlesu ca patiṭṭhānamattāyapi yathāvapaṭipattiyā
analyzed: apāya dukkha pātataḥ dhāraṇa atthena dhammam idam catubbidhassa api dhammassa sādhāraṇa vacanam  pariyatti dhammaḥ api hi saraṇesu ca sīlesu ca yathā avapaṭipattiyā
translated: “Dhamma” is the Dhamma that protects from falling into the suffering of the states of loss by virtue of its being the means for attaining the supramundane state. This is a general description of the fourfold Dhamma.

original: apāyadukkhapātato dhāreti eva. Imassa ca atthassa idameva vimānaṃ sādhakanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: apāya dukkha pātataḥ dhāreti eva imassa ca atthassa idam eva vimānam sādhakanti daṭṭhabbam
translated: For the Dhamma as the scriptures also protects from falling into the suffering of the states of loss by virtue of being the means for attaining the supramundane state, even though it is only the foundation for the practice of virtue and the refuges.🔽And this meaning should be regarded as illustrated by the following story.

original: Sādhāraṇabhāvena yathāvuttadhammassa paccakkhaṃ katvā dassento puna “ima”nti āha.
analyzed: sādhāraṇa bhāvena yathā vutta dhammassa paccakkham katvā dassentaḥ puna iman ti āha
translated: Having shown by direct experience the Dhamma as described above in its general sense, he said “this” again.🔽“Where”: in the Noble Sangha. “Given”: given, dedicated, the gift of food, etc.

original: 888. Yatthāti yasmiṃ ariyasaṅghe. Dinnanti pariccattaṃ annādideyyadhammaṃ. Dinna
analyzed: yattha ati yasmin ariya saṅghe pariccattam anna ādideyya dhammam
translated: “Given” is a past passive participle formed by adding the suffix -ta to the root dā with the augment -i-.🔽“Is of great fruit”: the nasal sound is elided for the sake of euphony.

original: mahapphalanti gāthāsukhatthaṃ anunāsikalopo kato. Accantameva kilesāsucito visujjhanena
analyzed: gāthā sukha attham anunāsika lopaḥ kataḥ accantam eva kilesa asucitaḥ visujjhanena
translated: “The pure”: the pure in the sense of being purified from the defilements that are impure.

original: sucīsu “sotāpanno sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno”tiādinā vuttesu catūsu purisayugesu.
analyzed: sucīsu sotāpanno sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannaḥ iti ādinā vuttesu catūsu purisa yugesu
translated: “The four pairs of persons, the eight individual persons”: the four pairs of persons and the eight individual persons described as “one who is in training, one who is on the way to realization of the fruit of stream-entry” , etc.

original: Aṭṭhāti maggaṭṭhaphalaṭṭhesu yugaḷe akatvā visuṃ visuṃ gahaṇena aṭṭha puggalā. Gāthāsukhatthameva
analyzed: aṭṭhā ti magga ṭṭha phala ṭṭhesu yugaḷe a katvā visum visum gahaṇena aṭṭha puggalāḥ gāthā sukha attham eva
translated: “Eight” : eight persons, by taking them separately, not by pairs, in the case of those who are on the path and those who are in fruition.🔽Here the description is made short for the sake of the metre,

original: cettha “puggala dhammadasā”ti rassaṃ katvā niddeso. Dhammadasāti catusaccadhammassa
analyzed: ca ittha puggala dhamma dasā ti rassam katvā niddesaḥ dhamma dasā ti catusacca dhammassa
translated: “Dhamma-seers” : those who see by direct experience the Dhamma of the Four Noble Truths🔽and the Dhamma of Nibbāna.

original: nibbānadhammassa ca paccakkhato dassanakā. Diṭṭhisīlasāmaññena saṃhatabhāvena saṅghaṃ.
analyzed: nibbāna dhammassa ca paccakkhataḥ dassanakāḥ diṭṭhi sīla sāmaññena saṃhata bhāvena saṅghaṃ
translated: The Sangha is a unity in the sense of a community of those who share the same view and morality.

original: Evaṃ bhagavatā tīhi gāthāhi saraṇaguṇasandassanena saddhiṃ saraṇagamanavidhimhi vutte
analyzed: evam bhagavatā tīhi gāthāhi saraṇa guṇa sandassanena saddhim saraṇa gamana vidhimhi vutte
translated: When the Blessed One had thus spoken, in three stanzas, showing the benefits of going for refuge together with the procedure for going for refuge,

original: māṇavo taṃtaṃsaraṇaguṇānussaraṇamukhena saraṇagamanavidhino attano hadaye ṭhapitabhāvaṃ
analyzed: māṇavaḥ hadaye ṭhapita bhāvam
translated: the student, by way of recollecting the special qualities of each of the refuges, showed how he had established in his heart the procedure for going for refuge.

original: vibhāvento tassā tassā gāthāya anantaraṃ “yo vadataṃ pavaro”tiādinā taṃ taṃ gāthaṃ
analyzed: vibhāvento tassā tassā gāthāya anantaram yaḥ tam tam gātham
translated: After each stanza he recited the stanza beginning, “Yo vadatam pavaro,”

original: paccanubhāsi. Evaṃ paccanubhāsitvā ṭhitassa pañca sikkhāpadāni sarūpato phalānisaṃsato
analyzed: evam paccanubhāsitvā ṭhitassa pañca sikkhāpadāni sarūpataḥ phala anisaṃsato
translated: and after he had thus recited the stanzas, he showed the five precepts in their nature and their benefits,

original: ca vibhāvetvā tesaṃ samādānavidhiṃ kathesi. So tampi suṭṭhu upadhāretvā pasannamānaso
analyzed: ca vibhāvetvā tesam samādāna vidhim kathesi saḥ tam pi suṭṭhu upadhāretvā pasanna mānasaḥ
translated: and he explained the procedure for undertaking them. The student, having understood them well, with a serene mind,

original: “handāhaṃ bhagavā gamissāmī”ti vatvā ratanattayaguṇaṃ anussaranto taṃyeva maggaṃ
analyzed: handa aham bhagavā gamissāmi iti vatvā anussarantaḥ taṃyeva maggaṃ
translated: “Well then, I will go to the Blessed One.” And recollecting the special qualities of the Three Jewels, he set out on the same road.

original: paṭipajji. Bhagavāpi “alaṃ imassa ettakaṃ kusalaṃ devalokūpapattiyā”ti jetavanameva agamāsi.
analyzed: paṭipajji bhagavā api alam imassa ettakam kusalam deva loka upapattiyā ati jetavanam eva agamāsi
translated: The Blessed One, however, thought, “That is enough merit for him to be reborn in the heavenly world,” and so he returned to Jetavana.

original: Māṇavassa pana pasannacittassa ratanattayaguṇaṃ sallakkhaṇavasena “saraṇaṃ upemī”ti
analyzed: māṇavassa pana pasanna cittassa ratanattaya guṇam sat lakkhaṇa vasena saraṇam upemi iti
translated: But the young brahmin, his mind full of faith, was recollecting the special qualities of the Three Jewels in the way of defining them, and the thought occurred to him, “I take refuge in the Buddha, I take refuge in the Dhamma, I take refuge in the Sangha.”🔽And by the arising of this thought, he was established in the refuges.

original: pavattacittuppādatāya saraṇesu ca, bhagavatā vuttanayena pañcannaṃ sīlānaṃ adhiṭṭhānena🔽sīlesu ca patiṭṭhitassa teneva nayena ratanattayaguṇe anussarantasseva gacchantassa
analyzed: pavatta cittuppāda tāya saraṇesu ca bhagavatā vutta nayena pañcannam sīlānam adhiṭṭhānena  sīlesu ca patiṭṭhitassa tena iva nayena rata nattaya guṇe anussarantassa iva gacchantassa
translated: Then, in the way described by the Blessed One, he resolved upon the five precepts and was established in the precepts.🔽And as he was going along, recollecting the special qualities of the Three Jewels in the same way,

original: corā magge pariyuṭṭhiṃsu. So te agaṇetvā ratanattayaguṇe anussarantoyeva gacchati.🔽Tañceko coro gumbantaraṃ upanissāya ṭhito visapītena sarena sahasāva vijjhitvā jīvitakkhayaṃ
analyzed: corāḥ magge pariyuṭṭhiṃsu saḥ te a gaṇetvā gacchati  tat ca ikaḥ coraḥ gumba antaram upanissāya ṭhitaḥ visa pītena sarena sahasā ava vijjhitvā jīvita kkhayam
translated: some thieves surrounded the road. He did not take any notice of them but continued recollecting the special qualities of the Three Jewels.🔽One of the thieves, standing behind a tree, suddenly shot him with a poisoned arrow and killed him.

original: pāpetvā kahāpaṇabhaṇḍikaṃ gahetvā attano sahāyehi saddhiṃ pakkāmi. Māṇavo pana kālaṃ
analyzed: pāpetvā kahā paṇabhaṇḍikam gahetvā attano sahāyehi saddhim pakkāmi māṇavaḥ pana kālam
translated: Then he took the young brahmin’s money-pouch and left with his companions.

original: katvā tāvatiṃsabhavane tiṃsayojanike kanakavimāne suttappabuddho viya accharāsahassaparivuto🔽saṭṭhisakaṭabhārālaṅkārapaṭimaṇḍitattabhāvo nibbatti, tassa vimānassa ābhā sātirekāni
analyzed: katvā tāvatiṃsa bhavane tiṃsa yojanike kanaka vimāne suttappabuddhaḥ viya accharā sahassa parivutaḥ  saṭṭhi sakaṭa bhāra alaṅkāra paṭimaṇḍita tta bhāvaḥ nibbatti tassa vimānassa ābhā sa atirekāni
translated: and he was reborn in the Thirty-three with a retinue of a thousand celestial nymphs in a golden palace thirty leagues in extent in the World of the Thirty-three,

original: vīsatiyojanāni pharitvā tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: vīsati yojanāni pharitvā tiṭṭhati
translated: and his body was adorned with the thirty-two marks of a Great Man, and his radiance extended over more than twenty leagues.

original: Atha māṇavaṃ kālakataṃ disvā setabyagāmavāsino manussā setabyaṃ gantvā tassa mātāpitūnaṃ
analyzed: atha māṇavam kālakatam disvā setabya gāma vāsinaḥ manussā setabyam gantvā tassa mātā pitūnam
translated: Then, seeing that the young brāhman had died, the people of Setavyā went to Setavyā and told his parents

original: ukkaṭṭhagāmavāsino ca ukkaṭṭhaṃ gantvā brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa kathesuṃ. Taṃ
analyzed: ukkaṭṭha gāma vāsino ca ukkaṭṭham gantvā brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa kathesuṃ tam
translated: and the people of Ukkaṭṭhā went to Ukkaṭṭhā and told the brāhman Pokkharasāti.

original: sutvā tassa mātāpitaro ñātimittā brāhmaṇo ca pokkharasāti saparivārā assumukhā rodamānā🔽taṃ padesaṃ agamaṃsu, yebhuyyena setabyavāsino ca ukkaṭṭhavāsino ca icchānaṅgalavāsino
analyzed: sutvā tassa mātā pitaraḥ ñāti mittāḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ca pokkharasāti sa parivārā assu mukhā rodamānā  tam padesam agamaṃsu yebhuyyena setabya vāsino ca ukkaṭṭha vāsino ca icchā anaṅgala vāsino
translated: Hearing this, the young brāhman’s parents, his kinsmen and friends, and the brāhman Pokkharasāti with his retinue, with tearful faces and weeping,

original: ca sannipatiṃsu, mahāsamāgamo ahosi. Atha māṇavassa mātāpitaro maggassa avidūre citakaṃ
analyzed: ca sannipatiṃsu mahā samāgamaḥ ahosi atha māṇavassa mātā pitaraḥ maggassa avidūre citakam
translated: came to that place, and most of the people of Setavyā, Ukkaṭṭhā and Icchānaṅgala assembled there, and there was a great concourse. Then the young brāhman’s parents, not far from the road,

original: sajjetvā sarīrakiccaṃ kātuṃ ārabhiṃsu.
analyzed: sajjetvā sarīra kiccam kātum ārabhiṃsu
translated: had a funeral pyre prepared and set about performing the funeral rites.

original: Atha bhagavā cintesi “mayi gate chattamāṇavo maṃ vandituṃ āgamissati, āgatañca taṃ
analyzed: atha bhagavā cintesi mayi gate chatta māṇavaḥ mam vanditum āgamissati āgatam ca tam
translated: Then the Exalted One thought, “When I go there, the deva Chatta will come to worship me.

original: katakammaṃ kathāpento kammaphalaṃ paccakkhaṃ kāretvā dhammaṃ desessāmi, evaṃ mahājanassa
analyzed: kata kammam kathāpentaḥ kamma phalam paccakkham kāretvā dhammaṃ desessāmi evam mahājanassa
translated: When he has come, I will question him about his deeds and will make the fruit of his deeds manifest to him, and then I will preach the Law. Thus there will be a great multitude

original: dhammābhisamayo bhavissatī”ti cintetvā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ taṃ padesaṃ
analyzed: dhamma abhisamayaḥ bhavissati iti cintetvā mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim tam padesam
translated: to whom the Law will be manifest.” So thinking, he went to that place with a great company of monks,
