translated: “See the result of the practice of the Dhamma for a moment, for a short time,

original: Jalamiva yasasā samekkhamānā, bahukāmaṃ pihayanti hīnakammā.
analyzed: jalam iva yasasā samekkhamānāḥ bahu kāmam pihayanti hīna kammā
translated: As if burning with fame, many desire the one of little merit.

original: “Passa katipayāya desanāya, sugatiñcamhi gato sukhañca patto;
analyzed: passa katipayāya desanāya sugatim camhi gato sukham ca patto
translated: “See, by the teaching of a few words, I have gone to a good destination and attained happiness;

original: Ye ca te satataṃ suṇanti dhammaṃ, maññe te amataṃ phusanti khemaṃ.
analyzed: ye ca te satatam suṇanti dhammam maññe te amatam phusanti khemam
translated: And those who always listen to the Dhamma, I think they touch the deathless, the secure.

original: “Appampi kataṃ mahāvipākaṃ, vipulaṃ hoti tathāgatassa dhamme;
analyzed: appam pi katam mahā vipākam vipulam hoti tathāgatassa dhamme
translated: “Even a little done has great results, in the Dhamma of the Realised One it becomes vast;

original: Passa katapuññatāya chatto, obhāseti pathaviṃ yathāpi sūriyo.
analyzed: passa kata puñña tāya chattaḥ obhāseti pathavim yathā api sūriyaḥ
translated: See, by the deed of merit the parasol, shines on the earth like the sun.

original: “Kimidaṃ kusalaṃ kimācarema, icceke hi samecca mantayanti;
analyzed: kim idam kusalam kim ācarema iti eke hi samet ca mantayanti
translated: “What is this wholesome? What should we do? Thus some, having come together, consult;

original: Te mayaṃ punareva laddha mānusattaṃ, paṭipannā viharemu sīlavanto.
analyzed: te mayam punar eva mānusattam paṭipannāḥ viharemu sīlavantaḥ
translated: We, having obtained the human state again, will practice and live with virtue.

original: “Bahukāro anukampako ca satthā, iti me sati agamā divā divassa;
analyzed: bahu kāraḥ anukampako ca satthā iti me satī agamā divā divassa
translated: “The Teacher is helpful and compassionate, thus my mindfulness has come day by day;

original: Svāhaṃ upagatomhi saccanāmaṃ, anukampassu punapi suṇemha dhammaṃ.
analyzed: svāham upagataḥ asmi sacca nāmam anukampassu puna api suṇemha dhammaṃ
translated: I have come to you, one whose name is true, have compassion and let me hear the Dhamma again.

original: “Ye cidha pajahanti kāmarāgaṃ, bhavarāgānusayañca pahāya mohaṃ;
analyzed: ye cidha pajahanti kāma rāgam bhava rāga anusayam ca pahāya moham
translated: “Those who here give up passion for sensual pleasures, and having given up the underlying tendency to passion for existence and delusion,

original: Na ca te puna mupenti gabbhaseyyaṃ, parinibbānagatā hi sītibhūtā”ti.🔽895. Tattha sayamidha pathe samecca māṇavenāti idha imasmiṃ pathe mahāmagge sayameva
analyzed: na ca te puna mupenti gabbhaseyyam parinibbāna gatāḥ hi sīti bhūtā ati  tattha sayam idha pathe māṇavena ati idha imasmin pathe mahā magge sayam eva
translated: Do not enter a womb again, for they have attained Nibbāna and are cooled.”🔽Here, having met the young brahmin who had come of his own accord on this path,

original: upagatena māṇavena brāhmaṇakumārena samecca samāgantvā. Diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikaparamatthehi
analyzed: upagatena māṇavena brāhmaṇa kumārena samet ca samāgantvā diṭṭhadhammika samparāyika paramatthehi
translated: having met, having come together, with the young brahmin, the brahmin youth, on this path, on this highway,

original: sattānaṃ yathārahamanusāsanato satthā bhagavā, tvaṃ yaṃ māṇavaṃ yathādhammaṃ anusāsi🔽anukampamāno anuggaṇhanto, tava ratanavarassa aggaratanassa sammāsambuddhassa, taṃ
analyzed: sattānam yathāraham anusāsanataḥ satthā bhagavā tvam yam māṇavam yathādhammam anusāsi  anukampamānaḥ anuggaṇhantaḥ tava ratana varassa aggaratanassa sammāsambuddhassa tam
translated: the Teacher, the Blessed One, who teaches beings as they deserve to be taught with regard to the highest good in this very life and in the next,🔽you, young brahmin, whom you instructed in accordance with the Dhamma,🔽having compassion, having helped, I, having heard that Dhamma of yours, the supreme jewel of the excellent jewel of the Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: dhammaṃ sutvā iti evaṃ karissāmi yathānusiṭṭhaṃ paṭipajjissāmīti, so chatto chattanāmako
analyzed: dhammam sutvā iti evam karissāmi yathānusiṭṭham paṭipajjissāmi iti saḥ chattaḥ chatta nāmako
translated: will do thus, I will practice as instructed. The young brahmin named Chatta

original: māṇavo bravittha kathesīti padayojanā.
analyzed: māṇavaḥ bravittha kathesi iti pada yojanā
translated: spoke, he said, is the construction of the words.

original: 896. Evaṃ yathāpucchitaṃ kammaṃ kāraṇato dassetvā idāni taṃ sarūpato vibhāgato ca🔽dassento satthārā samādapitabhāvaṃ attanā ca tattha pacchā patiṭṭhitabhāvaṃ dassetuṃ
analyzed: evam yathā pucchitam kammam kāraṇataḥ dassetvā idāni tam sarūpataḥ vibhāgato ca  dassento satthārā samādapita bhāvam attanā ca tattha pacchā patiṭṭhita bhāvam dassetuṃ
translated: Having thus shown the deed as asked about by way of its cause, the Master now showed it by way of its nature and its analysis.🔽And in order to show the state of being admonished by the Master and his own subsequent establishment in it, he said:

original: “jinavarapavara”ntiādimāha. Tattha noti paṭhamaṃ avocahaṃ bhanteti bhante bhagavā
analyzed: jinavara pavara nti ādim āha tattha no ti paṭhamam avoca ham bhante iti bhante bhagavā
translated: “I said to him at first, ‘O Blessed One.’

original: “saraṇagamanaṃ jānāsī”ti tayā vutto “no”ti na “jānāmī”ti paṭhamaṃ avocaṃ ahaṃ. Pacchā
analyzed: saraṇa gamanam jānāsi iti tayā vuttaḥ no ti na jānāmi iti paṭhamam avocam aham pacchā
translated: “‘Do you know the going for refuge?’ you asked. I said to him at first, ‘No, I do not know.’

original: te vacanaṃ tathevakāsinti pacchā tayā vuttaṃ kathaṃ parivattento tava vacanaṃ tatheva
analyzed: te vacanam pacchā tayā vuttam katham tava vacanam tathā iva
translated: Subsequently I acted in accordance with your words.

original: akāsiṃ paṭipajjiṃ, tīṇipi saraṇāni upagacchinti attho.
analyzed: akāsim paṭipajjim tīṇi pi saraṇāni upagacchinti
translated: I went for refuge to the Three .

original: 897. Vividhanti uccāvacaṃ, appasāvajjaṃ mahāsāvajjañcāti attho. Mā carassūti mā akāsi.
analyzed: vividhanti uccāvacam appasāvajjam mahāsāvajjam ca ati attho mā carassu uti mā akāsi
translated: ‘Various’ means high and low, that is, of little blame and of much blame. ‘Do not act’ means do not do.

original: Asucinti kilesāsucimissatāya na suciṃ. Pāṇesu asaññatanti pāṇaghātato avirataṃ. Na
analyzed: asucim ti kilesa asuci missatāya na sucim pāṇesu asaññatam ti pāṇa ghātataḥ aviratam na
translated: ‘Impure’ means not pure because of being mixed with the impurity of defilements. ‘Not restrained in regard to living beings’ means not refraining from killing living beings.

original: hi avaṇṇayiṃsūti na hi vaṇṇayanti. Paccūppannakālatthe hi idaṃ atītakālavacanaṃ.🔽Atha vā “avaṇṇayiṃsū”ti ekadesena sakalassa kālassa upalakkhaṇaṃ, tasmā yathā na
analyzed: hi na hi vaṇṇayanti paccūppanna kāla tthe hi idam atīta kāla vacanam  atha vā avaṇṇayiṃsu iti eka desena sakalassa kālassa upalakkhaṇam tasmai yathā na
translated: ‘They did not praise’: they did not extol. For this is a statement in the past tense with reference to the present.

original: vaṇṇayiṃsu atītamaddhānaṃ, evaṃ etarahipi na vaṇṇayanti, anāgatepi na vaṇṇayissantīti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: vaṇṇayiṃsu evam etarahi api na vaṇṇayanti anāgate api na vaṇṇayissanti iti vuttam hoti
translated: Or else, ‘they did not praise’ is a specification of the whole time by part, thus it is said that just as they did not praise in the past, so they do not praise now, and they will not praise in the future.

original: 898-900. Parajanassa rakkhitanti parapariggahitavatthu. Tenāha “adinna”nti. Mā agamāti🔽mā ajjhācari. Vitathanti atathaṃ, musāti attho. Aññathāti aññathāva, vitathasaññī
analyzed: para janassa rakkhitanti para pariggahita vatthu tena āha a dinna nti mā agama ti  mā ajjhācari vitathanti atatham musā ati attho aññathā ati aññathāva vitatha saññī
translated: ‘Another’s guarded property’: property belonging to another. Hence it is said, ‘not taken’ . ‘Do not go’ means ‘do not commit adultery.’

original: evaṃ vitathanti jānanto evaṃ mā bhaṇīti attho.
analyzed: evam vitathanti jānantaḥ evam mā bhaṇi iti attho
translated: ‘Falsely’: untruthfully, deceptively, is the meaning. ‘Otherwise’: in a different way. ‘With consciousness distorted’ means knowing thus, ‘This is distorted,’ ‘Do not speak thus’ is the meaning.

original: 901. Yenāti yena majjena, pītenāti adhippāyo. Apetīti vigacchati. Saññāti dhammasaññā, lokasaññā eva vā. Sabbanti anavasesaṃ, bījato paṭṭhāyāti attho.
analyzed: yena ati yena majjena pītena ati adhippāyaḥ apeti iti vigacchati saññā ati dhamma saññā loka saññā eva vā sabbam ti anavasesam bījataḥ paṭṭhāya ati attho
translated: ‘By which’: by which liquor, the meaning is, ‘having drunk.’ ‘One departs’ means one goes away. ‘Perception’ is perception of states or perception of the world. ‘All’ means without exception; the meaning is, ‘from the seed onwards.’

original: 902. Svāhanti so tadā chattamāṇavabhūto ahaṃ. Idha imasmiṃ maggapadese, imasmiṃ vā🔽tava sāsane. Tenāha “tathāgatassa dhamme”ti. Pañca sikkhāti pañca sīlāni. Karitvāti
analyzed: svāhanti saḥ tadā chatta māṇava bhūtaḥ aham idha imasmin magga padese imasmin vā  tava sāsane tena āha tathāgatassa dhamme iti pañca sikkhā ati pañca sīlāni karitvā iti
translated: I, the youth Sāgata, then, here in this place on the path, or in your Dispensation,

original: ādiyitvā, adhiṭṭhāyāti attho. Dvepathanti dvinnaṃ gāmasīmānaṃ vemajjhabhūtaṃ pathaṃ,
analyzed: ādiyitvā adhiṭṭhāya ati atthaḥ dvepathanti dvinnam gāma sīmānam vemajjha bhūtam patham
translated: therefore said “in the Tathāgata’s Dispensation.” Five trainings: the five precepts. Having made: having taken up, having undertaken, is the meaning. Two-path: a path that is the middle between the boundaries of two villages,

original: sīmantarikapathanti attho. Teti te corā. Tatthāti sīmantarikamagge. Bhogahetūti āmisakiñcikkhanimittaṃ.
analyzed: sīmantarika pathanti te iti te corā tattha ati sīmantarika magge bhoga hetū ti āmisa kiñcikkha nimittam
translated: the meaning is a path between two boundaries. They: those thieves. There: on the path between the boundaries. For the sake of wealth: for the sake of some material gain.

original: 903. Tatoti yathāvuttakusalato paraṃ upari aññaṃ kusalaṃ na vijjati na upalabbhati, yamahaṃ anussareyyanti attho. Kāmakāmīti yathicchitakāmaguṇasamaṅgī.🔽904. Khaṇamuhuttasaññamassāti khaṇamuhuttamattaṃ pavattasīlassa. Anudhammappaṭipattiyāti
analyzed: tatas ti yathā vutta kusalataḥ param upari aññam kusalam na vijjati na upalabbhati yam aham anussareyyan ti attho kāma kāmī iti yathicchita kāma guṇa samaṅgī  khaṇa muhutta saññamassa ati khaṇa muhutta mattam pavatta sīlassa anudhamma ppaṭipattiyā ati
translated: Beyond that: after the aforesaid profitable there is no other profitable to be found, no other profitable that I can recollect, is the meaning. One who desires sensual desires: one who possesses the qualities of sensual desires as desired.

original: yathādhigatassa phalassa anurūpadhammaṃ paṭipajjamānassa bhagavā passa, tuyhaṃ ovādadhammassa
analyzed: yathā adhigatassa phalassa anurūpa dhammam paṭipajjamānassa bhagavā passa tuyham ovāda dhammassa
translated: The perception of a moment or a second: of virtue that lasts only a moment or a second. Practising in conformity with the Dhamma: see that the Blessed One, who is practising the Dhamma in conformity with the fruit he has attained,

original: vā anurūpāya dhammapaṭipattiyā vuttaniyāmeneva saraṇagamanassa sīlasamādānassa cāti
analyzed: vā anurūpāya dhamma paṭipattiyā vutta niyāmena iva saraṇa gamanassa sīla samādānassa ca ati
translated: and the practice of the Dhamma in accordance with the way of practice stated in the going for refuge and the undertaking of the precepts.🔽The meaning is: “just as the water of the great ocean is one taste, so too is the Dhamma of the great Buddha one taste.”

original: attho. Jalamiva yasasāti iddhiyā parivārasampattiyā ca jalantaṃ viya. Samekkhamānāti
analyzed: atthaḥ jalam iva yasasā ati iddhiyā parivāra sampattiyā ca jalantam viya samekkhamānā ati
translated: Shining like the sun: shining like the sun with the splendor of his psychic power and the excellence of his retinue.🔽Looking on:

original: passantā. Bahukāti bahavo. Pihayantīti “kathaṃ nu kho mayaṃ edisā bhaveyyāmā”ti patthenti.
analyzed: passantā bahukā ati bahavaḥ pihayanti iti katham nu kho mayam edisāḥ bhaveyyāma ati patthenti
translated: seeing. Many: many people. Long for: they desire, thinking, “How may we become like this?”

original: Hīnakammāti mama sampattito nihīnabhogā.
analyzed: hīna kammā ati mama sampattitaḥ nihīna bhogā
translated: Inferior deeds: inferior in wealth compared to my own excellence.

original: 905. Katipayāyāti appikāya. Yeti ye bhikkhū ceva upāsakādayo ca. Ca-saddo byatireke. Teti tava. Satatanti divase divase.
analyzed: katipayāya ati appikāya ye iti ye bhikkhū ca iva upāsaka ādayo ca casaddaḥ byatireke te iti tava divase divase
translated: A few: a small number. Those: those monks and lay followers. The word “and” is used in the sense of “also.” Your: your. Always: day after day.

original: 906. Vipulanti uḷāraphalaṃ vipulānubhāvaṃ. Tathāgatassa dhammeti tathāgatassa sāsane
analyzed: vipulanti uḷāra phalam vipula anubhāvam tathāgatassa dhamme iti tathāgatassa sāsane
translated: Extensive: having great fruit, extensive power. The Dhamma of the Tathāgata: the advice given in the Dispensation of the Tathāgata.

original: ovāde ṭhatvā katanti yojanā. Evaṃ anuddesikavasena vuttamevatthaṃ attuddesikavasena🔽dassento “passā”tiādimāha. Tattha passāti bhagavantaṃ vadati, attānameva vā aññaṃ
analyzed: ovāde yojanā evam anuddesika vasena vuttam evattham attuddesika vasena  dassentaḥ passa ati ādim āha tattha passa ati bhagavantam vadati attānam eva vā aññam
translated: The construction is: “having stood.” Thus having shown the meaning stated by way of the indirect method,🔽he shows the same meaning by way of the direct method, saying, “See.”

original: viya ca katvā vadati.
analyzed: viya ca katvā vadati
translated: There, “see” he says to the Blessed One, or he says as if referring to himself as another.

original: 907. Kimidaṃ kusalaṃ kimācaremāti kusalaṃ nāmetaṃ kiṃsabhāvaṃ kīdisaṃ, kathaṃ vā🔽taṃ ācareyyāma. Icceke hi samecca mantayantīti evameke samecca samāgantvā pathaviṃ🔽parivattentā viya sineruṃ ukkhipantā viya ca sudukkaraṃ katvā mantayanti vicārenti,
analyzed: kim idam kusalam kim ācarema ati kusalam nāma etam kiṃsabhāvam kīdisam katham vā  tam ācareyyāmaḥ id ca eke hi samet ca mantayanti iti evam eke samet ca samāgantvā pathavim  parivattentāḥ viya sinerum ukkhipantāḥ viya ca su dukkaram katvā mantayanti vicārenti
translated: What is this good? What should we do? — This good, what is its nature, what is it like, or how should we practice it? — Thus some, having met together, deliberate. — Thus some, having met together, having come together, as if turning the earth, as if lifting up Sineru, having done what is very difficult to do, deliberate, consider.

original: mayaṃ pana akiccheneva punapi kusalaṃ ācareyyāmāti adhippāyo. Tenevāha “maya”ntiādi.
analyzed: mayam pana a kicchena iva punapi kusalam ācareyyāma ati tena iva āha
translated: What is this good? What should we do? — This is good, but what is its nature, what is it like, or how should we practice it? — Thus some, after meeting together, consult, as it were, turning the earth over and lifting up Sineru, doing what is very difficult. But our intention is: We should practice good without difficulty. Therefore he said “maya” , etc.

original: 908. Bahukāroti bahūpakāro, mahāupakāro vā. Anukampakoti kāruṇiko. Ma-kāro padasandhikaro.🔽Itīti evaṃ, bhagavato attani paṭipannākāraṃ sandhāya vadati. Me satīti mayi sati
analyzed: bahu kāraḥ iti bahu upakāraḥ mahā upakāraḥ vā anukampakaḥ iti kāruṇikaḥ makāraḥ pada sandhi karaḥ  iti iti evam bhagavataḥ paṭipanna ākāram sandhāya vadati me sati iti mayi sati
translated: Helpful: helpful to many, or very helpful. Compassionate: merciful. The syllable “ma” is a word-connector.

original: vijjamāne, corehi avadhite evāti attho. Divā divassāti divasassapi divā, kālassevāti
analyzed: vijjamāne corehi avadhite eva ati atthaḥ divā divassā ati divasassa api divā kālassa eva ati
translated: Thus: in this way. He speaks with reference to the Blessed One’s way of practice in himself. In me: in me existing, not being struck down by thieves, is the meaning. Day by day: by day of the day. The meaning is: by time of day.

original: attho. Svāhanti so chattamāṇavabhūto ahaṃ. Saccanāmanti “bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho”tiādināmehi
analyzed: svāhā iti saḥ chattamāṇava bhūtaḥ aham bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ iti ādi nāmehi
translated: I: I, who was the youth Chatta. True name: with the names “The Blessed One is an arahat, a fully-enlightened Buddha” ,

original: avitathanāmaṃ bhūtatthanāmaṃ. Anukampassūti anuggaṇhāhi. Punapīti bhiyyopi suṇemu,
analyzed: avitatha nāmam bhūtattha nāmam anukampassu uti anuggaṇhāhi puna pi iti bhiyyas pi suṇemu
translated: the name of the place where the Buddha was staying. Anukampassūti anuggaṇhāhi. Punapīti bhiyyopi suṇemu,

original: tava dhammaṃ suṇeyyāmayevāti attho.
analyzed: tava dhammam suṇeyya amayā iva ati atthaḥ
translated: tava dhammaṃ suṇeyyāmayevāti attho.

original: Evaṃ devaputto sabbametaṃ kataññutābhāve ṭhatvā satthu payirupāsane ca dhammassavane
analyzed: evam devaputto sabbam etam kataññu tā bhāve ṭhatvā satthu payirupāsane ca dhammassavane
translated: Evaṃ devaputto sabbametaṃ kataññutābhāve ṭhatvā satthu payirupāsane ca dhammassavane

original: ca atittimeva dīpento vadati. Bhagavā devaputtassa ca tattha sannipatitaparisāya
analyzed: ca dīpentaḥ vadati bhagavā devaputtassa ca tattha sannipatita parisāya
translated: ca atittimeva dīpento vadati. Bhagavā devaputtassa ca tattha sannipatitaparisāya

original: ca ajjhāsayaṃ oloketvā anupubbikathaṃ kathesi. Atha nesaṃ allacittataṃ ñatvā sāmukkaṃsikaṃ
analyzed: ca ajjhāsayam oloketvā anupubbi katham kathesi atha na isam alla citta tam ñatvā sāmukkaṃsikam
translated: ca ajjhāsayaṃ oloketvā anupubbikathaṃ kathesi. Atha nesaṃ allacittataṃ ñatvā sāmukkaṃsikaṃ

original: dhammadesanaṃ pakāsesi. Desanāpariyosāne devaputto ceva mātāpitaro cassa sotāpattiphale
analyzed: dhamma desanam pakāsesi desanā pariyosāne deva putto ca iva mātā pitaro ca ssa sotāpatti phale
translated: dhammadesanaṃ pakāsesi. Desanāpariyosāne devaputto ceva mātāpitaro cassa sotāpattiphale

original: patiṭṭhahiṃsu, mahato ca janakāyassa dhammābhisamayo ahosi.
analyzed: patiṭṭhahiṃsu mahataḥ ca jana kāyassa dhamma abhisamayaḥ ahosi
translated: patiṭṭhahiṃsu, mahato ca janakāyassa dhammābhisamayo ahosi.

original: 909. Paṭhamaphale patiṭṭhito devaputto uparimaggesu attano garucittīkāraṃ, tadadhigamassa
analyzed: paṭhama phale patiṭṭhitaḥ devaputtaḥ upari maggesu attanaḥ garu cittīkāram tad adhigamassa
translated: . Paṭhamaphale patiṭṭhito devaputto uparimaggesu attano garucittīkāraṃ, tadadhigamassa

original: ca mahānisaṃsataṃ vibhāvento “ye cidha pajahanti kāmarāga”nti pariyosānagāthamāha.
analyzed: ca mahānisaṃsatam vibhāventaḥ ye cidha pajahanti pariyosāna gātham āha
translated: ca mahānisaṃsataṃ vibhāvento “ye cidha pajahanti kāmarāga”nti pariyosānagāthamāha.

original: Tassattho – ye idha imasmiṃ sāsane ṭhitā pajahanti anavasesato samucchindanti kāmarāgaṃ,
analyzed: tassa atthaḥ ye idha imasmin sāsane ṭhitā pajahanti anavasesataḥ samucchindanti kāma rāgam
translated: The meaning is this: those who, being established in this Dispensation, abandon sensual lust without remainder,

original: na ca te puna upenti gabbhaseyyaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ samucchinnattā. Ye🔽ca pana pahāya mohaṃ sabbaso samugghātetvā bhavarāgānusayañca pajahanti, te puna
analyzed: na ca te punar upenti gabbhaseyyam orambhāgiyānam saṃyojanānam samucchinna ttāḥ ye  ca pana pahāya moham sabbaso samugghātetvā bhava rāga anusayam ca pajahanti te puna

analyzed: saṭṭhi ca vassa sata sahassāni honti vācā abhigītam ti vācāya abhigītam āgacchantu  ayyāḥ idam āsanam paññattam idha nisīdatha ati ādinā kim sarīrassa ārogyaṃ  kim vasana ṭṭhānam phāsuka nti ādinā paṭisanthāra vasena ca vācāya kathita mattam manasā  pavattitanti ime ayyāḥ pesalāḥ brahmacārino dhamma cārino ti ādinā cittena pavattitan
translated: and sixty thousand years. Spoken welcome: spoken welcome, “Come, venerable sirs, this seat is ready, sit down here,” and so on, and the words of hospitality, “Is your body well, venerable sirs?🔽Is your dwelling place convenient?” Mind-made: made with the mind, “These venerable ones are kindly, celibate, living the spiritual life righteously,” and so on.

original: pasādamattaṃ, na pana mama santakaṃ kiñci pariccattaṃ atthīti dasseti. Ettāvatāti🔽ettakena evaṃ kathanamattena pasādamattenapi. Ṭhassati puññakammoti katapuñño nāma🔽hutvā devaloke ṭhassati ciraṃ pavattissati, tiṭṭhanto ca dibbehi kāmehi samaṅgībhūto🔽tasmiṃ devanikāye devānaṃ valañjaniyāmeneva dibbehi pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samaṅgībhūto

translated: and sixty thousand years. ‘Praised with speech’: praised with speech, with such words as ‘Come, venerable sirs, this seat is ready. Please sit down here’, ‘How is it with the venerable ones? Are you healthy, strong, and in normal comfort? Is your pain bearable? Are you used to the food and drink here? Are you sitting or lying down at ease?’, ‘The venerable ones are kindly, virtuous, and of good character’, and so on. ‘Praised in mind’: merely praised in mind, not even a trifle given. ‘So far’: so far, with just this much speaking and praising. ‘Will stand’: one who has made merit will stand, will last long, in the heavenly world after burning up. And while standing, endowed with heavenly sensual pleasures, in that divine world, he will be endowed with the five heavenly sensual pleasures in the manner of the gods’ enjoyment of them.

original: samannāgato hutvā indriyāni paricārento viharatīti attho. Sesaṃ vuttanayameva.

translated: The description of the Dvārapāla Mansion is ended.

original: “Idampi pānīyaṃ sītaṃ, ābhataṃ girigabbharā;
analyzed: idam pi pānīyam giri gabbharā
translated: “This water is cool, brought from the mountain cave.🔽Having drunk, prince, sit on the spread.”

original: Rājaputta tato pitvā, santhatasmiṃ upāvisā”ti. – āha;
analyzed: rāja putta tatas pitvā santhatasmin upāvisa āha
translated: He said.

original: 984. Tattha adurāgatanti durāgamanavajjitaṃ, mahāpuñña, te idhāgamanaṃ svāgataṃ,
analyzed: tattha adurāgatam ti durāgamana vajjitam mahā puñña te idha āgamanam svāgatam
translated: Herein, not far to come is free from the coming far of the kind already stated. It is a great merit of his that he has come here. Welcome to him,

original: na te appakampi durāgamanaṃ atthi tuyhañca mayhañca pītisomanassajananatoti adhippāyo.
analyzed: na te appakampi durāgamanam atthi tuyham ca mayham ca pīti somanassa jananato ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: Herein, he has come not from far away: he has come not from a far place to be avoided, he has come to a great place of merit, his coming here is welcome, there is not the slightest difficulty for him in coming, and he is a source of joy and gladness both to himself and to others: this is the meaning.

original: “Adhunāgata”ntipi pāṭho, idāni āgamananti attho.
analyzed: pāṭhaḥ idāni āgamananti attho
translated: The reading “adhunāgata” is also allowable; the meaning is “his coming is now”.

original: 985. Santhatasmiṃ upāvisāti anantarahitāya bhūmiyā anisīditvā amukasmiṃ tiṇasanthārake nisīdāti.
analyzed: santhatasmin upāvisāti anantara hitāya bhūmiyā a nisīditvā amukasmin tiṇa santhārake nisīdāti
translated: He sat down on the spread: he did not sit down on the ground without a break in it; he sat down on a spread of grass in such and such a place.

original: Tato rājakumāro therassa paṭisanthāraṃ sampaṭicchanto āha –
analyzed: tatas rāja kumāraḥ therassa paṭisanthāram sampaṭicchantaḥ āha
translated: Then the prince, in accepting the Elder’s hospitality, said:

original: “Kalyāṇī vata te vācā, savanīyā mahāmuni;
analyzed: kalyāṇī vata te vācā savanīyā mahā muni
translated: “How good your speech, great sage, how fit to hear,

original: Nelā atthavatī vaggu, mantvā atthañca bhāsasi.
analyzed: na ilā atthavatī vaggu mantvā atthañca bhāsasi
translated: Clear, meaningful, and sweet, and then the sense.

original: “Kā te rati vane viharato, isinisabha vadehi puṭṭho;
analyzed: kā te rati vane viharataḥ isinisabha vadehi puṭṭhaḥ
translated: “What is your pleasure in the forest life? Tell me, chief of seers, when asked.

original: Tava vacanapathaṃ nisāmayitvā, atthadhammapadaṃ samācaremase”ti.
analyzed: tava vacana patham nisāmayitvā attha dhamma padam samācaremasa iti
translated: We will observe the word you speak, and then the sense and the good way.”

original: 986. Tattha kalyāṇīti sundarā sobhanā. Savanīyāti sotuṃ yuttā. Nelāti niddosā. Atthavatīti
analyzed: tattha kalyāṇī iti sundarā sobhanā savanīyā ati sotum yuttā na ilā ati niddosā atthavatī iti
translated: Herein, good is beautiful, lovely. Fit to hear: worthy to be heard. Clear: free from the stain of the defilements. Meaningful:

original: atthayuttā diṭṭhadhammikādinā hitena upetā. Vaggūti madhurā. Mantvāti jānitvā paññāya
analyzed: attha yuttāḥ diṭṭhadhammika ādinā hitena upetāḥ vaggū iti madhurāḥ mantvā ati jānitvā paññāya
translated: It is beneficial, since it is connected with benefit here and now, etc. It is sweet, since it is pleasant. Having considered: having known, having discerned with understanding.

original: paricchinditvā. Atthanti atthato anapetaṃ ekantahitāvahaṃ.
analyzed: paricchinditvā atthanti atthataḥ an apetam ekanta hita āvaham
translated: Meaning: not divorced from meaning, bringing about only benefit.

original: 987. Isinisabhāti isīsu nisabha ājānīyasadisa. Vacanapathanti vacanaṃ. Vacanameva
analyzed: isi nisabha ati isīsu nisabhaḥ vacana pathanti vacanam vacanam eva
translated: Bull among seers: a bull among seers, like a thoroughbred.🔽Path of speech: speech.

original: hi atthādhigamassa upāyabhāvato “vacanapatha”nti vuttaṃ. Atthadhammapadaṃ samācaremaseti
analyzed: hi attha adhigamassa upāya bhāvataḥ vacana pathanti vuttam attha dhamma padam samācaremasa iti
translated: For speech is called “the path of speech” because it is the means of attaining the meaning.

original: idha ceva samparāye ca atthāvahaṃ sīlādidhammakoṭṭhāsaṃ paṭipajjāmase.
analyzed: idha ca iva samparāye ca attha āvaham sīla ādi dhamma koṭṭhāsam paṭipajjāmase
translated: We follow the word and the meaning: we practice the aggregates of states such as virtue, which bring about meaning both here and now and in the life to come.

original: Idāni thero attano sammāpaṭipattiṃ tassa anucchavikaṃ vadanto –
analyzed: idāni thero attano sammāpaṭipattim tassa anucchavikam vadantaḥ
translated: Now, the elder, speaking in conformity with his own right practice, said:

original: “Ahiṃsā sabbapāṇīnaṃ, kumāramhāka ruccati;
analyzed: ahiṃsā sabba pāṇīnam ruccati
translated: “Non-violence to all creatures, this is pleasing to me, young man,

original: Theyyā ca aticārā ca, majjapānā ca ārati.
analyzed: theyyā ca aticārā ca majja pānā ca ārati
translated: Steadfastness, chastity, and the avoidance of wine,

original: “Ārati samacariyā ca, bāhusaccaṃ kataññutā;
analyzed: ārati sama cariyā ca bāhusaccam kataññu tā
translated: “Contentment, good will, and learning, gratitude,

original: Diṭṭheva dhamme pāsaṃsā, dhammā ete pasaṃsiyā”ti. – āha;
analyzed: diṭṭhā iva dhamme pāsaṃsā dhammāḥ ete pasaṃsiyā ti āha
translated: Praise in this very life, these are the things to be praised.”

original: 989. Tattha ārati samacariyā cāti yathāvuttā ca pāpadhammato ārati, paṭivirati kāyasamatādisamacariyā🔽ca. Bāhusaccanti pariyattibāhusaccaṃ. Kataññutāti parehi attano katassa upakārassa
analyzed: tattha ārati sama cariyā ca ati yathā vuttā ca pāpa dhammataḥ ārati paṭivirati kāya samatā ādi sama cariyā  ca bāhusaccanti pariyatti bāhusaccam kataññu tā ti parehi attanaḥ katassa upakārassa
translated: Herein, disliking and good conduct are the disliking of what is called evil and the good conduct consisting in the bodily equanimity, etc., and abstinence from it.🔽Much learning is learning much of the scriptures. Grateful: knowing what others have done for him.🔽Praiseworthy: to be praised by those who desire his welfare.

original: jānanā. Pāsaṃsāti atthakāmehi kulaputtehi pakārato āsaṃsitabbā. Dhammā eteti ete
analyzed: jānanā pāsaṃsā ati attha kāmehi kula puttehi pakārataḥ āsaṃsitabbāḥ dhammāḥ ete iti ete
translated: These states: these states beginning with non-violence.

original: yathāvuttā ahiṃsādidhammā. Pasaṃsiyāti viññūhi pasaṃsitabbā.🔽Evaṃ thero tassa anucchavikaṃ sammāpaṭipattiṃ vatvā anāgataṃsañāṇena āyusaṅkhāre🔽olokento “pañcamāsamattamevā”ti disvā taṃ saṃvejetvā daḷhaṃ tattha sammāpaṭipattiyaṃ
analyzed: yathā vuttāḥ ahiṃsā ādi dhammā pasaṃsiya ati viññūhi pasaṃsitabbā  evam thero tassa anucchavikam sammāpaṭipattim vatvā anāgataṃsa ñāṇena āyu saṅkhāre  olokento pañca māsa mattam eva ati disvā tam saṃvejetvā daḷham tattha sammā paṭipattiyam
translated: Praise: to be praised by the wise.🔽After the elder had thus spoken the right practice suitable to him, he looked at the life formation with knowledge of the future and saw that it would last only five months.

original: patiṭṭhāpetuṃ imaṃ gāthamāha –
analyzed: patiṭṭhāpetum imam gātham āha
translated: Then he aroused his conscience and established him firmly in the right practice, and he uttered this stanza:

original: “Santike maraṇaṃ tuyhaṃ, oraṃ māsehi pañcahi;
analyzed: santike maraṇam tuyham oram māsehi pañcahi
translated: “Your death is near, Prince, Not more than five months hence;

original: Rājaputta vijānāhi, attānaṃ parimocayā”ti.
analyzed: rāja putta vijānāhi attānam parimocaya ati
translated: So, Prince, be quick to know, And make yourself secure.”

original: Tattha attānaṃ parimocayāti attānaṃ apāyadukkhato mocehi.
analyzed: tattha attānam parimocaya ati attānam apāya dukkhataḥ mocehi
translated: Herein, make yourself secure is make yourself safe from the suffering of the states of loss.

original: Tato kumāro attano muttiyā upāyaṃ pucchanto āha –
analyzed: tatas kumāraḥ attanaḥ muttiyāḥ upāyam pucchantaḥ āha
translated: Then the prince, asking for a means of his own deliverance, said:

original: “Katamaṃ svāhaṃ janapadaṃ gantvā, kiṃ kammaṃ kiñca porisaṃ;
analyzed: katamam svāham janapadam gantvā kim kammam kiñca porisam
translated: “What country, sir, should I go to, what work should I do, and what man should I follow,

original: Kāya vā pana vijjāya, bhaveyyaṃ ajarāmaro”ti.
analyzed: kāya vā pana vijjāya bhaveyyam ajara amara uti
translated: Or by what knowledge should I become ageless and deathless?”

original: Tattha katamaṃ svāhanti katamaṃ su ahaṃ, katamaṃ nūti attho. Kiṃ kammaṃ kiñca porisanti katvāti vacanaseso. Porisanti purisakiccaṃ.
analyzed: tattha katamam svāhanti katamam su aham katamam nu iti atthaḥ kim kammam kiñca porisanti katvā ati vacana sesaḥ porisanti purisa kiccam
translated: Herein, what country, sir, should I go to? What is good for me? What is it like? What is the meaning? What work should I do? What man should I follow? The word katvā is a remainder. Man should be done as a man’s duty.

original: Tato thero tassa dhammaṃ desetuṃ imā gāthāyo avoca –
analyzed: tatas theraḥ tassa dhammam desetuṃ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ avoca
translated: Then the Elder spoke these stanzas in order to teach him the True Idea:

original: “Na vijjate so padeso, kammaṃ vijjā ca porisaṃ;
analyzed: na vijjate so padesaḥ kammam vijjā ca porisam
translated: “No place is found where work and knowledge,

original: Yattha gantvā bhave macco, rājaputtājarāmaro.
analyzed: gantvā bhave
translated: Where a man may go and become ageless and deathless, Prince.

original: “Mahaddhanā mahābhogā, raṭṭhavantopi khattiyā;
analyzed: mahat dhanāḥ mahā bhogāḥ raṭṭhavantaḥ api khattiyā
translated: “Greatly rich and greatly prosperous, even if they are Khattiyas in a kingdom,

original: Pahūtadhanadhaññāse, tepi no ajarāmarā.
analyzed: te pi no ajara amarā
translated: With abundant wealth and corn, they too are not ageless and deathless.

original: “Yadi te sutā andhakaveṇḍuputtā, sūrā vīrā vikkantappahārino;
analyzed: yadi te sutā andhaka veṇḍu puttā sūrāḥ vīrāḥ vikkanta ppahārinaḥ
translated: “If you have heard of the Andhakas, the Vengi-sons, the heroes, the brave, the bold and daring,

original: Tepi āyukkhayaṃ pattā, viddhastā sassatīsamā.
analyzed: te pi āyu khayam pattā viddhastā sassatī samā
translated: They too, having reached the end of their life-span, were pierced and slain like any ordinary man.

original: “Khattiyā brāhmaṇā vessā, suddā caṇḍālapukkusā;
analyzed: khattiyāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ vessāḥ suddāḥ caṇḍālapukkusā
translated: “Khattiyas, Brahmins, Vessas, Suddas, Candalas and Pukkusas,

original: Ete caññe ca jātiyā, tepi no ajarāmarā.
analyzed: ete caññe ca jātiyā te pi no ajara amarā
translated: and others besides, they are not ageless and deathless.

original: “Ye mantaṃ parivattenti, chaḷaṅgaṃ brahmacintitaṃ;
analyzed: ye mantam chaṣ aṅgam brahma cintitam
translated: “Those who recite the mantras, the six-factored Brahma-meditation,

original: Ete caññe ca vijjāya, tepi no ajarāmarā.
analyzed: ete caññe ca te pi no ajara amarā
translated: and others besides, they are not ageless and deathless.

original: “Isayo cāpi ye santā, saññatattā tapassino;
analyzed: isayaḥ ca api ye santā saññatattā tapassino
translated: “And those ascetics who are calm, self-controlled, and austere,

original: Sarīraṃ tepi kālena, vijahanti tapassino.
analyzed: sarīram te api kālena vijahanti tapassinaḥ
translated: they too, in time, leave the body, those austere ones.

original: “Bhāvitattāpi arahanto, katakiccā anāsavā;
analyzed: arahantaḥ kata kiccāḥ anāsavā
translated: “And even the perfected ones, who have developed , whose work is done, who are without taints,

original: Nikkhipanti imaṃ dehaṃ, puññapāpaparikkhayā”ti.
analyzed: nikkhipanti imam deham puñña pāpa parikkhayā ti
translated: they lay down this body, through the exhaustion of merit and demerit.”

original: 992. Tattha yattha gantvāti yaṃ padesaṃ gantvā kammaṃ vijjaṃ porisañca kāyapayogena itarapayogena ca upagantvā pāpuṇitvā bhaveyya ajarāmaroti attho.🔽993. Heṭṭhimakoṭiyā koṭisatādiparimāṇaṃ saṃharitvā ṭhapitaṃ mahantaṃ dhanaṃ etesanti
analyzed: tattha yattha gantvā iti yam padesam gantvā kammam vijjam porisam ca kāya payogena itara payogena ca upagantvā pāpuṇitvā bhaveyya ajara amara iti attho  heṭṭhima koṭiyā koṭi sata ādi parimāṇam saṃharitvā ṭhapitam mahantam dhanam
translated: Herein, having gone to where: having gone to a place, having approached, having reached, by means of action, knowledge, and the use of the body and the use of other things, one would be ageless and deathless, is the meaning.🔽They have great wealth in that they have stored up a great deal of wealth, a hundred thousand, etc.,

original: mahaddhanā. Kumbhattayādikahāpaṇaparibbayo mahanto bhogo etesanti mahābhogā. Raṭṭhavantoti
analyzed: mahat dhanā mahantaḥ bhogo etesanti mahā bhogāḥ raṭṭhavanto ti
translated: at the lower end of the scale. They have great possessions in that they have a great deal of property, a hundred thousand kahāpaṇas, etc., at the lower end of the scale. They have great power in that they have great power and influence in a country.

original: raṭṭhasāmikā, anekayojanaparimāṇaṃ raṭṭhaṃ pasāsantāti adhippāyo. Khattiyāti khattiyajātikā.
analyzed: raṭṭha sāmikāḥ aneka yojana parimāṇam raṭṭham pasāsantā ati adhippāyaḥ khattiyā ati khattiya jātikā
translated: Khattiyas: those of the warrior caste.

original: Pahūtadhanadhaññāseti mahādhanadhaññasannicayā, attano parisāya ca sattaṭṭhasaṃvaccharapahonakadhanadhaññasannicayā.🔽Tepi no ajarāmarāti jarāmaraṇadhammā eva, mahaddhanatādīnipi tesaṃ upari nipatantaṃ
analyzed: mahā dhana dhañña sannicayā attano parisāya ca sattaṭṭha saṃvacchara pahonaka dhana dhañña sannicayā  te pi no jarā maraṇa dhammāḥ eva mahat dhana tā ādīni pi tesam upari nipatantam
translated: Greatly rich in property and corn: they have great store of wealth and corn, and their retinue has a store of wealth and corn sufficient for seven or eight years.

original: jarāmaraṇaṃ nivattetuṃ na sakkontīti attho.
analyzed: jarā maraṇam nivattetum na sakkonti iti atthaḥ
translated: They too are not free from aging and death: they are subject to aging and death. The meaning is, they are unable to avert aging and death that falls upon them, even with their great wealth, etc.🔽Andhaka-Veṇhu-putta: they are known as the sons of Andhaka-Veṇhu.🔽Brave: they are full of courage.

original: 994. Andhakaveṇḍuputtāti andhakaveṇḍussa puttāti paññātā. Sūrāti sattimanto. Vīrāti
analyzed: andhakaveṇḍu puttā ati andhakaveṇḍussa puttā ati paññātā sūrā ati sattimantaḥ vīrā ati
translated: Heroes: they are full of energy.

original: vīriyavanto. Vikkantappahārinoti sūravīrabhāveneva paṭisattubalaṃ vikkamma pasayha🔽paharaṇasīlā. Viddhastāti vinaṭṭhā. Sassatīsamāti kulaparamparāya sassatīhi candasūriyādīhi
analyzed: vīriyavantaḥ vikkanta ppahārinaḥ ti sūra vīra bhāvena iva paṭisattu balam vikkamma pasayha  paharaṇa sīlā vinaṭṭhā kula paramparāya sassatīhi canda sūriya ādīhi
translated: They fight with their enemies: by virtue of their bravery and heroism they fight with their enemies, overcoming and crushing them.🔽They are destroyed: they are ruined.

original: samānā, tepi acirakālapavattakulanvayāti attho.
analyzed: samānā te pi acira kāla pavatta kula nvayā ti attho
translated: They are equal to the eternal sun and moon: they are equal to the eternal sun, moon, etc., by reason of the continuity of their families. The meaning is, their families have continued for a long time.

original: 995. Jātiyāti attano jātiyā, visiṭṭhatarā pana jātipi nesaṃ jarāmaraṇaṃ nivattetuṃ na sakkotīti attho.
analyzed: jātiyā iti attanaḥ jātiyā visiṭṭhatarā pana jāti pi nesam jarā maraṇam nivattetum na sakkoti iti attho
translated: “Birth” : by his own birth. The meaning is, even a more distinguished birth than his cannot avert aging-and-death.

original: 996. Mantanti vedaṃ. Chaḷaṅganti kappabyākaraṇaniruttisikkhāchandovicitijotisatthasaṅkhātehi
analyzed: mantanti vedam kappa byākaraṇa nirutti sikkhā chando viciti jotisattha saṅkhātehi
translated: “Mant” : the Veda. “Six-limbed” : the six-limbed Veda consisting of the Siksa, the Kalpa, the Vyakaraṇa, the Nirukti, the Chandas, and the Jyotisa.

original: chahi aṅgehi chaḷaṅgaṃ. Brahmacintitanti brahmehi aṭṭhakādīhi cintitaṃ paññācakkhunā diṭṭhaṃ.
analyzed: chahi aṅgehi chaḷaṅgam brahma cintitam ti aṭṭhaka ādīhi cintitam paññācakkhunā diṭṭham
translated: “Brahma-conceived” : conceived by the Brahmas, seen with the eye of wisdom.

original: 997. Santāti upasantakāyavacīkammantā. Saññatattāti saññatacittā. Tapassinoti tapanissitā.
analyzed: santā ati upasanta kāya vacī kammantā saññata ttā ati saññata cittā tapassinaḥ ti tapa nissitā
translated: “Self-controlled” : with self-controlled bodily and verbal action. “Self-mastered” : with self-mastered mind. “Ascetics” : devoted to mortification.

original: Idāni kumāro attanā kattabbaṃ vadanto –
analyzed: idāni kumāraḥ attanā kattabbam vadantaḥ
translated: Now the prince, speaking of what he himself should do, said:

original: “Subhāsitā atthavatī, gāthāyo te mahāmuni;
analyzed: su bhāsitāḥ atthavatī gāthāyaḥ te mahā muni
translated: “Well spoken, full of meaning, are your verses, great sage.

original: Nijjhattomhi subhaṭṭhena, tvañca me saraṇaṃ bhavā”ti. –
analyzed: nijjhattaḥ asmi su bhaṭṭhena tvam ca me saraṇam bhavāti
translated: I am converted by the good teacher; you are my refuge.”

original: Āha. Tattha nijjhattomhīti nijjhāpito dhammojasaññāya saññattigato amhi. Subhaṭṭhenāti suṭṭhu bhāsitena.
analyzed: āha tattha nijjhattaḥ amhi iti nijjhāpitaḥ dhamma oja saññāya saññatti gataḥ amhi su bhaṭṭhena ati suṭṭhu bhāsitena
translated: Herein, “I am converted” : I have become one who has attained self-control by the perception of the power of the Dhamma. “By the good teacher” : by the one who has spoken well.

original: Tato thero taṃ anusāsanto imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi –
analyzed: tatas theraḥ tam anusāsantaḥ imam gātham abhāsi
translated: Then the Elder, instructing him, uttered this verse:

original: “Mā maṃ tvaṃ saraṇaṃ gaccha, tameva saraṇaṃ vaja;
analyzed: mā mam tvam saraṇam gaccha tam eva saraṇam vaja
translated: “Do not go to me for refuge, go to him for refuge,

original: Sakyaputtaṃ mahāvīraṃ, yamahaṃ saraṇaṃ gato”ti.
analyzed: sakya puttam mahāvīram yam aham saraṇam gataḥ iti
translated: The great hero, the son of the Sakyans, to whom I have gone for refuge.”

original: Tato rājakumāro āha –
analyzed: tatas rāja kumāraḥ āha
translated: Then the prince said:

original: “Katarasmiṃ so janapade, satthā tumhāka mārisa;
analyzed: katarasmin saḥ janapade satthā mārisa
translated: “In what country, good sir, is your teacher?

original: Ahampi daṭṭhuṃ gacchissaṃ, jinaṃ appaṭipuggala”nti.
analyzed: aham pi daṭṭhum gacchissam jinam appaṭipuggalam ti
translated: I too will go to see the Conqueror, the peerless one.”

original: Puna thero āha –
analyzed: puna theraḥ āha
translated: Then the Elder said:

original: “Puratthimasmiṃ janapade, okkākakulasambhavo;
analyzed: puratthimasmin janapade okkāka kula sambhavaḥ
translated: “In the eastern country, born in the Okkāka clan,

original: Tatthāsi purisājañño, so ca kho parinibbuto”ti.
analyzed: tattha asi purisājañño so ca kho parinibbuto ti
translated: There is a wise man, but he has attained final Nibbāna.”

original: Tattha therena nisinnapadesato majjhimadesassa pācīnadisābhāgattā vuttaṃ “puratthimasmiṃ janapade”ti.
analyzed: tattha therena nisinna padesataḥ majjhima desassa pācīna disā bhāgattā vuttam puratthimasmin janapada iti
translated: Here, because the Middle Country is in the eastern direction from the place where the Elder was sitting, it was said: “In the eastern country.”

original: Evaṃ so rājaputto therassa dhammadesanaṃ sutvā pasannamānaso saraṇesu ca sīlesu ca patiṭṭhahi. Tena vuttaṃ –
analyzed: evam saḥ rāja putto therassa dhamma desanam sutvā pasanna mānasaḥ saraṇesu ca sīlesu ca patiṭṭhahi tena vuttam
translated: Thus, having heard the Elder’s teaching of the Dhamma, the prince, with his mind full of faith, was established in the Refuges and Precepts. Therefore it was said:

original: “Sace hi buddho tiṭṭheyya, satthā tumhāka mārisa;
analyzed: sace hi buddhaḥ tiṭṭheyya satthā tumhāka mārisa
translated: “If the Buddha were still living, good sir, your teacher,

original: Yojanāni sahassāni, gaccheyyaṃ payirupāsituṃ.
analyzed: yojanāni sahassāni gaccheyyam payis upāsitum
translated: I would go a thousand leagues to wait on him.

original: “Yato ca kho parinibbuto, satthā tumhāka mārisa;
analyzed: yatas ca kho parinibbutaḥ satthā tumhāka mārisa
translated: “But since the teacher, good sir, has attained final Nibbāna,

original: Nibbutampi mahāvīraṃ, gacchāmi saraṇaṃ ahaṃ.
analyzed: nibbutam pi mahāvīram gacchāmi saraṇam aham
translated: I go for refuge to the Great Hero, the Buddha, who is at peace.

original: “Upemi saraṇaṃ buddhaṃ, dhammañcāpi anuttaraṃ;
analyzed: upemi saraṇam buddham dhammam ca api anuttaram
translated: I go for refuge to the Buddha, and to the unsurpassed Dhamma,

original: Saṅghañca naradevassa, gacchāmi saraṇaṃ ahaṃ.
analyzed: saṅghañca naradevassa gacchāmi saraṇam aham
translated: and to the Saṅgha of disciples of the Buddha, I go for refuge.

original: “Pāṇātipātā viramāmi khippaṃ, loke adinnaṃ parivajjayāmi;
analyzed: pāṇa atipātā viramāmi khippam loke adinnam parivajjayāmi
translated: I will quickly refrain from killing living creatures, and in the world I will avoid taking what is not given;

original: Amajjapo no ca musā bhaṇāmi, sakena dārena ca homi tuṭṭho”ti.
analyzed: no ca musā bhaṇāmi sakena dārena ca homi tuṭṭhaḥ ti
translated: I will not drink alcohol, and I will not tell lies, and I will be satisfied with my own wife.

original: Evaṃ pana taṃ saraṇesu ca sīlesu ca patiṭṭhitaṃ thero evamāha “rājakumāra, tuyhaṃ
analyzed: evam pana tam saraṇesu ca sīlesu ca patiṭṭhitam theraḥ evam āha rāja kumāra tuyham
translated: But when he was established in the refuges and the precepts, the Elder said to him, “Prince,

original: idha araññavāsena attho natthi, na ciraṃ tava jīvitaṃ, pañcamāsabbhantare eva kālaṃ
analyzed: idha arañña vāsena atthaḥ natthi na ciram tava jīvitam pañca māsa abbhantare eva kālam
translated: you have no need to live in the forest here, your life will not last long, within five months

analyzed: karissasi tasmā tava pitu santikam eva gantvā dāna ādīni puññāni katvā sagga parāyaṇaḥ
translated: you will die, therefore you should go to your father and make merit such as giving, and you will be reborn in heaven.

original: bhaveyyāsī”ti vatvā attano santike dhātuyo datvā vissajjesi. So gacchanto “ahaṃ,
analyzed: bhaveyyāsi iti vatvā attano santike dhātuyaḥ datvā vissajjesi saḥ gacchantaḥ aham
translated: ” After saying this, he gave him the relics from his own shrine and dismissed him. He said, “Venerable Sir,

original: bhante, tumhākaṃ vacanena ito gamissāmi, tumhehipi mayhaṃ anukampāya tattha āgantabba”nti
analyzed: bhante tumhākam vacanena itas gamissāmi tumhehi pi mayham anukampāya tattha āgantabbanti
translated: I will go from here on your word, and out of compassion for me you should come there.”

original: vatvā therassa adhivāsanaṃ viditvā vanditvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pitu nagaraṃ gantvā🔽uyyānaṃ pavisitvā attano āgatabhāvaṃ rañño nivedesi.
analyzed: vatvā therassa adhivāsanam viditvā vanditvā padakkhiṇam katvā pitu nagaram gantvā  uyyānam pavisitvā attanaḥ āgata bhāvam raññaḥ nivedesi
translated: and having so done, he saluted the Elder and departed. He then went to his father’s city,🔽entered the garden, and announced his arrival to the king.

original: Taṃ sutvā rājā saparivāro uyyānaṃ gantvā kumāraṃ āliṅgitvā antepuraṃ netvā abhisiñcitukāmo
analyzed: tam sutvā rājā sa parivāraḥ uyyānam gantvā kumāram āliṅgitvā antepuram netvā abhisiñcitu kāmaḥ
translated: When the king heard this, he went to the garden with his retinue, embraced the prince, took him to the palace, and desired to anoint him crown prince.

original: ahosi. Kumāro “deva, mayhaṃ appakaṃ āyu, ito catunnaṃ māsānaṃ accayena maraṇaṃ bhavissati,
analyzed: ahosi kumāraḥ deva mayham appakam āyu itas catunnam māsānam accayena maraṇam bhavissati
translated: The prince said, “Your majesty, my life is short. Four months from now I shall die.

original: kiṃ me rajjena, tumhe nissāya puññameva karissāmī”ti vatvā therassa guṇaṃ ratanattayassa
analyzed: kim me rajjena tumhe nissāya puññam eva karissāmi iti vatvā therassa guṇam ratanattayassa
translated: What is a kingdom to me? I shall make merit with your help.” He then extolled the virtues of the Elder and

original: ca ānubhāvaṃ pavedesi. Taṃ sutvā rājā saṃvegappatto ratanattaye ca there ca pasannamānaso🔽mahantaṃ vihāraṃ kāretvā mahākaccāyanattherassa santike dūtaṃ pāhesi. Theropi rājānaṃ
analyzed: ca ānubhāvam tam sutvā rājā saṃvega pattaḥ ratanattaye ca there ca pasanna mānasaḥ  mahantam vihāram kāretvā mahākaccāyana therassa santike dūtam pāhesi theraḥ api rājānam
translated: the power of the Three Jewels. When the king heard this, he was deeply moved. He became devoted to the Three Jewels and to the Elder,🔽and he had a great monastery built. He then sent a messenger to the Elder Mahā-Kaccayana. The Elder came to help the king

original: mahājanañca anuggaṇhanto āgacchi. Rājā ca saparivāro dūratova paccuggamanaṃ katvā
analyzed: mahājanam ca anuggaṇhantaḥ āgacchi rājā ca sa parivāraḥ dūratas va paccuggamanam katvā
translated: and the people. The king and his retinue went out to meet him.

original: theraṃ vihāraṃ pavesetvā catūhi paccayehi sakkaccaṃ upaṭṭhahanto saraṇesu ca sīlesu
analyzed: theram vihāram pavesetvā catūhi paccayehi sakkaccam upaṭṭhahantaḥ saraṇesu ca sīlesu
translated: and after he had brought the Elder into the monastery, he served him with the four requisites and established himself in the Refuges and the Precepts.

original: ca patiṭṭhahi. Kumāro ca sīlāni samādiyitvā theraṃ bhikkhū ceva sakkaccaṃ upaṭṭhahanto
analyzed: ca kumāro ca sīlāni samādiyitvā theram bhikkhū ca iva sakkaccam upaṭṭhahantaḥ
translated: And after the boy had taken the Precepts, he served the Elder and the Bhikkhus with the four requisites,

original: dānāni dadanto dhammaṃ suṇanto catunnaṃ māsānaṃ accayena kālaṃ katvā tāvatiṃsabhavane
analyzed: dānāni dadantaḥ dhammam suṇantaḥ catunnam māsānam accayena kālam katvā tāvatiṃsa bhavane
translated: and after he had given gifts and listened to the Dhamma, he died at the end of four months and was reborn in the World of the Thirty-three.

original: nibbatti. Tassa puññānubhāvena sattaratanapaṭimaṇḍito sattayojanappamāṇo ratho uppajji,
analyzed: nibbatti tassa puñña anubhāvena satta ratana paṭimaṇḍitaḥ satta yojana ppamāṇaḥ rathaḥ uppajji
translated: By the power of his merit a chariot appeared, adorned with the seven precious stones, seven leagues in extent,

original: anekāni cassa accharāsahassāni parivāro ahosi.
analyzed: anekāni ca assa accharā sahassāni parivāraḥ ahosi
translated: and he had a retinue of many thousands of celestial nymphs.

original: Rājā kumārassa sarīrasakkāraṃ katvā bhikkhusaṅghassa ca mahādānaṃ pavattetvā cetiyassa
analyzed: rājā kumārassa sarīra sakkāram katvā bhikkhu saṅghassa ca mahādānam pavattetvā cetiyassa
translated: After the king had paid honour to the boy’s body and had given a great gift to the Community of Bhikkhus, he made offerings to the Shrine,

original: pūjaṃ akāsi, tattha mahājano sannipati, theropi saparivāro taṃ padesaṃ upagañchi.
analyzed: pūjam akāsi tattha mahā janaḥ sannipati theraḥ api sa parivāraḥ tam padesam upagañchi
translated: and a great crowd of people assembled there. The Elder, too, came to that place with his retinue.

original: Atha devaputto attanā katakusalakammaṃ oloketvā kataññutāya “gantvā theraṃ vandissāmi,
analyzed: atha devaputtaḥ attanā kata kusala kammam oloketvā kataññu tāya gantvā theram vandissāmi
translated: Then the young god, looking at the good deed he had done, and out of gratitude, thought: “I will go and pay homage to the Elder,

original: sāsanaguṇe ca pākaṭe karissāmī”ti cintetvā dibbarathaṃ āruyha mahatā parivārena dissamānarūpo🔽āgantvā rathā oruyha therassa pāde vanditvā pitarā saddhiṃ paṭisanthāraṃ katvā theraṃ
analyzed: sāsana guṇe ca pākaṭe karissāmi iti cintetvā dibba ratham āruyha mahatā parivārena dissamāna rūpaḥ  āgantvā rathā oruyha therassa pāde vanditvā pitarā saddhim paṭisanthāram katvā theram
translated: and I will make known the virtues of the Dispensation.” Having thus thought, he mounted his celestial chariot, and with a great retinue, appearing in his own form,🔽he came to the monastery. Descending from the chariot, he paid homage at the Elder’s feet, and after exchanging greetings with his parents,

original: payirupāsamāno añjaliṃ paggayha aṭṭhāsi. Taṃ thero imāhi gāthāhi pucchi –
analyzed: payis upāsamānaḥ añjalim paggayha aṭṭhāsi tam theraḥ imāhi gāthāhi pucchi
translated: he stood in reverential attendance, holding up his joined palms. The Elder questioned him with these verses:

original: “Sahassaraṃsīva yathāmahappabho, disaṃ yathā bhāti nabhe anukkamaṃ;
analyzed: sahassa raṃsī iva yathā mahappabhaḥ disam yathā bhāti nabhe anukkamam
translated: “Like the great sun with a thousand rays, as it shines in the sky in due course,

original: Tathāpakāro tavāyaṃ mahāratho, samantato yojanasattamāyato.
analyzed: tathā apakāraḥ tava ayam mahā rathaḥ samantataḥ yojana sattama āyataḥ
translated: so is this great chariot of yours, extending a hundred leagues in all directions.

original: “Suvaṇṇapaṭṭehi samantamotthaṭo, urassa muttāhi maṇīhi cittito;
analyzed: suvaṇṇa paṭṭehi urassa muttāhi maṇīhi cittitaḥ
translated: “Covered all over with gold plates, its top adorned with pearls and gems,

original: Lekhā suvaṇṇassa ca rūpiyassa ca, sobhenti veḷuriyamayā sunimmitā.
analyzed: lekhā suvaṇṇassa ca rūpiyassa ca sobhenti veḷuriya mayā su nimmitā
translated: the lines of gold and silver gleam, well-fashioned in lapis lazuli.

original: “Sīsañcidaṃ veḷuriyassa nimmitaṃ, yugañcidaṃ lohitakāya cittitaṃ;
analyzed: sīsam cidam veḷuriyassa nimmitam yugam cidam lohitakāya
translated: “The head is made of lapis lazuli, the yoke is adorned with coral,

original: Yuttā suvaṇṇassa ca rūpiyassa ca, sobhanti assā ca ime manojavā.
analyzed: yuttā suvaṇṇassa ca rūpiyassa ca sobhanti assā ca ime manojavā
translated: the horses are yoked to gold and silver, and these horses are swift as thought.

original: “So tiṭṭhasi hemarathe adhiṭṭhito, devānamindova sahassavāhano;
analyzed: so tiṭṭhasi hema rathe adhiṭṭhitaḥ devānam indo uva sahassa vāhanaḥ
translated: “You stand, established in a golden chariot, like the Lord of the Gods, with a thousand yokes,

analyzed: pucchāmi tā aham yasavanta kovidam katham tayā laddhaḥ ayam uḷāra iti
translated: I ask you, O you who are famous and wise, how did you get this great thing?”

original: 1007. Tattha sahassaraṃsīti sūriyo. So hi anekasahassaraṃsimantatāya “sahassaraṃsī”ti🔽vuccati. Yathāmahappabhoti attano mahattassa anurūpappabho. Yathā hi mahattena sūriyamaṇḍalena
analyzed: tattha sahassaraṃsī iti sūriyo saḥ hi aneka sahassaraṃsimantatāya sahassaraṃsī iti  vuccati yathāmahappabhoti attanaḥ mahattassa anurūpa ppabho yathā hi mahattena sūriya maṇḍalena
translated: Herein, the sun is the “thousand-rayed one” because it has a thousand rays all round.🔽It is “of great radiance” in accordance with its greatness, for there is no orb of light comparable to the sun’s orb of light in its greatness.

original: sadisaṃ jotimaṇḍalaṃ natthi, evaṃ pabhāyapi. Tathā hi taṃ ekasmiṃ khaṇe tīsu mahādīpesu🔽ālokaṃ pharantaṃ tiṭṭhati. Disaṃ yathā bhāti nabhe anukkamanti nabhe ākāse yatheva
analyzed: sadisam joti maṇḍalam na atthi evam tathā hi tam ekasmin khaṇe tīsu mahā dīpesu  ālokam pharantam tiṭṭhati disam yathā bhāti nabhe anukkamanti nabhe ākāse yathā iva
translated: For that shines in the three great continents at one and the same time.

original: disaṃ anukkamanto gacchanto yathā yena pakārena bhāti dibbati jotati. Tathāpakāroti
analyzed: disam anukkamantaḥ gacchantaḥ yathā yena pakārena bhāti dibbati jotati
translated: “As it shines in the directions in the sky” : as it goes shining, lighting up, illuminating, the directions in the sky, in the firmament,🔽“so” : in the same way,

original: tādisākāro. Tavāyanti tava ayaṃ.
analyzed: tava ayanti tava ayam
translated: “this is yours” .🔽“With golden reins” : with reins made of gold.

original: 1008. Suvaṇṇapaṭṭehīti suvaṇṇamayehi paṭṭehi. Samantamotthaṭo samantato chādito.
analyzed: suvaṇṇa paṭṭehi iti suvaṇṇa mayehi paṭṭehi samantamotthaṭaḥ samantataḥ chāditaḥ
translated: “All around it is draped” : it is covered all round.

original: Urassāti uro assa, rathassa uroti ca īsāmūlaṃ vadati. Lekhāti veḷuriyamayā mālākammalatākammādilekhā.🔽Tāsaṃ suvaṇṇapaṭṭesu ca rajatapaṭṭesu ca dissamānattā vuttaṃ “suvaṇṇassa ca rūpiyassa
analyzed: urassa ati uraḥ assa rathassa uro ti ca īsā mūlam vadati lekhā ati veḷuriya mayā mālā kamma latā kamma ādi lekhā  tāsam suvaṇṇa paṭṭesu ca rajata paṭṭesu ca dissamāna ttā vuttam suvaṇṇassa ca rūpiyassa
translated: ‘Breast’ : his breast, the breast of the chariot, the base of the pole is what is meant. ‘Lines’ : lines of inlaid work in beryl, of creeper-work, etc.

original: cā”ti. Sobhentīti rathaṃ sobhayanti.🔽1009. Sīsanti rathakubbarasīsaṃ. Veḷuriyassa nimmitanti veḷuriyena nimmitaṃ, veḷuriyamaṇimayanti🔽attho. Lohitakāyāti lohitakamaṇinā, yena kenaci rattamaṇinā vā. Yuttāti yojitā, atha
analyzed: ca ati sobhenti iti ratham sobhayanti  sīsanti rathakubbara sīsam veḷuriyassa nimmitanti veḷuriyena nimmitam veḷuriya maṇi mayanti  atthaḥ lohitakāya iti lohitaka maṇinā yena kenacid ratta maṇinā vā yuttā ati yojitā atha
translated: Since these are seen on the gold and silver panels, it is said ‘of gold and silver’. ‘Adorn’ : they adorn the chariot.

original: vā yottā suvaṇṇassa ca rūpiyassa cāti suvaṇṇamayā ca rūpiyamayā ca yottā, saṅkhalikāti attho.🔽1010. Adhiṭṭhitoti attano deviddhiyā sakalamidaṃ ṭhānaṃ abhibhavitvā ṭhito. Sahassavāhanoti
analyzed: vā yottā suvaṇṇassa ca rūpiyassa ca ati suvaṇṇa mayā ca rūpiya mayā ca yottā saṅkhalikā ati attho  adhiṭṭhitaḥ ti attanaḥ deva iddhiyā sakalam idam ṭhānam abhibhavitvā ṭhitaḥ sahassavāhanaḥ ti
translated: ‘Head’ : the head of the chariot’s peak. ‘Made of beryl’ : made of beryl, the meaning is, of beryl gems. ‘Red-stone’ : of red-stone gems, or of any gems that are red. ‘Yoked’ : harnessed. Or else, ‘yoked’ means yoked together, the meaning is, of gold and silver, yoked together, the meaning is, of gold and silver yokes. ‘Chains’ : the meaning is, of chains.

original: sahassayuttavāhano, sahassaājānīyayuttaratho devānamindo yathāti adhippāyo. Yasavantāti
analyzed: sahassa yutta vāhanaḥ sahassa ājānīya yutta rathaḥ devānam indaḥ yathā ati adhippāyaḥ yasavantā ati
translated: ‘Established’ : established by his own psychic power, having overcome the whole of this place. ‘With a thousand teams’ : the meaning is, harnessed to a thousand teams, like the chariot of Sakka Ruler of Gods, harnessed to a thousand thoroughbreds. ‘Yasavanta’ :

original: ālapanaṃ, yasassīti attho. Kovidanti kusalañāṇavantaṃ, rathārohane vā chekaṃ. Ayaṃ
analyzed: ālapanam yasassi iti kovidanti kusala ñāṇavantam ratha ārohane vā chekam ayam
translated: ‘Conversation’ means ‘fame’. ‘Skilled’ means ‘possessing skill’, or ‘skilled in mounting a chariot’. ‘This’

original: uḷāroti ayaṃ uḷāro mahanto yasoti adhippāyo.
analyzed: uḷāro ti ayam uḷāraḥ mahantaḥ yaso ti adhippāyo
translated: means ‘this great fame’.

original: Evaṃ therena puṭṭho devaputto imāhi gāthāhi byākāsi –
analyzed: evam therena puṭṭhaḥ devaputto imāhi gāthāhi
translated: When asked by the Elder, the god replied with these verses:

original: “Sujāto nāmahaṃ bhante, rājaputto pure ahuṃ;
analyzed: sujātaḥ nāma aham bhante rāja putto pure ahum
translated: “I was called Sujāta, Sir, and was a prince in the past;

original: Tvañca maṃ anukampāya, saññamasmiṃ nivesayi.
analyzed: tvam ca mama anukampāya saññamasmin nivesayi
translated: And you, out of compassion for me, established me in mindfulness.

original: “Khīṇāyukañca maṃ ñatvā, sarīraṃ pādāsi satthuno;
analyzed: khīṇa āyukam ca mama ñatvā sarīram pādāsi satthunaḥ
translated: “Knowing that my life was over, I gave my body to the Teacher;

original: Imaṃ sujāta pūjehi, taṃ te atthāya hehiti.
analyzed: imam sujāta pūjehi tam te atthāya hehi iti
translated: ‘Sujāta, worship this, it will be for your benefit.’

original: “Tāhaṃ gandhehi mālehi, pūjayitvā samuyyuto;
analyzed: tā aham gandhehi mālehi pūjayitvā
translated: “I worshipped it with perfumes and garlands, and was elated;

original: Pahāya mānusaṃ dehaṃ, upapannomhi nandanaṃ.
analyzed: pahāya mānusam deham upapannaḥ asmi nandanam
translated: Abandoning the human body, I was reborn in Nandana.

original: “Nandane ca vane ramme, nānādijagaṇāyute;
analyzed: nandane ca vane ramme nānā ādija gaṇa āyute
translated: “And in the delightful Nandana Grove, with its throngs of various birds,

original: Ramāmi naccagītehi, accharāhi purakkhato”ti.
analyzed: ramāmi nacca gītehi accharāhi purakkhato ti
translated: I delight in dancing and singing, attended by celestial nymphs.”

original: 1012-3. Tattha sarīrantī sarīradhātuṃ. Hehitīti bhavissati. Samuyyutoti sammā uyyutto, yuttappayuttoti attho.
analyzed: tattha sarīra dhātum hehiti iti bhavissati samuyyuto ti sammā uyyuttaḥ yutta ppayuttaḥ ti attho
translated: Herein, ‘body’ means a bodily relic. ‘Will be’ means ‘will come to be’. ‘Elated’ means ‘well elated’, the meaning is, ‘well disposed’.

original: Evaṃ devaputto therena pucchitamatthaṃ kathetvā theraṃ vanditvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā
analyzed: evam devaputto therena pucchitam attham kathetvā theram vanditvā padakkhiṇam katvā
translated: The deva-son, having thus told the Elder the meaning of his question, saluted the Elder, passed by on the right,

original: pitaraṃ āpucchitvā rathaṃ āruyha devalokameva gato. Theropi tamatthaṃ aṭṭhuppattiṃ🔽katvā sampattaparisāya vitthārena dhammakathaṃ kathesi. Sā dhammakathā mahājanassa🔽sātthikā ahosi. Atha thero taṃ sabbaṃ attanā ca tena ca kathitaniyāmeneva saṅgītikāle
analyzed: pitaram āpucchitvā ratham āruyha deva lokam eva gataḥ theraḥ api tam attham aṭṭhuppattim  katvā sampatta parisāya vitthārena dhamma katham kathesi sā dhamma kathā mahājanassa  sā atthikā ahosi atha thero tam sabbam attanā ca tena ca kathita niyāmena iva saṅgīti kāle
translated: and after taking leave of his father, he mounted his chariot and went to the deva-world. The Elder, having made that the occasion,🔽and having preached the Dhamma in detail to the assembled people, that Dhamma talk was beneficial🔽to the great multitude. Then the Elder announced all that to the compilers of the Dhamma,

original: dhammasaṅgāhakānaṃ ārocesi, te ca taṃ tathā saṅgahaṃ āropesunti.
analyzed: dhamma saṅgāhakānam ārocesi te ca tam tathā saṅgaham āropesunti

analyzed: yathā adhigate hassa ādi rase samenti samānenti iti atthaḥ attha ittha  naccanti atha ittha accharāḥ obhāsayanti iti evam gīta ādīni samarase karontiyaḥ atha aññā  ekaccā accharāḥ ettha etasmin tava rathe naccanti atha aññāḥ varitthiyaḥ uttamitthiyaḥ  naccam passantiyaḥ sarīra ubhāsena ca iva vattha ābharaṇa obhāsena ca ettha etasmin
translated: “They blend into one”: they become of one taste, of one flavour. Or alternatively, “they blend into one” means that they are made to be of one taste, of one flavour, by blending the sound of the lute with the sound of the song and the sound of the dance, not letting the joy-mood, etc., already obtained through the dance be lost. The meaning is that they blend, they make blend.

original: padese ubhato dvīsu passesu dasapi disā kevalaṃ obhāsayanti vijjotayantīti attho.
analyzed: padese ubhatas dvīsu passesu dasa api disā kevalam obhāsayanti vijjotayanti iti attho
translated: “Here they dance, here the celestial nymphs shine”: thus they make the songs, etc., of one taste. Then other celestial nymphs here in your chariot dance, and other excellent women, watching the dance, here in this place with the radiance of their own bodies and the radiance of their garments and ornaments illuminate, make shine, the ten directions on both sides, on the two sides.

original: 1036. Soti so tvaṃ evaṃbhūto. Tūriyagaṇappabodhanoti dibbatūriyasamūhena katapītipabodhano. Mahīyamānoti pūjīyamāno. Vajirāvudhorivāti indo viya.
analyzed: saḥ iti saḥ tvam evaṃbhūtaḥ tūriya gaṇa ppabodhanaḥ ti dibba tūriya samūhena kata pīti pabodhanaḥ mahīyamānaḥ iti indo indo
translated: So ti so. Tuvaṃ evaṃbhūto ti tuvaṃ evaṃbhūto. Tūriyagaṇappabodhano ti dibbatūriyasamūhena katapītipabodhano. Mahīyamānoti pūjīyamāno. Vajirāvudhorivāti indo viya.

original: 1037. Uposathaṃ kaṃ vā tuvaṃ upāvasīti aññehipi uposatho upavasīyati, tvaṃ kaṃ vā
analyzed: uposatham kam vā tuvam upāvasi iti uposathaḥ upavasīyati tvam kam vā
translated: Uposathaṃ kaṃ vā tuvaṃ upāvasīti aññehipi uposatho upavasīyati, tvaṃ kaṃ vā

original: kīdisaṃ nāma uposathaṃ upavasīti pucchati. Dhammacariyanti dānādipuññapaṭipattiṃ.
analyzed: kīdisam nāma uposatham upavasi iti pucchati dhamma cariyanti dāna ādi puñña paṭipattim
translated: kīdisaṃ nāma uposathaṃ upavasīti pucchati. Dhammacariyanti dānādipuññapaṭipattiṃ.

original: Vatanti vatasamādānaṃ. Abhirocayīti abhirocesi, ruccitvā pūresīti attho. “Abhirādhayī”tipi
analyzed: vatanti vata samādānam abhirocayi iti abhirocesi ruccitvā pūresi iti atthaḥ abhirādhayi iti pi
translated: Vatanti vatasamādānaṃ. Abhirocayīti abhirocesi, ruccitvā pūresīti attho. “Abhirādhayī”tipi

original: pāṭho, sādhesi nipphādesīti attho.
analyzed: pāṭhaḥ sādhesi nipphādesi iti attho
translated: pāṭho, sādhesi nipphādesīti attho.

original: 1038. Idanti nipātamattaṃ, idaṃ vā phalanti adhippāyo. Abhirocaseti abhibhavitvā vijjotasi.
analyzed: idam ti nipāta mattam idam vā phalanti adhippāyaḥ abhirocasā iti abhibhavitvā vijjotasi
translated: Idanti nipātamattaṃ, idaṃ vā phalanti adhippāyo. Abhirocaseti abhibhavitvā vijjotasi.

original: Evaṃ mahātherena puṭṭho devaputto tamatthaṃ ācikkhi. Tena vuttaṃ –
analyzed: evam mahā therena puṭṭhaḥ devaputto tam attham ācikkhi tena vuttam
translated: Evaṃ mahātherena puṭṭho devaputto tamatthaṃ ācikkhi. Tena vuttaṃ –

original: “So devaputto attamano, moggallānena pucchito;
analyzed: saḥ deva puttaḥ atta manaḥ moggallānena pucchito
translated: “So devaputto attamano, moggallānena pucchito;

original: Pañhaṃ puṭṭho viyākāsi, yassa kammassidaṃ phala”nti.
analyzed: pañham puṭṭhaḥ viyākāsi yassa kammassa idam phalanti
translated: Pañhaṃ puṭṭho viyākāsi, yassa kammassidaṃ phala”nti.🔽 Translation: So: you, thus being. Tūriyagaṇappabodhano: awakened by the sound of the divine musical instruments. Mahīyamāno: being worshipped. Vajirāvudhorivā: like Indra.🔽Uposathaṃ kaṃ vā tuvaṃ upāvasī: others also observe the Uposatha, which Uposatha do you observe?🔽Dhammacariyāti: the practice of giving, etc.🔽Vatanti: the undertaking of the vow. Abhirocayī: you delight in, you fulfil, having approved of, is the meaning. The reading is also “abhirādhayī” (I delight in), the meaning is: you accomplish, you bring about.🔽Idanti: this is merely a particle, the meaning is: this is the fruit. Abhirocase: you shine, having overcome.

original: “Jitindriyaṃ buddhamanomanikkamaṃ, naruttamaṃ kassapamaggapuggalaṃ;
analyzed: jitindriyam buddha manaḥ anikkamam naruttamam kassapa magga puggalam
translated: “With senses controlled, the Buddha, the mind’s supreme guide, the best of men, Kassapa, the foremost person on the path,

original: Avāpurantaṃ amatassa dvāraṃ, devātidevaṃ satapuññalakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: avāpuḥ antam amatassa dvāram devātidevam sata puñña lakkhaṇam
translated: Opening the door to the deathless, the god of gods, endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great man.

original: “Tamaddasaṃ kuñjaramoghatiṇṇaṃ, suvaṇṇasiṅgīnadabimbasādisaṃ;
analyzed: tam addasam kuñjara moghatiṇṇam suvaṇṇa siṅgī nada bimba sādisam
translated: “I saw him, the elephant, who had crossed the flood, who was like a golden statue with the color of a coral tree flower,

analyzed: disvāna tam khippa mahum sucīmano tam eva disvāna su bhāsita ddhajam
translated: And having seen him, I quickly became pure in mind, having seen him, the one who had the banner of good sayings.

original: “Tamannapānaṃ athavāpi cīvaraṃ, suciṃ paṇītaṃ rasasā upetaṃ;
analyzed: tam anna pānam athavā api cīvaram sucim paṇītam rasasā upetam
translated: “I offered him a drink and a robe, pure, excellent, and tasty,

original: Pupphābhikiṇṇamhi sake nivesane, patiṭṭhapesiṃ sa asaṅgamānaso.
analyzed: puppha abhikiṇṇamhi sake nivesane patiṭṭhapesim sa asaṅga mānaso
translated: And in my own house, strewn with flowers, I established him, my mind free from attachment.

original: “Tamannapānena ca cīvarena ca, khajjena bhojjena ca sāyanena ca;
analyzed: tam anna pānena ca cīvarena ca khajjena bhojjena ca sa ayanena ca
translated: “With a drink and a robe, with food and drink, with meals and refreshments,

original: Santappayitvā dvipadānamuttamaṃ, so saggaso devapure ramāmahaṃ.
analyzed: santappayitvā dvipa dānam uttamam saḥ saggasaḥ deva pure ramām aham
translated: Having satisfied the supreme one among men, I rejoice in the city of the gods, in the heaven of the Thirty-three.

original: “Etenupāyena imaṃ niraggaḷaṃ, yaññaṃ yajitvā tividhaṃ visuddhaṃ;
analyzed: etena upāyena imam niraggaḷam yaññam yajitvā tividham visuddham
translated: “By this means, having performed this open-air sacrifice, purified in three ways,
