analyzed: pahāya aham mānusakam samussayam indu upamaḥ deva pure ramām aham
translated: Having given up my human dwelling, I rejoice in the city of the gods, like the moon.”

original: “Āyuñca vaṇṇañca sukhaṃ balañca, paṇītarūpaṃ atikaṅkhatā muni;
analyzed: āyuḥ ca vaṇṇam ca sukham balam ca paṇīta rūpam ati kaṅkhatā muni
translated: The Sage has no desire for these.🔽Food and drink in abundance, well prepared,

original: Annañca pānañca bahuṃ susaṅkhataṃ, patiṭṭhapetabbamasaṅgamānase.
analyzed: annam ca pānam ca bahum su saṅkhatam patiṭṭhapetabbam asaṅga mānase
translated: Should be placed before him, with a mind free from stinginess.🔽“In this world or the next,

original: “Nayimasmiṃ loke parasmiṃ vā pana, buddhena seṭṭho va samo va vijjati;
analyzed: nayi imasmin loke parasmin vā pana buddhena seṭṭhaḥ va samaḥ va vijjati
translated: There is no one equal or similar to the Buddha.🔽He has gone to the highest worship of those worthy of worship,

original: Āhuneyyānaṃ paramāhutiṃ gato, puññatthikānaṃ vipulapphalesina”nti.
analyzed: āhuneyyānam parama āhutim gataḥ puññatthikānam vipula phala isinam ti
translated: For those seeking merit, the fruit of which is vast.”

original: 1041. Tattha jitindriyanti manacchaṭṭhānaṃ indriyānaṃ bodhimūleyeva aggamaggena jitattā
analyzed: tattha jitindriyam ti manaccha ṭṭhānam indriyānam bodhi mūleya iva aggamaggena jita ttā
translated: Here, “having conquered the faculties” means that at the foot of the Bodhi tree, by the supreme path, he conquered the six faculties beginning with the mind.

original: nibbisevanabhāvassa katattā jitindriyaṃ. Abhiññeyyādīnaṃ abhiññeyyādibhāvato anavasesato
analyzed: nibbisevana bhāvassa kata ttā jitindriyam abhiññeyya ādīnam abhiññeyya ādi bhāvataḥ anavasesataḥ
translated: Because he has made them easy to tend, he is one who has conquered the faculties.

original: abhisambuddhattā buddhaṃ. Puripuṇṇavīriyatāya anomanikkamaṃ caturaṅgasamannāgatassa
analyzed: abhisambuddha ttā buddham puripuṇṇa vīriya tāya an oma nikkamam catur aṅga samannāgatassa
translated: Because he has fully awakened to the entire range of what is to be directly known, beginning with the four noble truths, he is the Buddha.🔽Because he has fulfilled the four right efforts, which are the four aspects of energy endowed with the four factors, through the energy that is not inferior and is complete with the four factors, he is the Buddha.

original: vīriyassa catubbidhasammappadhānassa ca pāripūriyāti attho. Naruttamanti narānaṃ
analyzed: vīriyassa catubbidha sammappadhānassa ca pāripūriyā atthaḥ naruttamanti
translated: “Best of men” means the best of men, the supreme of bipeds.

original: uttamaṃ dvipaduttamaṃ. Kassapanti bhagavantaṃ gottena vadati. Avāpurantaṃ amatassa
analyzed: uttamam dvipad uttamam kassapanti bhagavantam gottena vadati avāpuḥ antam amatassa
translated: “Kassapa” is the Blessed One’s clan name. “Who has attained” means who has attained the deathless.

original: dvāranti koṇāgamanassa bhagavato sāsanantaradhānato pabhuti pihitaṃ nibbānamahānagarassa🔽dvāraṃ ariyamaggaṃ vivarantaṃ. Devātidevanti sabbesampi devānaṃ atidevaṃ. Satapuññalakkhaṇanti
analyzed: koṇāgamanassa bhagavato sāsana antaradhānataḥ pabhuti pihitam nibbāna mahā nagarassa  dvāram ariya maggam vivarantam deva atidevanti sabbesam pi devānam atidevam sata puñña lakkhaṇanti
translated: The two doors: the door of the city of Nibbāna, which was closed from the time of the arrival of the Koṇḍañña Buddha and the disappearance of the Dispensation of the Blessed One,

original: anekasatapuññavasena nibbattamahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ.🔽1042. Kuñjaranti kilesapaṭisattunimmaddanena kuñjarasadisaṃ, mahānāganti attho. Catunnaṃ
analyzed: aneka sata puñña vasena nibbatta mahāpurisa lakkhaṇam  kuñjaranti kilesa paṭisattu nimmaddanena kuñjara sadisam mahā nāgam ti attho
translated: was opened by him, revealing the Noble Path. The god of gods: the god above all gods. The characteristics of a hundred merits: the characteristics of a Great Man, which arose through many hundreds of merits.

original: oghānaṃ saṃsāramahoghassa taritattā oghatiṇṇaṃ. Suvaṇṇasiṅgīnadabimbasādisanti siṅgīsuvaṇṇajambunadasuvaṇṇarūpasadisaṃ,🔽kañcanasannibhattacanti attho. Disvāna taṃ khippamahuṃ sucīmanoti taṃ kassapasammāsambuddhaṃ
analyzed: oghānam saṃsāra mahā oghassa tarita ttā ogha tiṇṇam suvaṇṇa siṅgī nada bimba sādisanti siṅgī suvaṇṇa jambu nada suvaṇṇa rūpa sadisam  atthaḥ disvāna tam khippa mahum tam kassapa sammāsambuddham
translated: The elephant: like an elephant in the crushing of the enemy of defilements; the meaning is, the Great Man. Having crossed the four floods: having crossed the great flood of saṃsāra. Like a golden palm tree: like a golden palm tree, like a golden statue of a palm tree;🔽the meaning is, like a golden mountain. Having seen him, I quickly became pure: having seen that Perfectly Enlightened One Kassapa,

original: disvā khippaṃ tāvadeva “sammāsambuddho bhagavā”ti pasādavasena kilesamalāpagamanena
analyzed: disvā khippam tāvat eva sammāsambuddhaḥ bhagavā ati pasāda vasena kilesa mala apagamanena
translated: I quickly became pure, that is, I became pure in faith, by the removal of the stain of defilement, by the thought: “The Blessed One is a Perfectly Enlightened One.”

original: sucimano visuddhamano ahosiṃ, tañca kho tameva disvāna taṃ disvā eva. Subhāsitaddhajanti dhammaddhajaṃ.
analyzed: suci mano visuddha mano ahosim tat ca kho tam eva disvāna tam disvā eva su bhāsita dhajanti dhamma ddhajam
translated: I was of pure mind, of clear mind, having seen that, having seen only that. ‘The banner of good words’ means the banner of Dhamma.

original: 1043. Tamannapānanti tamhi bhagavati annañca pānañca. Athavāpi cīvaranti atha cīvarampi.
analyzed: tam anna pānanti tamhi bhagavati annam ca pānanti athavā api cīvaranti atha cīvarampi
translated: . ‘I gave him food and drink’: I gave him food and drink to the Fortunate One. Or else ‘and clothes’ means and clothes as well.

original: Rasasā upetanti rasena upetaṃ sādurasaṃ, uḷāranti attho. Pupphābhikiṇṇamhīti ganthitehi
analyzed: rasasā upetanti rasena upetam sādu rasam uḷāram ti attho puppha abhikiṇṇamhi iti ganthitehi
translated: ‘And with flavours’: with flavour, with good flavour, with excellent flavour, is the meaning. ‘And with flowers’: strewn with flowers,

original: ca aganthikehi ca pupphehi olambanavasena santharaṇavasena ca abhikiṇṇe. Patiṭṭhapesinti
analyzed: ca aganthikehi ca pupphehi olambana vasena santharaṇa vasena ca abhikiṇṇe patiṭṭhapesinti
translated: hanging down, and spread out, with both bound and unbound flowers. ‘I established’:

original: paṭipādesiṃ adāsiṃ. Asaṅgamānasoti katthaci alaggacitto so ahanti yojanā.
analyzed: a dāsim a saṅga mānasaḥ ti katthaci a lagga citto saḥ aham ti yojanā
translated: I established, I gave, I offered. ‘With a mind free from attachment’: with a mind not stuck anywhere, is the meaning.

original: 1044. Saggasoti aparāparūpapattivasena sagge sagge, tatthāpi ca devapure sudassanamahānagare. Ramāmīti kīḷāmi modāmi.
analyzed: saggaso ti apara apara upapatti vasena sagge sagge tattha api ca devapure sudassana mahā nagare ramāmi iti kīḷāmi modāmi
translated: . ‘In heaven after heaven’: in heaven after heaven through rebirth after rebirth, and in that heavenly city of Sudassana. ‘I rejoice’: I play, I delight.

original: 1045. Etenupāyenāti gopālabrāhmaṇakāle sasāvakasaṅghassa kassapabhagavato yathā asadisadānaṃ
analyzed: etena upāyena ati gopāla brāhmaṇa kāle sa sāvaka saṅghassa kassapa bhagavataḥ yathā asadisa dānam
translated: . ‘By this means’: by the gift of incomparable alms to the Fortunate One Kassapa, together with his community of disciples, at the time of the Gopaka-Brahmin (birth).

original: adāsiṃ, etena upāyena. Imaṃ niraggaḷaṃ yaññaṃ yajitvā tividhaṃ visuddhanti anāvaṭadvāratāya🔽muttacāgatāya ca niraggaḷaṃ, tīsupi kālesu tīhi dvārehi karaṇakārāpanānussaraṇavidhīhi
analyzed: adāsim etena upāyena imam niraggaḷam yaññam yajitvā tividham an āvaṭa dvāra tāya  ca niraggaḷam tīsu pi kālesu tīhi dvārehi karaṇa kārāpana anussaraṇa vidhīhi
translated: because of the absence of a revolving door,🔽because of the freedom from coming and going,🔽because of the possession of the method of remembering the performance by the three doors at the three times,

original: sampannatāya tividhaṃ, tattha saṃkilesābhāvena visuddhaṃ aparimitadhanapariccāgabhāvena
analyzed: sampanna tāya tividham tattha saṃkilesa abhāvena visuddham aparimita dhana pariccāga bhāvena
translated: purified because of the absence of defilement,

original: mahācāgatāya yaññaṃ yajitvā, mahādānaṃ datvāti attho. Taṃ pana dānaṃ cirakatampi
analyzed: mahācāgatāya yaññam yajitvā mahādānam da tvā ati tam pana dānam cira katam pi
translated: having sacrificed the sacrifice, having given the great gift, because of the great honour of the giving away of immeasurable wealth. But that gift, though done long ago,🔽because of the greatness of the field, the object, and the mind,

original: khettavatthucittānaṃ uḷāratāya antarantarā anussaraṇena attano pākaṭaṃ āsannaṃ paccakkhaṃ
analyzed: khetta vatthu cittānam uḷāra tāya antar antarā anussaraṇena attanaḥ pākaṭam āsannam paccakkham
translated: remembering it from time to time, as if it were present,

original: viya upaṭṭhitaṃ gahetvā āha “ima”nti.🔽1046. Evaṃ devaputto attanā katakammaṃ therassa kathetvā idāni tādisāya sampattiyā
analyzed: viyas upaṭṭhitam gahetvā āha iman ti  evam devaputtaḥ attanā kata kammam therassa kathetvā idāni tādisāya sampattiyā
translated: near, and manifest, he said “this.”

original: parepi patiṭṭhāpetukāmataṃ tathāgate ca uttamaṃ attano pasādabahumānaṃ pavedento
analyzed: pare pi tathāgate ca uttamam pasāda bahu mānam
translated: Thus the deva son, having told the Elder his own deed, now, desiring to establish others in such an attainment, and showing the utmost confidence and respect in the Realised One,🔽said:

original: “āyuñca vaṇṇañcā”tiādinā gāthādvayamāha. Tattha abhikaṅkhatāti icchantena. Munīti theraṃ ālapati.
analyzed: āyuṃ ca vaṇṇañca ati ādinā gāthā dvayam āha tattha icchantena muni iti theram ālapati
translated: He spoke the two verses beginning with “Life and beauty” . Herein, if he wishes is if he desires. Sage is an address to the Elder.

original: 1047. Nayimasmiṃ loketi devaputto attano paccakkhabhūtaṃ lokaṃ vadati. Parasminti🔽tato aññasmiṃ. Etena sabbepi sadevake loke dasseti. Samo ca vijjatīti seṭṭho tāva🔽tiṭṭhatu, samo eva na vijjatīti attho. Āhuneyyānaṃ paramāhutiṃ gatoti imasmiṃ loke
analyzed: na yimasmin loke iti deva putto attanaḥ paccakkha bhūtam lokam vadati parasmin ti  tatas aññasmin etena sabbe api sa devake loke dasseti samaḥ ca vijjati iti seṭṭho tāva  tiṭṭhatu samaḥ eva na vijjati iti attho āhuneyyānam parama āhutim gataḥ ti imasmin loke
translated: In this world is the world that is evident to the god. In the other is🔽in the one other than that. By this he shows all the worlds with the gods. And equal is not found is not found even equal to him, so what to say of better?

original: yattakā āhuneyyā nāma, tesu sabbesu paramāhutiṃ paramaṃ āhuneyyabhāvaṃ gato. “Dakkhiṇeyyānaṃ
analyzed: yattakāḥ āhuneyyāḥ nāma tesu sabbesu parama āhutim paramam āhuneyya bhāvam gataḥ dakkhiṇeyyānam
translated: Gone to the supreme offering of those worthy of gifts is gone to the supreme offering, to the state of being the most worthy of gifts, among all those worthy of gifts in this world.

original: paramaggataṃ gato”ti vā pāṭho, tattha paramaggatanti paramaṃ aggabhāvaṃ, aggadakkhiṇeyyabhāvanti🔽attho. Kesanti āha “puññatthikānaṃ vipulapphalesina”nti, puññena atthikānaṃ vipulaṃ
analyzed: param agga tam gataḥ iti vā pāṭhaḥ tattha paramam agga bhāvam agga dakkhiṇeyya bhāvanti  āha puññatthikānam vipula phala isinam ti puññena atthikānam vipulam
translated: Or there is the reading “Gone to the supreme state of those worthy of gifts” . Herein, supreme state is supreme foremost state. The meaning is: to the state of being the most worthy of gifts.

original: mahantaṃ puññaphalaṃ icchantānaṃ, tathāgato eva lokassa puññakkhettanti dasseti.
analyzed: mahantam puñña phalam icchantānam tathāgataḥ eva lokassa puñña khettanti dasseti
translated: Hair is said in the verse “For those who seek merit, who seek the fruit of great fruit” . For those who seek merit, who desire the fruit of great merit, the Tathāgata is the field of merit for the world.

original: Keci pana “āhuneyyānaṃ paramaggataṃ gato”ti paṭhanti, soyevattho.
analyzed: keci pana āhuneyyānam paramaggatam gataḥ ti paṭhanti
translated: Some read “gone to the highest place of honour,” but the meaning is the same.

original: Evaṃ kathentameva taṃ thero kallacittaṃ muducittaṃ vinīvaraṇacittaṃ udaggacittaṃ
analyzed: evam kathentam eva tam thero kalla cittam mudu cittam vinīvaraṇa cittam udagga cittam

analyzed: sovaṇṇa maye pabbatasmim vimānam sabbata upabham
translated: “On a golden mountain, a mansion all aglow,

translated: With eight well-fashioned pillars, all of cat’s eye gem,

translated: Of coral, of pearl, and of ruby,

translated: Or else of reverential salutation: tell me this, when asked.”

translated: He replied with these verses:

analyzed: sabbe veḷuriya āmayā ti sabbe thambhāḥ veḷuriya maṇi mayāḥ tattha pana ekam ekāya
translated: All of crystal means all the pillars are of crystal gems. Herein, in each one of the crystal gems

analyzed: aṃsiyā ti aṭṭhaṃsesu thambhesu ekam ekasmin aṃsa bhāge ratanā satta nimmitā ati satta ratana kamma nimmitā
translated: Aṃsi means in the eight-spoked (wheel) in each of the four directions. Ratanā satta nimmitā means made of the seven precious substances.

analyzed: ekekaḥ aṃsaḥ satta ratana mayaḥ ti attho  veḷūriya suvaṇṇassa ati ādinā nānā ratanāni dasseti tattha veḷūriya suvaṇṇassa ati

original: 1137. Na tatthuddhaṃsatī rajoti maṇimayabhūmikattā na tasmiṃ vimāne rajo uggacchati.🔽Gopānasīgaṇāti gopānasīsamūhā. Pītāti pītavaṇṇā, suvaṇṇamayā ceva phussarāgādimaṇimayā
analyzed: na maṇi maya bhūmikattā na tasmin vimāne rajaḥ uggacchati  gopānasī gaṇā ati gopānasī samūhā pītā ati pīta vaṇṇā suvaṇṇa mayā ca iva phussa rāga ādi maṇi mayā
translated: Na tatthuddhaṃsatī rajo means in that mansion no dust arises, because the floor is made of precious substances.🔽Gopānasīgaṇāti gopānasīsamūhā means a collection of gopānasīs. Pītāti pītavaṇṇā means yellow-coloured. The meaning is: made of gold and phussarāga gems and so on.

original: cāti attho. Kūṭaṃ dhārentīti sattaratanamayaṃ kaṇṇikaṃ dhārenti.
analyzed: ca ati kūṭam dhārenti iti satta ratana mayam kaṇṇikam dhārenti
translated: Kūṭaṃ dhārentī means they bear a jewel-made pinnacle.

original: 1138-9. Nānāratanagabbhehīti nānāratanamayehi ovarakehi. Vediyāti vedikā. Catassoti catūsu disāsu catasso. Tenāha “samantā caturo disā”ti.
analyzed: nānā ratana gabbhehi iti nānā ratana mayehi ovarakehi vediyā ati vedikā catasso iti catūsu disāsu catasso tena āha samantā caturaḥ disā iti
translated: ‘With many a jewel-studded chamber’: with many a chamber made of various jewels. ‘With a balustrade’: with a parapet. ‘Four’: in the four directions. Hence he said ‘in the four directions all around’.

original: 1140. Mahappabhoti mahājutiko. Udayantoti uggacchanto. Bhāṇumāti ādicco.
analyzed: mahappabhaḥ ti mahā jutikaḥ udayantaḥ iti uggacchantaḥ bhāṇumā ati ādiccaḥ
translated: ‘The great sun’: the one of great radiance. ‘Rising’: ascending. ‘The sun’: the sun.

original: 1143. Sehi pāṇibhīti kāyasāraṃ puññaṃ pasavanto attano pāṇīhi taṃ taṃ kiccaṃ karonto🔽vihāraṃ satthu kāresinti yojanā. Atha vā sehi pāṇibhīti tattha andhakavindasmiṃ gandhañca
analyzed: sehi pāṇibhi iti kāya sāram puññam pasavantaḥ attanaḥ pāṇīhi tam tam kiccam karontaḥ  vihāram satthu kāresinti yojanā atha vā sehi pāṇibhi iti tattha andhaka vindasmim gandham ca
translated: ‘With my own hands’: making various things with my own hands, producing merit which is the essence of the body.

original: mālañca paccayañca vilepanañca pūjāvasena. Yathā kathaṃ? Vihārañca vippasannena cetasā
analyzed: mālañca paccayañca vilepanañca pūjā vasena yathā katham vihārañca vippasannena cetasā
translated: ‘I had the Master’s dwelling built’: the construction is by implication. Or alternatively, ‘with my own hands’ means ‘in that place, in the Andhakavinda, with perfumes, garlands, requisites, and ointments for anointing, for the purpose of worship’. In what way? ‘And with a mind of faith’

original: satthuno adāsiṃ pūjesiṃ niyyādesiṃ cāti evamettha yojanā veditabbā.
analyzed: satthunaḥ adāsim pūjesim niyyādesim ca ati evam ettha yojanā veditabbā
translated: ‘I gave the dwelling to the Master, I worshipped, I dedicated’. This is how the construction should be understood here.

original: 1144. Tenāti tena yathāvuttena puññakammena kāraṇabhūtena. Mayhanti mayā. Idanti idaṃ puññaphalaṃ, idaṃ vā dibbaṃ ādhipateyyaṃ. Tenāha “vasaṃ vattemī”ti.

translated: ‘By that’: by that deed of merit stated thus, which was the cause. ‘Mine’: by me. ‘This’: this fruit of merit, or this lordship over the devas. Hence he said ‘I rule’.

analyzed: dibbā saddāti ādīsu pi esa iva nayaḥ

translated: The letter Ma is a word-divider. With webbed fingers and toes: with fingers and toes that are joined by webs. analyzed: nibbatti uḷārā cassa dibba sampattiyaḥ pāturahesum tena vuttam tassa iva ānubhāvena ati

analyzed: ṭhāna gatassa pasāda maya puññassa balena devaḥ deva puramhi vā ati tāvatiṃsa bhavane sakkaḥ devarājā viya

analyzed: evam devaputtaḥ yathā adhigatāya anāgatāya bhava sampattiyā kāraṇa bhūtam

translated: “You are a fool, student, to ask for what cannot be had.

original: Maññāmi tuvaṃ marissasi, na hi tvaṃ lacchasi candasūriye”ti.
analyzed: maññāmi tuvam marissasi na hi tvam lacchasi canda sūriya iti
translated: I think you will die, for you will never get the sun and moon.”

original: Atha naṃ māṇavo “kiṃ pana paññāyamānassatthāya rodanto bālo hoti, udāhu apaññāyamānassā”ti vatvā –
analyzed: atha nam māṇavaḥ kim pana paññāyamānassa atthāya rodantaḥ bālaḥ hoti udāhu a paññāyamānassa ati vatvā
translated: “Is one a fool,” asked the student, “if one cries out in pain when one is hurt, or is one a fool if one does not know that one is hurt?”

original: “Gamanāgamanampi dissati, vaṇṇadhātu ubhayattha vīthiyā;
analyzed: gamana āgamanam pi dissati vaṇṇa dhātu ubhayattha vīthiyā
translated: “One sees the coming and going, the color and the form,

original: Peto kālakato na dissati, ko nidha kandataṃ bālyataro”ti.
analyzed: kālakataḥ na dissati kaḥ
translated: but when the dead man is gone, one sees him no more. Who is more foolish than he who weeps and wails?”

original: Taṃ sutvā brāhmaṇo “yuttaṃ esa vadatī”ti sallakkhetvā –
analyzed: tam sutvā brāhmaṇaḥ yuttam esa vadati iti
translated: When the brahmin heard this, he thought, “He speaks rightly,” and he said:

original: “Saccaṃ kho vadesi māṇava, ahameva kandataṃ bālyataro;
analyzed: saccam kho vadesi māṇava aham eva kandatam bālyataraḥ
translated: “You speak the truth, young man. I am the more foolish of the two.

original: Candaṃ viya dārako rudaṃ, petaṃ kālakatābhipatthayi”nti. –
analyzed: candam viya dārakaḥ rudam petam
translated: Like a child crying for the moon, I was hoping for the dead man’s return.”

original: Vatvā tassa kathāya nissoko hutvā māṇavassa thutiṃ karonto imā gāthā abhāsi –
analyzed: vatvā tassa kathāya nissokaḥ hutvā māṇavassa thutim karontaḥ imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāsi
translated: Having thus acknowledged the young man’s words, he praised him, saying:🔽“As if a burning, blazing fire🔽Were quenched by water,

original: “Ādittaṃ vata maṃ santaṃ, ghatasittaṃva pāvakaṃ;🔽Vārinā viya osiñcaṃ, sabbaṃ nibbāpaye daraṃ.
analyzed: ādittam vata mam santam pāvakam  vārinā viya osiñcam sabbam nibbāpaye daram
translated: So you have quenched my fever.🔽“The dart that lay within my heart,

original: “Abbahī vata me sallaṃ, sokaṃ hadayanissitaṃ;
analyzed: abbahi vata me sallam sokam hadaya nissitam
translated: The dart that was lodged in my mind,🔽The dart that was deep in my heart,

original: Yo me sokaparetassa, puttasokaṃ apānudi.
analyzed: yaḥ me soka paretassa putta sokam apānudi
translated: You have drawn out, young man.🔽“I am freed from the dart, cooled,

original: “Svāhaṃ abbūḷhasallosmi, sītibhūtosmi nibbuto;
analyzed: svāham abbūḷha sallaḥ asmi sīti bhūtaḥ asmi nibbutaḥ
translated: And I am quenched, young man.🔽I do not grieve, I do not weep,

original: Na socāmi na rodāmi, tava sutvāna māṇavā”ti.🔽1208-10. Tattha rathapañjaroti rathūpatthaṃ. Na vindāmīti na labhāmi. Bhaddamāṇavāti
analyzed: na socāmi na rodāmi tava sutvāna māṇavāti  ratha pañjarā uti rathūpattham na vindāmi iti na labhāmi bhadda māṇava ati
translated: Having heard your words.”

original: ālapanaṃ. Paṭipādayāmīti sampādetvā dadāmi, mā cakkayugābhāvena jīvitaṃ jahīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: ālapanam paṭipādayāmi iti sampādetvā dadāmi mā cakka yuga abhāvena jīvitam jahi iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: Herein, the chariot’s axle is the chariot’s axle-tree. I do not find is I do not get. Blessed young man is an address. I will provide is I will give after making ready. Do not give up life through the absence of a pair of wheels is the meaning.

original: Ubhayettha dissareti ubhopi ettha candasūriyā ākāse dissanti. Ya-kāro padasandhikaro,
analyzed: ubhayā ittha dissarā iti ubho api ettha canda sūriyā ākāse dissanti yakāro pada sandhi karo
translated: Both are seen here: both the moon and the sun are seen in the sky here. The syllable ya is a word-connector.

original: ubhaye etthāti vā padavibhāgo.
analyzed: ubhaye ettha ati vā pada vibhāgaḥ
translated: Or the analysis of the words is: “Both are here.”

original: 1212. Gamanāgamananti divase divase ogamanuggamanavasena candasūriyānaṃ gamanaṃ āgamanañca
analyzed: gamana āgamanam ti divase divase canda sūriyānam gamanam āgamanam ca
translated: Coming and going: the coming and going of the moon and sun by way of setting and rising

original: dissati. “Gamanogamana”ntipi pāḷi, uggamanaṃ ogamanañcāti attho. Vaṇṇadhātūti sītibhāvavisiṭṭhā
analyzed: dissati gamana ugamanam tipi uggamanam ogamanam ca ati atthaḥ vaṇṇa dhātū ti sīti bhāva visiṭṭhā
translated: is seen day after day. The reading is also “gamanogamana,” the meaning being “rising and setting.” The color-elements: the color-appearances that are distinguished by coolness

original: kantabhāvabhāsurā, uṇhabhāvavisiṭṭhā tikkhabhāvabhāsurā ca vaṇṇanibhā. Ubhayatthāti
analyzed: kanta bhāva bhāsurā uṇha bhāva visiṭṭhā tikkha bhāva bhāsurā ca vaṇṇa nibhā ubhayattha ati
translated: and that shine with the nature of loveliness, and those that are distinguished by heat and that shine with the nature of sharpness. Both here:

original: cande sūriye cāti dvīsupi vaṇṇadhātu dissatīti yojetabbaṃ. Vīthiyāti pavattanavīthiyaṃ
analyzed: cande sūriye ca ati dvīsu pi vaṇṇa dhātu dissati iti yojetabbam vīthiyā ti pavattana vīthiyam
translated: in the moon and in the sun. The color-elements are seen in both, thus should be construed. In the path: in the path of appearance

original: ākāse, nāgavīthiyādivīthiyaṃ vā. “Ubhayetthā”tipi pāṭho, ubhaye etthāti padavisandhi.
analyzed: ākāse nāga vīthiyā ādi vīthiyam vā ubhaya itthā atipi pāṭhaḥ ubhaye etthā iti pada visandhi
translated: in the sky, or in the path of the nāga’s path, etc. The reading is also “ubhayettha,” the analysis of the words being: “both are here.”

original: Bālyataroti bālataro atisayena bālo.
analyzed: bālyataraḥ iti bālataraḥ atisayena bālaḥ
translated: More foolish: more foolish, extremely foolish.

original: 1213. Imaṃ pana kathaṃ sutvā “alabbhanīyavatthuṃ vatāhaṃ patthetvā kevalaṃ sokagginā
analyzed: imam pana katham sutvā a labbhanīya vatthum vata aham patthetvā kevalam sokagginā
translated: Having heard this, however, the king thought: “I have asked for something that cannot be obtained. I am only burning with the fire of sorrow.

original: ḍayhāmi, kiṃ me niratthakena anayabyasanenā”ti paṭisaṅkhāne aṭṭhāsi. Atha devaputto
analyzed: ḍayhāmi kim me niratthakena anaya byasanena ati paṭisaṅkhāne aṭṭhāsi atha devaputto
translated: I am burning, what have I to do with unprofitable loss?” and he stood firm in reflection. Then the deva

original: maṭṭhakuṇḍalīrūpaṃ paṭisaṃharitvā attano dibbarūpeneva aṭṭhāsi. Brāhmaṇo pana taṃ
analyzed: maṭṭhakuṇḍalī rūpam paṭisaṃharitvā attanaḥ dibba rūpena iva aṭṭhāsi brāhmaṇaḥ pana tam
translated: discarded the form of the corpse and stood in his own divine form. But the brahmin,

original: anoloketvā māṇavavohāreneva voharanto “saccaṃ kho vadesi māṇavā”tiādimāha. Tattha
analyzed: māṇava vohārena iva voharantaḥ saccam kho vadesi māṇava ati ādim āha tattha
translated: without looking at him, and speaking in the student’s voice, said, “You speak the truth, student.” Herein,

original: candaṃ viya dārako rudanti candaṃ abhipatthayaṃ rudanto dārako viyāti attho. Kālakatābhipatthayinti
analyzed: candam viya dārakaḥ rudanti candam abhipatthayam rudantaḥ dārakaḥ viya ati
translated: a child who cries for the moon, crying with the desire for the moon, is like a child who cries, desiring the moon. Desiring death

original: kālakataṃ abhipatthayiṃ. “Abhipatthaya”ntipi pāṭho.
analyzed: kālakatam abhipatthayim abhipatthayanti pi
translated: is desiring death. The reading is also “desiring.”

original: 1214-5. Ādittanti sokagginā ādittaṃ. Nibbāpaye daranti nibbāpayi darathaṃ sokapariḷāhaṃ. Abbahīti uddhari.
analyzed: ādittam iti sokagginā ādittam nibbāpaye daranti nibbāpayi daratham soka pariḷāham abbahi iti uddhari
translated: – Burning: burning with the fire of grief. I shall extinguish: I shall extinguish the fever of grief and sorrow. I shall remove: I shall take out.

original: Atha brāhmaṇo sokaṃ vinodetvā attano upadesadāyakaṃ dibbarūpena ṭhitaṃ disvā “ko nāma tva”nti pucchanto –
analyzed: atha brāhmaṇaḥ sokam vinodetvā attanaḥ upadesa dāyakam dibba rūpena ṭhitam disvā kaḥ nāma tvanti pucchantaḥ
translated: Then the brahmin, having dispelled his grief, saw the one standing in divine form who had given him advice, and asking, “Who are you?” he said,🔽“Are you a deva or a gandhabba,

original: “Devatā nusi gandhabbo, adu sakko purindado;
analyzed: devatā nusi gandhabbaḥ adu sakkaḥ purindadaḥ
translated: or Sakka, the giver of boons?

original: Ko vā tvaṃ kassa vā putto, kathaṃ jānemu taṃ maya”nti. –
analyzed: kaḥ vā tvam kassa vā putto katham jānemu tam mayanti
translated: Who are you? Whose son? How may we know you?”

original: Āha. Sopi tassa –
analyzed: āha saḥ upi tassa
translated: He replied,

original: “Yañca kandasi yañca rodasi, puttaṃ āḷāhane sayaṃ dahitvā;
analyzed: yat ca kandasi yat ca rodasi puttam āḷāhane sayam dahitvā
translated: “You weep and wail because of your son, whom you yourself burned in the fire.

original: Svāhaṃ kusalaṃ karitvā kammaṃ, tidasānaṃ sahabyataṃ gato”ti. –
analyzed: svāham kusalam karitvā kammam tidasānam sahabyatam gataḥ iti
translated: I have done good deeds and have gone to the company of the Thirty-Three Gods.”

original: Attānaṃ kathesi. Tattha yañca kandasi yañca rodasīti yaṃ tava puttaṃ maṭṭhakuṇḍaliṃ uddissa rodasi, assūni muñcasi.
analyzed: attānam kathesi tattha yam ca kandasi yam ca rodasi iti yam tava puttam maṭṭha kuṇḍalim uddissa rodasi assūni muñcasi
translated: He told his own story. There, “You weep and wail” means you weep and shed tears because of your son, the curly-haired child.

original: Atha naṃ brāhmaṇo āha –
analyzed: atha nam brāhmaṇaḥ āha
translated: Then the brahmin said,

original: “Appaṃ vā bahuṃ vā nāddasāma, dānaṃ dadantassa sake agāre;
analyzed: appam vā bahum vā na addasāma dānam dadantassa sake agāre
translated: “Whether it was little or much, we did not see you giving a gift in your own house.

original: Uposathakammaṃ vā tādisaṃ, kena kammena gatosi devaloka”nti.
analyzed: uposatha kammam vā tādisam kena kammena gataḥ asi deva lokan ti
translated: We did not see you doing such a Uposatha observance. By what deed did you go to the world of the gods?”

original: Tattha “uposathakammaṃ vā tādisaṃ nāddasāmā”ti yojanā.
analyzed: tattha uposatha kammam vā tādisam na addasāma iti yojanā
translated: There, the interpretation is “We did not see you doing such a Uposatha observance.”

original: Atha naṃ māṇavo āha –
analyzed: atha nam māṇavaḥ āha
translated: Then the student said,

original: “Ābādhikohaṃ dukkhito gilāno, āturarūpomhi sake nivesane;
analyzed: ābādhikaḥ aham dukkhitaḥ gilānaḥ ātura rūpaḥ mhi sake nivesane
translated: “I was sick, suffering, and afflicted, lying in my own house in a critical condition.

original: Buddhaṃ vigatarajaṃ vitiṇṇakaṅkhaṃ, addakkhiṃ sugataṃ anomapaññaṃ.
analyzed: buddham vigata rajam vitiṇṇa kaṅkham addakkhim sugatam a noma paññam
translated: I saw the Buddha, who is free from dust, has crossed over doubt, is the Well-Gone, and has unsurpassed wisdom.

original: “Svāhaṃ muditamano pasannacitto, añjaliṃ akariṃ tathāgatassa;
analyzed: svāham mudita manaḥ pasanna cittaḥ añjalim akarim tathāgatassa
translated: “With glad heart and serene, I raised my joined palms to the Tathāgata.

original: Tāhaṃ kusalaṃ karitvāna kammaṃ, tidasānaṃ sahabyataṃ gato”ti.🔽1220-21. Tattha ābādhikoti ābādhasamaṅgī. Dukkhitoti teneva ābādhikabhāvena jātadukkho.
analyzed: tā aham kusalam karitvāna kammam tidasānam sahabyatam gataḥ uti  tattha ābādhikaḥ ti ābādha samaṅgī dukkhitaḥ ti tena iva ābādhika bhāvena jāta dukkhaḥ
translated: Having done this good deed, I have gone to the company of the Thirty-Three Gods.”🔽Herein, afflicted with disease means possessed of disease. Suffering means suffering born of that very state of being afflicted with disease.

original: Gilānoti gilāyamānoti attho. Āturarūpoti dukkhavedanābhitunnakāyo. Vigatarajanti
analyzed: gilāno ti gilāyamāno ti attho ātura rūpo ti dukkha vedanā abhitunna kāyaḥ
translated: Sick means one who is sick.🔽Deprived of joy means deprived of joy in the sense of delight.

original: vigatarāgādirajaṃ. Vitiṇṇakaṅkhanti sabbaso saṃsayānaṃ samucchinnattā tiṇṇavicikicchaṃ.
analyzed: vigata rāga ādi rajam sabbasas saṃsayānam samucchinna ttā tiṇṇa vicikiccham
translated: With doubts crossed out means with doubts completely cut out.

original: Anomapaññanti paripuṇṇapaññaṃ, sabbaññunti attho. Akarinti akāsiṃ. Tāhanti taṃ ahaṃ.
analyzed: anoma paññam ti paripuṇṇa paññam sabbaññunti attho akarinti akāsim tāhan ti tam aham
translated: With unsurpassed understanding means with complete understanding. The meaning is: all-knowing. I did means I did.

original: Evaṃ tasmiṃ kathenteyeva brāhmaṇassa sakalasarīraṃ pītiyā paripūri. So taṃ pītiṃ pavedento –
analyzed: evam tasmin brāhmaṇassa sakala sarīram pītiyā paripūri saḥ tam pītim
translated: Even as he was speaking thus, the whole body of the brahmin was filled with happiness. Expressing that happiness, he said:

original: “Acchariyaṃ vata abbhutaṃ vata,
analyzed: acchariyam vata abbhutam vata
translated: “How wonderful! How marvellous!

original: Añjalikammassa ayamīdiso vipāko;
analyzed: añjali kammassa ayam īdisaḥ vipākaḥ
translated: This is the result of the act of raising the joined palms.

original: Ahampi muditamano pasannacitto,
analyzed: aham pi mudita manaḥ pasanna cittaḥ
translated: With glad heart and serene,

original: Ajjeva buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ vajāmī”ti. – āha;
analyzed: ajjā iva buddham saraṇam vajāmi iti āha
translated: Even today I go for refuge to the Buddha.”

original: Tattha anabhiṇhappavattitāya accharaṃ paharituṃ yogganti acchariyaṃ, abhūtapubbatāya
analyzed: tattha an abhiṇha pavatti tāya accharam paharitum acchariyam a bhūta pubba tāya
translated: it is a marvel because it has never happened before.

original: abbhutaṃ. Ubhayenapi vimhayāvahataṃyeva dassetvā “ahampi muditamano pasannacitto,
analyzed: abbhutam ubhayena api dassetvā aham pi mudita manaḥ pasanna cittaḥ
translated: After showing that he was struck with wonder and amazement by both, he said, “I am glad and pleased,

original: ajjeva buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ vajāmī”ti āha.
analyzed: ajjā iva buddham saraṇam vajāmi iti āha
translated: and today I go for refuge to the Enlightened One.”

original: Atha naṃ devaputto saraṇagamane sīlasamādāne ca niyojento –
analyzed: atha nam devaputto saraṇa gamane sīla samādāne ca niyojento
translated: Then the deity, in order to induce him to go for refuge and to undertake the precepts, said:🔽“Today go for refuge to the Enlightened One,

original: “Ajjeva buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ vajāhi, dhammañca saṅghañca pasannacitto;
analyzed: ajjā iva buddham saraṇam vajāhi dhammañca saṅghañca pasanna cittaḥ
translated: and to the Dhamma and the Community of monks, with a mind full of faith.🔽And likewise undertake the five training precepts,

original: Tatheva sikkhāya padāni pañca, akhaṇḍaphullāni samādiyassu.
analyzed: tathā iva sikkhāya padāni pañca akhaṇḍa phullāni samādiyassu
translated: complete and pure.

original: “Pāṇātipātā viramassu khippaṃ, loke adinnaṃ parivajjayassu;
analyzed: pāṇa atipātāḥ viramassu khippam loke adinnam parivajjayassu
translated: “Abstain from taking life, from taking what is not given,

original: Amajjapo mā ca musā bhaṇāhi, sakena dārena ca hohi tuṭṭho”ti. –
analyzed: a majja paḥ mā ca musā bhaṇāhi sakena dārena ca hohi tuṭṭhaḥ iti
translated: from sexual activity, from false speech, and from the condition of indolence produced by alcoholic drink and sloth-producing drugs. Be contented with your own wife, and do not look to the wife of another.”

original: Gāthādvayamāha.
analyzed: gāthā dvayam āha
translated: He spoke this pair of verses.

original: 1223. Tattha tathevāti yathā pasannacitto “sammāsambuddho bhagavā”ti buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ
analyzed: tattha tathā iva ati yathā pasanna cittaḥ sammāsambuddhaḥ bhagavā ati buddham saraṇam
translated: Herein, likewise means just as with a mind full of faith you went for refuge to the Enlightened One, thinking “The Blessed One is fully enlightened,”

original: vajesi, tatheva “svākkhāto dhammo, suppaṭipanno saṅgho”ti pasannacitto dhammañca
analyzed: vajesi tathā iva su ākkhātaḥ dhammo suppaṭipanno saṅghaḥ ti pasanna cittaḥ dhammañca
translated: so likewise with a mind full of faith go for refuge to the Dhamma and the Community of monks, thinking “The Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Blessed One, the Community of monks is practising the good way.”

original: saṅghañca saraṇaṃ vajāhi. Yathā vā pasannacitto ratanattayaṃ saraṇaṃ vajesi, tatheva
analyzed: saṅgham ca saraṇam vajāhi yathā vā pasanna cittaḥ ratanattayam saraṇam vajesi tathā iva
translated: And go for refuge to the Community. As you have gone for refuge to the Three Jewels with a mind full of confidence,

original: “ayaṃ ekaṃsato diṭṭheva dhamme abhisamparāyañca hitasukhāvaho”ti pasannacitto sikkhāya
analyzed: ayam ekaṃsataḥ diṭṭhe iva dhamme abhisamparāyañca hita sukha āvahaḥ ti pasanna cittaḥ sikkhāya
translated: in the same way, with a mind full of confidence, thinking, “This is the one who leads to welfare and happiness in this life and in the life to come,”

original: adhisīlasikkhāya padāni koṭṭhāsabhūtāni adhicittaadhipaññāsikkhāya vā upāyabhūtāni
analyzed: adhi sīla sikkhāya padāni koṭṭhāsa bhūtāni adhicitta adhipaññā sikkhāya vā upāya bhūtāni
translated: take up the five precepts, which are the parts, the components, of the training in the higher virtue, or which are the means to the training in the higher mind and the higher wisdom,

original: pañcasīlāni avikopanato ca asaṃkilissanato ca akhaṇḍaphullāni samādiyassu, samādāya vattassūti attho.
analyzed: pañca sīlāni a vikopanataḥ ca a saṃkilissanataḥ ca akhaṇḍa phullāni samādiyassu samādāya vattassu iti attho
translated: by not violating them and by not being defiled by them, by keeping them without breach or flaw. The meaning is: “Having taken them up, you should live by them.”

original: Evaṃ devaputtena saraṇagamane sīlasamādāne ca niyojito brāhmaṇo tassa vacanaṃ sirasā sampaṭicchanto –
analyzed: evam devaputtena saraṇa gamane sīla samādāne ca niyojitaḥ brāhmaṇo tassa vacanam sirasā sampaṭicchanto
translated: Thus, when the god-son had instructed him to go for refuge and to take up the precepts, the brahmin, accepting his words with his head, said:

original: “Atthakāmosi me yakkha, hitakāmosi devate;
analyzed: attha kāmo asi me yakkha hita kāmo asi devate
translated: “You are my benefactor, Yakkha, you are my deity,

original: Karomi tuyhaṃ vacanaṃ, tvaṃsi ācariyo mamā”ti. –
analyzed: karomi vacanam mama ati
translated: I will do as you say, for you are my teacher.”

original: Gāthaṃ vatvā tattha patiṭṭhahanto –
analyzed: gātham vatvā tattha patiṭṭhahantaḥ
translated: Having spoken this verse, he established himself in the refuge by saying:

original: “Upemi saraṇaṃ buddhaṃ, dhammañcāpi anuttaraṃ;
analyzed: upemi saraṇam buddham dhammam ca api anuttaram
translated: “I go for refuge to the Buddha, and to the Dhamma unsurpassed,

original: Saṅghañca naradevassa, gacchāmi saraṇaṃ ahaṃ.
analyzed: saṅghañca naradevassa gacchāmi saraṇam aham
translated: And to the Community of deathless men, I go for refuge.

original: “Pāṇātipātā viramāmi khippaṃ, loke adinnaṃ parivajjayāmi;
analyzed: pāṇa atipātā viramāmi khippam loke adinnam parivajjayāmi
translated: “I will quickly refrain from killing living beings, and I will avoid in the world what has not been given;

original: Amajjapo no ca musā bhaṇāmi, sakena dārena ca homi tuṭṭho”ti. –
analyzed: a majja paḥ no ca musā bhaṇāmi sakena dārena ca homi tuṭṭhaḥ ti
translated: I will not drink alcohol, and I will not tell lies. I will be satisfied with my own wife.”

original: Gāthādvayamāha. Tampi suviññeyyameva.

translated: and how it came to pass, and listen with concentrated minds.” “To the spirits of the earth”: to the spirits of the earth.

original: Idāni yakkhassa pucchāgāthāyo honti –
analyzed: idāni yakkhassa pucchāgāthāyaḥ honti
translated: Now come the verses of the ogre’s questions:

original: “Vaṅke araññe amanussaṭṭhāne, kantāre appodake appabhakkhe;
analyzed: vaṅke araññe amanussa ṭṭhāne kantāre appodake appabhakkhe
translated: “In the jungle, in the wilderness, in a place of non-human beings,🔽In a desert, with little water, with little food,🔽In a very difficult place, in the middle of a path of colour,

original: Suduggame vaṇṇupathassa majjhe, vaṅkaṃbhayā naṭṭhamanā manussā.
analyzed: su duggame vaṇṇu pathassa majjhe vaṅkaṃbhayā naṭṭha manāḥ manussā

original: “Nayidha phalā mūlamayā ca santi, upādānaṃ natthi kutodha bhakkho;
analyzed: na yidha phalā mūla mayā ca santi upādānam natthi kutas dha bhakkho
translated: “Here there are no fruits or roots, there is no possession, how much less food?🔽Except for dust and sand,

original: Aññatra paṃsūhi ca vālukāhi ca, tattāhi uṇhāhi ca dāruṇāhi ca.
analyzed: aññatra paṃsūhi ca vālukāhi ca tattāhi uṇhāhi ca dāruṇāhi ca
translated: and for hot, terrible ashes.

original: “Ujjaṅgalaṃ tattamivaṃ kapālaṃ, anāyasaṃ paralokena tulyaṃ;
analyzed: ujjaṅgalam kapālam anāyasam para lokena tulyam
translated: “That jungle is like a skull, not made of iron, equal to the other world,

original: Luddānamāvāsamidaṃ purāṇaṃ, bhūmippadeso abhisattarūpo.
analyzed: luddānam āvāsam idam purāṇam bhūmi ppadeso abhisatta rūpo
translated: This is an ancient dwelling of hunters, a place of earth, of the form of a being.

original: “Atha tumhe kena vaṇṇena, kimāsamānā imaṃ padesañhi;
analyzed: atha tumhe kena vaṇṇena kimāsamānāḥ imam
translated: “Then by what colour, by what appearance, having come to this place,

translated: Did you suddenly sit down, having met with greed, fear, or having become confused?”

analyzed: tattha vaṅkā iti saṃsaya ṭṭhāne yattha paviṭṭhānam jīvissāma nu kho marissāma

analyzed: nu khalu iti jīvite saṃsayaḥ hoti tādise araññe amanussa ṭṭhāne ti amanussānam pisāca ādīnam

original: 1231. Idhāti imasmiṃ marukantāre. Phalāti ambajambutālanāḷikerādiphalāni na santīti
analyzed: idha ati imasmin maru kantāre amba jambu tāla nāḷikera ādi phalāni na santi iti
translated: Here means in this desert. Fruit means that there are no fruits such as mangoes, rose-apples, coconuts, palmyra fruits, etc.

original: yojanā. Mūlamayā cāti mūlāniyeva mūlamayā, vallikandādīni sandhāya vadati. Upādānaṃ
analyzed: yojanā mūla mayā ca ati mūla mayā valli kanda ādīni sandhāya vadati upādānam
translated: The idea is that there is no fruit. Root-food means that there are only roots for food. He says this referring to creepers, tubers, etc.

original: natthīti kiñcāpi kiñci bhakkhaṃ natthi, upādānaṃ vā indhanaṃ, aggissa indhanamattampi🔽natthi, kuto kena kāraṇena idha marukantāre bhakkho siyāti attho. Yaṃ pana atthi
analyzed: natthi iti kiñca api kiñci bhakkham natthi upādānam vā indhanam aggissa indhana mattam pi  natthi kutas kena kāraṇena idha maru kantāre bhakkhaḥ siyāti atthaḥ yam pana atthi
translated: There is no fuel means that although there is no food at all, there is no fuel either, which is the kindling of fire.

original: tattha, taṃ dassetuṃ “aññatra paṃsūhī”tiādi vuttaṃ.🔽1232. Ujjaṅgalanti jaṅgalaṃ vuccati lūkhadhūsaro anudako bhūmippadeso, taṃ pana ṭhānaṃ🔽jaṅgalatopi ukkaṃsena jaṅgalanti āha “ujjaṅgala”nti. Tenāha “tattamivaṃ kapāla”nti,
analyzed: tattha tam dassetum aññatra paṃsūhi itiādi vuttam  ujjaṅgalanti jaṅgalam vuccati lūkha dhūsaraḥ anudakaḥ bhūmi ppadeso tam pana ṭhānam  ukkaṃsena jaṅgalanti āha ujjaṅgalanti tena āha tat tam ivam
translated: The meaning is: for what reason should there be food in this desert? But what there is there, he shows by “except for dust-heap rubbish.”🔽Desert means a place of ground that is rough and waterless, called a desert. But that place is a desert because it is a desert even more than a desert. Therefore he said “desert-like.”

original: tattaṃ ayokapālasadisanti attho. Gāthāsukhatthañcettha sānunāsikaṃ katvā vuttaṃ,
analyzed: tat tam ayaḥ kapāla sadisanti atthaḥ gāthā sukha attham ca ittha sa anunāsikam katvā vuttam
translated: Hence he said “like a piece of iron,” the meaning being that it is like a piece of red-hot iron. But this was said with the meter in mind.

original: tattamivaicceva daṭṭhabbaṃ. Anāyasanti natthi ettha āyo sukhanti anāyaṃ, tato eva
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam anāyasanti natthi ettha āyo sukhanti anāyam tatas eva
translated: It should be regarded as just like that. It is without torment: there is no torment here, thus it is without torment.

original: jīvitaṃ sīyati vināsetīti anāyasaṃ. Atha vā na āyasanti anāyasaṃ. Paralokenāti narakena
analyzed: jīvitam sīyati anāyasam atha vā na anāyasam para lokena ati narakena
translated: Or alternatively, it is not tormented, thus it is without torment. As to the other world: it is like hell.

original: tulyaṃ. Narakañhi sattānaṃ ekantānatthatāya parabhūto paṭisattubhūto lokoti visesato
analyzed: tulyam narakam hi sattānam ekanta anatthatāya para bhūtaḥ paṭisattu bhūtaḥ loko ti visesataḥ
translated: For hell is called “the other world” in the sense of being a different world, a world opposed to this one, since it is the utter misfortune of beings.

original: “paraloko”ti vuccati, samantato ayomayattā āyasañca, idaṃ pana tadabhāvato anāyasaṃ,🔽mahato dukkhassa uppattiṭṭhānatāya paralokasadisanti dasseti, “anassaya”nti ca keci
analyzed: para lokaḥ iti vuccati samantataḥ ayaḥ mayattā āyasam ca idam pana tad abhāvataḥ anāyasam  mahataḥ dukkhassa uppatti ṭṭhāna tāya para loka sadisanti dasseti anassayanti ca keci
translated: It is made of iron all round, thus it is “iron” . But this is without torment because it lacks that.

original: paṭhanti, sukhassa appatiṭṭhānabhūtanti attho. Luddānamāvāsamidaṃ purāṇanti idaṃ🔽ṭhānaṃ cirakālato paṭṭhāya luddānaṃ dāruṇānaṃ pisācādīnaṃ āvāsabhūtaṃ. Abhisattarūpoti
analyzed: paṭhanti sukhassa a patiṭṭhāna bhūtanti atthaḥ luddānam āvāsam idam purāṇam ti idam  ṭhānam cira kālataḥ paṭṭhāya luddānam dāruṇānam pisāca ādīnam āvāsa bhūtam
translated: It is shown to be like the other world because it is the source of great suffering. Some read “anassaya” . The meaning is: it is not a foundation for pleasure.🔽This is the abode of wild spirits: this place has been the abode of wild, cruel spirits such as pīsācas from ancient times.

original: “evaṃ lūkho ghorākāro hotū”ti porāṇehi isīhi sapitasadiso, dinnasapo viyāti attho.
analyzed: evam lūkhaḥ ghora ākāraḥ hotu uti porāṇehi isīhi sapita sadisaḥ dinna sapaḥ viya ati attho
translated: It is the form of the Bodhisatta: it was like the colour of the sap of the pīlu tree, thus it was like the sap of the pīlu tree. The meaning is: it was like the sap of the pīlu tree, which the ancient seers had made to be of such a terrible appearance.

original: 1233. Kena vaṇṇenāti kena kāraṇena. Kimāsamānāti kiṃ paccāsīsantā. Hīti nipātamattaṃ.🔽“Padesampī”ti ca paṭhanti, imampi nāma padesanti attho. Sahasā sameccāti sahasā ādīnavānisaṃse
analyzed: kena vaṇṇena ati kena kāraṇena kim āsamānā ati kim hi iti nipāta mattam  padesampi iti ca paṭhanti imam pi nāma attho sahasā samet ca ati sahasā ādīnava anisaṃse
translated: “For what reason?” means “for what cause?” “What are you waiting for?” means “what are you waiting for?” “Hī” is a mere particle.

original: avicāretvā samavāyena anupaviṭṭhā sappaviṭṭhā. Lobhā bhayā atha vā kenaci anatthakāmena
analyzed: a vicāretvā samavāyena anupaviṭṭhā sa paviṭṭhā lobhā bhayā atha vā kenaci anattha kāmena
translated: They read “padesampi,” the meaning is “this place too.” “Have come together suddenly” means “have come together without examining the danger and benefit, have come together without being properly settled.” “Through greed and fear” means “through greed and fear, or through being tempted by someone who wishes to do harm,

original: palobhitā lobhato kenaci amanussādinā paripātitā bhayā vā. Atha vā sampamūḷhāti maggavippanaṭṭhā
analyzed: palobhitā lobhataḥ kenaci a manussādinā paripātitā bhayā vā atha vā sampamūḍhā ati magga vippanaṭṭhā
translated: or through being frightened by someone such as a non-human.” Or “through confusion” means “through being lost on the path.”

original: imaṃ padesaṃ anupaviṭṭhāti yojanā.
analyzed: imam padesam anupaviṭṭhā ati yojanā
translated: “Have come to this place” is the construction.

original: Idāni vāṇijā āhaṃsu –
analyzed: idāni vāṇijāḥ āhaṃsu
translated: Now the merchants said:

original: “Magadhesu aṅgesu ca satthavāhā, āropayitvā paṇiyaṃ puthuttaṃ;
analyzed: magadhesu aṅgesu ca satthavāhāḥ āropayitvā paṇiyam puthuttam
translated: “Caravans from Magadha and Aṅga, having loaded up various goods,

original: Te yāmase sindhusovīrabhūmiṃ, dhanatthikā uddayaṃ patthayānā.
analyzed: te yāmase sindhusovīra bhūmim dhanatthikāḥ uddayam patthayānā
translated: Set out in the night to the land of the Sindhus and the Sauvīras, seeking profit and gain.

original: “Divā pipāsaṃnadhivāsayantā, yoggānukampañca samekkhamānā;
analyzed: divā pipāsaṃn adhivāsayantā yogga anukampañca samekkhamānā
translated: “Enduring thirst by day, and looking out for a favorable wind,

original: Etena vegena āyāma sabbe, rattiṃ maggaṃ paṭipannā vikāle.
analyzed: etena vegena āyāma sabbe rattim maggam paṭipannāḥ vikāle
translated: We all came with this speed, traveling the road at night in the wrong time.

original: “Te duppayātā aparaddhamaggā, andhākulā vippanaṭṭhā araññe;
analyzed: te duppayātāḥ aparaddha maggāḥ andha ākulāḥ vippanaṭṭhāḥ araññe
translated: “We are lost, we have gone astray, we are blind, we are a family in the wilderness,

original: Suduggame vaṇṇupathassa majjhe, disaṃ na jānāma pamūḷhacittā.
analyzed: su duggame vaṇṇu pathassa majjhe disam na jānāma pamūḍha cittā
translated: In the middle of a difficult road, we do not know the direction, our minds are confused.

original: “Idañca disvāna adiṭṭhapubbaṃ, vimānaseṭṭhañca tavañca yakkha;
analyzed: idam ca disvāna a diṭṭha pubbam vimāna seṭṭham ca tavam ca yakkha
translated: “Having seen this, and this most excellent mansion, and you, O Yakkha,

original: Tatuttariṃ jīvitamāsamānā, disvā patītā sumanā udaggā”ti.
analyzed: tatuttarim jīvitam āsamānā disvā patītā sumanāḥ udaggāti
translated: Having seen this, we have come to life again, we have come to life again, we are happy and joyful.”🔽Herein, born and bred in Magadha and in Aṅga are ‘caravan-leaders.’

original: 1234. Tattha magadhesu aṅgesu ca satthavāhāti magadharaṭṭhe ca aṅgaraṭṭhe ca jātā🔽saṃvaḍḍhā taṃnivāsino satthe satthassa ca vāhanakā satthakā ceva satthasāmikā ca.
analyzed: tattha magadhesu aṅgesu ca satthavāhā ati magadha raṭṭhe ca aṅga raṭṭhe ca jātā  saṃvaḍḍhā taṃnivāsino satthe satthassa ca vāhanakā satthakā ca iva sattha sāmikā ca
translated: They are caravan-leaders and caravan-owners who are born and bred in the Magadha country and in the Aṅga country.

original: Paṇiyanti bhaṇḍaṃ. Teti te mayaṃ. Yāmaseti gacchāma. Sindhusovīrabhūminti sindhudesaṃ🔽sovīradesañca. Uddayanti ānisaṃsaṃ atirekalābhaṃ.
analyzed: bhaṇḍam te iti te mayam yāmasa iti gacchāma sindhusovīra bhūmin ti sindhu desam  ānisaṃsam atireka lābham
translated: Goods is ‘merchandise.’ We are ‘we.’ We are going is ‘we are going.’ To the land of the Sindhus and the countries of the Sabbās is ‘to the Sindhu country and to the countries of the Sabbās.’ Profit is ‘advantage.’

original: 1235. Anadhivāsayantāti adhivāsetuṃ asakkontā. Yoggānukampanti goṇādīnaṃ sattānaṃ
analyzed: an adhivāsayantā ati adhivāsetum a sakkontā yoggā anukampanti goṇa ādīnam sattānam
translated: We are unable to wait is ‘we are unable to wait.’ The welfare of the cattle is ‘the welfare of the cattle.’

original: anuggahaṃ. Etena vegenāti iminā javena, yena tava dassanato pubbe āyāma āgatamha.
analyzed: anuggaham etena vegena ati iminā javena yena tava dassanataḥ pubbe āyāma āgatamha
translated: By this speed is ‘by this speed,’ by which speed we have come before we have seen you.

original: Rattiṃ maggaṃ paṭipannāti rattiyaṃ maggaṃ paṭipannā. Vikāleti akāle avelāyaṃ.
analyzed: rattim maggam paṭipannā ati rattiyam maggam paṭipannā vikāleti akāle avelāyam
translated: “Traveling the road at night”: traveling the road at night. “Lost”: at an improper time, at an inconvenient time.

original: 1236. Duppayātāti duṭṭhu payātā apathe gatā, tato eva aparaddhamaggā. Andhākulāti
analyzed: duppayātā ati duṭṭhu payātā apathe gatā tatas eva aparaddha maggā andha ākulā ati
translated: “Gone astray”: gone astray, gone by a wrong path. “Confused”:

original: andhā viya ākulā, maggajānanasamatthassa paññācakkhuno abhāvena andhā, tato eva ākulā,
analyzed: andhā viya ākulā magga jānana samatthassa paññā cakkhuno abhāvena andhā tatas eva ākulā
translated: confused like the blind, blind because of the absence of the eye of wisdom capable of knowing the path, and therefore confused,

original: vippanaṭṭhā ca maggasammūḷhatāya. Disanti gantabbadisaṃ, yassaṃ disāyaṃ sindhusovīradeso,
analyzed: vippanaṭṭhā ca magga sammūḷha tāya disanti gantabba disam disā ayam sindhusovīra deso
translated: and disoriented because of being lost on the path. “The direction”: the direction to go, the direction in which the land of Sindhu and Sovira is.

original: taṃ disaṃ. Pamūḷhacittāti disāsaṃsayasumūḷhacittā.
analyzed: tam disam pamūḍha cittā ati disā saṃsaya sumūḍha cittā
translated: “Confused in mind”: confused in mind because of doubt about the direction.

original: 1237. Tavañcāti tuvañca. Yakkhāti ālapanaṃ. Tatuttariṃ jīvitamāsamānāti yo “ito paraṃ
analyzed: tavañca ati tuvañca yakkha ati ālapanam tatuttarim jīvitam āsamānāti yaḥ itas param
translated: “You”: you. “Yakkha”: an address. “More than that”: more than that,

original: amhākaṃ jīvitaṃ natthī”ti jīvitasaṃsayo uppanno, idāni tato uttarimpi jīvitaṃ āsīsantā.
analyzed: amhākam jīvitam na atthi iti jīvita saṃsayaḥ uppannaḥ idāni tatas uttarim pi jīvitam
translated: thinking “There is no life for us beyond this,” the doubt about life arose. Now, hoping for life beyond that,

original: Disvāti dassanahetu. Patītāti pahaṭṭhā. Sumanāti somanassappattā. Udaggāti udaggāya pītiyā udaggacittā.
analyzed: disvā ati dassana hetu patītā ati pahaṭṭhā sumanā ati somanassa ppattā udaggā ati udaggāya pītiyā udagga cittā
translated: “Seeing”: because of seeing. “Rejoiced”: delighted. “Glad”: with uplifted mind, with uplifted mind because of uplifted joy.

original: Evaṃ vāṇijehi attano pavattiyā pakāsitāya puna devaputto dvīhi gāthāhi pucchi –
analyzed: evam vāṇijehi attanaḥ pavattiyā pakāsitāya puna devaputtaḥ dvīhi gāthāhi pucchi
translated: When the merchants had thus told him their own story, the deva again asked them in two stanzas:

original: “Pāraṃ samuddassa imañca vaṇṇuṃ, vettācaraṃ saṅkupathañca maggaṃ;
analyzed: pāram samuddasse imañca vaṇṇum vettā acaram saṅku patham ca maggaṃ
translated: “The other shore of the sea and this fair land, the path of reeds and the road with stumps,

original: Nadiyo pana pabbatānañca duggā, puthuddisā gacchatha bhogahetu.
analyzed: nadiyaḥ pana pabbatānam ca duggāḥ puthuddisā gacchatha bhoga hetu
translated: The rivers and the mountains’ difficult terrain—you go to different lands for gain.

original: “Pakkhandiyāna vijitaṃ paresaṃ, verajjake mānuse pekkhamānā;
analyzed: pakkhandiyāna vijitam paresam verajjake mānuse pekkhamānā
translated: “You who have crossed to the lands of others, looking on the people of the alien lands,

original: Yaṃ vo sutaṃ vā atha vāpi diṭṭhaṃ, accherakaṃ taṃ vo suṇoma tātā”ti.
analyzed: yam vaḥ sutam vā atha vā api diṭṭham accherakam tam vaḥ suṇoma tāta ati
translated: What have you seen or heard that is worth telling? Tell us, dear friends.”

original: Tassattho – pāraṃ samuddassāti samuddassa paratīraṃ, imañca īdisaṃ, vaṇṇuṃ vaṇṇupathaṃ
analyzed: tassa atthaḥ pāram samuddassa ati samuddassa para tīram imañca īdisam vaṇṇum vaṇṇu patham
translated: The meaning is as follows: The other shore of the sea is the further shore of the ocean. This fair land is this fair land.

original: vettalatā bandhitvā ācaritabbato vettācaraṃ maggaṃ, saṅkuke khāṇuke koṭṭetvā gantabbato
analyzed: vetta latāḥ bandhitvā ācaritabbataḥ vetta ācaram maggam saṅkuke khāṇuke koṭṭetvā gantabbataḥ
translated: The path of reeds is a path that one must go by binding together reeds. The road with stumps is a road that one must go by knocking down stumps.

original: saṅkupathaṃ maggaṃ, nadiyo pana candabhāgādikā, pabbatānañca visamappadesāti evaṃ
analyzed: saṅku patham maggam nadiyaḥ pana candabhāga ādikā pabbatānam ca visama ppadesā ti evam
translated: The rivers and the mountains’ difficult terrain—the rivers such as the Candabhāgā, etc., and the uneven places in the mountains—

original: duggā puthuddisā bhoganimittaṃ gacchatha, evaṃ gacchantā ca pakkhandiyāna pakkhanditvā
analyzed: duggā puthuddisā bhoga nimittam gacchatha evam gacchantā ca pakkhandiyāna pakkhanditvā
translated: you go to different lands for gain. And going thus, you who have crossed to the lands of others,🔽looking on the people of the alien lands,

original: anupavisitvā, paresaṃ rājūnaṃ vijitaṃ tattha verajjake videsavāsike manusse pekkhamānā
analyzed: an upavisitvā paresam rājūnam vijitam tattha verajjake videsa vāsike manusse pekkhamānā
translated: without visiting them, to other kings’ realms, and there, while looking at the people who are enemies and strangers,

original: gacchatha, evaṃbhūtehi vo tumhehi yaṃ sutaṃ vā atha vā diṭṭhaṃ vā accherakaṃ acchariyaṃ,
analyzed: gacchatha evaṃbhūtehi vaḥ tumhehi yam sutam vā atha vā diṭṭham vā accherakam acchariyam
translated: “Go, in such a way, whatever you have heard or seen that is wonderful,

original: taṃ vo santike tātā vāṇijā suṇomāti attano vimānassa acchariyabhāvaṃ tehi kathāpetukāmo pucchati.
analyzed: tam vaḥ santike tātā vāṇijā suṇoma ati attanaḥ vimānassa acchariya bhāvam tehi kathā petu kāmo pucchati
translated: close to you, dear merchants, we will listen to it.” wanting to have them tell about the wonder of his own mansion, he asks.

original: Evaṃ devaputtena puṭṭhā vāṇijā āhaṃsu –
analyzed: evam devaputtena puṭṭhāḥ vāṇijāḥ āhaṃsu
translated: Being asked by the god, the merchants said this:

original: “Itopi accherataraṃ kumāra, na no sutaṃ vā atha vāpi diṭṭhaṃ;
analyzed: itas upi kumāra na no sutam vā atha vā api diṭṭham
translated: “This is more wonderful, Prince, than what we have heard or seen;

original: Atītamānusakameva sabbaṃ, disvā na tappāma anomavaṇṇaṃ.🔽“Vehāyasaṃ pokkharañño savanti, pahūtamalyā bahupuṇḍarīkā;
analyzed: atīta mānusakam eva sabbam disvā na tappāma anoma vaṇṇam  vehāyasam pokkharañño savanti pahūta malyā bahu puṇḍarīkā
translated: All of it is beyond human (experience), having seen it we are not ashamed, O you of incomparable beauty.🔽“From the sky the lotus lake flows, with abundant garlands and many lotuses;

original: Dumā cime niccaphalūpapannā, atīva gandhā surabhiṃ pavāyanti.🔽“Veḷūriyathambhā satamussitāse, silāpavāḷassa ca āyataṃsā;
analyzed: dumā cime nicca phala upapannāḥ atīva gandhā surabhim pavāyanti  veḷūriya thambhā silāpavāḷassa ca āyataṃsā
translated: These trees are always laden with fruit, and they blow a very fragrant sweet scent.🔽“These pillars are made of crystal and gold, and are inlaid with precious stones and coral;

original: Masāragallā sahalohitaṅgā, thambhā ime jotirasāmayāse.
analyzed: masāragallā sahalohitaṅgā thambhāḥ ime jotiḥ asāmayāse
translated: These pillars are made of ruby and coral, and are inlaid with gold and crystal.

original: “Sahassathambhaṃ atulānubhāvaṃ, tesūpari sādhumidaṃ vimānaṃ;
analyzed: sahassa thambham atula anubhāvam tesu upari sādhum idam vimānam
translated: “A thousand pillars, incomparable in splendor, above them this fair mansion,

original: Ratanantaraṃ kañcanavedimissaṃ, tapanīyapaṭṭehi ca sādhuchannaṃ.
analyzed: kañcana vedi missam tapanīya paṭṭehi ca sādhu channam
translated: With a jeweled floor and a golden dais, well-covered with cloths of fine silk.

original: “Jambonaduttattamidaṃ sumaṭṭho, pāsādasopānaphalūpapanno;
analyzed: su maṭṭhaḥ pāsāda sopāna phala upapannaḥ
translated: “This fair staircase of coral-tree wood, with steps of precious stones,

original: Daḷho ca vaggu ca susaṅgato ca, atīva nijjhānakhamo manuñño.
analyzed: daḷhaḥ ca vaggu ca su saṅgataḥ ca atīva nijjhāna khamaḥ manuñño
translated: Is strong, beautiful, and well-fitted, and very pleasant to behold.

original: “Ratanantarasmiṃ bahuannapānaṃ, parivārito accharāsaṅgaṇena;
analyzed: bahu anna pānam parivāritaḥ accha rāsaṅgaṇena
translated: “In the midst of the precious stones, surrounded by a group of celestial nymphs,

original: Murajaālambaratūriyaghuṭṭho, abhivanditosi thutivandanāya.
analyzed: abhivanditaḥ asi thuti vandanāya
translated: With the sound of the drum, the lute, and the tabor, you are worshipped with praise and homage.

original: “So modasi nārigaṇappabodhano, vimānapāsādavare manorame;
analyzed: saḥ modasi nāri gaṇa ppabodhanaḥ vimāna pāsāda vare manorame
translated: “You rejoice, O lord of the nāgas, in the most delightful mansion and palace,

original: Acintiyo sabbaguṇūpapanno, rājā yathā vessavaṇo naḷinyā.
analyzed: acintiyaḥ sabba guṇa upapannaḥ rājā yathā vessavaṇaḥ naḷinyā
translated: Inconceivable, endowed with every virtue, like the king Vessavaṇa in the Nāḷinī.”

original: “Devo nu āsi udavāsi yakkho,
analyzed: devaḥ nu āsi udavāsi yakkhaḥ
translated: “Are you a god or a yakkha?

original: Udāhu devindo manussabhūto;
analyzed: uda ahu devindaḥ manussa bhūtaḥ
translated: Or are you Sakka, lord of the gods, or a human being?

original: Pucchanti taṃ vāṇijā satthavāhā,
analyzed: pucchanti tam vāṇijāḥ satthavāhāḥ
translated: The merchants and the caravan leaders ask you this:

original: Ācikkha ko nāma tuvaṃsi yakkho”ti.
analyzed: ācikkha kaḥ nāma tuvaṃsi yakkho ti
translated: Tell us, what yakkha are you?”

original: 1240-2. Tattha kumārāti paṭhamavaye ṭhitattā devaputtaṃ ālapati. Sabbanti devaputtaṃ
analyzed: tattha kumāra ati paṭhama vaye ṭhita ttā devaputtam ālapati sabban ti devaputtam
translated: There, the prince, referring to the deva-son, said, “You are young,” because he was in the first stage of life. “All” refers to the deva-son.

original: tassa vimānapaṭibaddhañca sandhāya vadati. Pokkharaññoti pokkharaṇiyo. Satamussitāseti
analyzed: tassa vimāna paṭibaddhañca sandhāya vadati pokkharañño ti pokkharaṇiyaḥ
translated: and he speaks with reference to the palace. Pokkharañño means ‘of the lotus-ponds’. Satamussitāse means

original: sataratanubbedhā. Silāpavāḷassāti silāya pavāḷassa ca, silāmayā pavāḷamayāti attho.
analyzed: sa tara tanu bbedhā silā pavāḷassa ati silāya pavāḷassa ca silā mayā pavāḷa mayā ati attho
translated: a hundred yojanas in height. Silāpavāḷassāti means of the stone and the coral, the meaning is: made of stone and made of coral.

original: Āyataṃsāti dīghaṃsā. Atha vā āyatā hutvā aṭṭhasoḷasadvattiṃsādiaṃsavanto.
analyzed: dīgha aṃsāḥ atha vā āyatāḥ hutvā
translated: Āyataṃsāti means long-necked. Or else, they are long and have eight, sixteen, thirty-two, etc. ribs.

original: 1242. Tesūparīti tesaṃ thambhānaṃ upari. Sādhumidanti sundaraṃ idaṃ tava vimānaṃ.🔽Ratanantaranti ratanantaravantaṃ, bhittithambhasopānādīsu nānāvidhehi aññehi ratanehi
analyzed: tesu upari iti tesam thambhānam upari sundaram idam tava vimānam  rata nantaram ti rata nantaravantam bhitti thambha sopāna ādīsu nānāvidhehi aññehi ratanehi
translated: . Tesūparī means on top of those pillars. Sādhumidanti means beautiful, this is your palace.🔽Ratanantaranti means having a jewel-studded interior, the walls, pillars, steps, etc. are

original: yuttaṃ. Kañcanavedimissanti suvaṇṇamayāya vedikāya sahitaṃ parikkhittaṃ. Tapanīyapaṭṭehi
analyzed: yuttam kañcana vedi missanti suvaṇṇa mayāya vedikāya sahitam parikkhittam tapanīya paṭṭehi
translated: endowed with various other jewels. Kañcanavedimissanti means together with a golden altar, surrounded by a golden altar. Tapanīyapaṭṭehi

original: ca sādhuchannanti tapanīyamayehi anekaratanamayehi ca chadanehi tattha tattha suṭṭhu chāditaṃ.
analyzed: ca tapanīya mayehi aneka ratana mayehi ca chadanehi tattha tattha suṭṭhu chāditam
translated: sādhuchannanti means well-covered here and there with coverings made of gold and many jewels.

original: 1244. Jambonaduttattamidanti idaṃ tava vimānaṃ yebhuyyena uttattajambunadabhāsuraṃ.
analyzed: idam tava vimānam yebhuyyena uttatta jambu nada bhāsuram
translated: . Jambonaduttattamidanti means this your palace is mostly shining like the Jambu River gold.🔽.

original: Sumaṭṭho pāsādasopānaphalūpapannoti tassa ca so so padeso sumaṭṭho suṭṭhu majjito,
analyzed: su maṭṭho pāsāda sopāna phala upapanno ti tassa ca so so padeso sumaṭṭhaḥ suṭṭhu majjito
translated: And well-polished, with steps of polished ivory: and that place of his was well polished, well smoothed,

original: tehi tehi anantarapāsādehi sopānavisesehi ramaṇīyehi phalakehi ca yutto. Daḷhoti
analyzed: tehi tehi anantara pāsādehi sopāna visesehi ramaṇīyehi phalakehi ca yuttaḥ daḷhoti
translated: with the various steps of the adjacent palaces and with the lovely planks. Firm:

original: thiro. Vaggūti abhirūpo samuggato. Susaṅgatoti suṭṭhu saṅgatāvayavo aññamaññānurūpapāsādāvayavo.🔽Atīva nijjhānakhamoti pabhassarabhāvepi ativiya olokanakkhamo. Manuññoti manoramo.
analyzed: thiraḥ vaggu iti abhirūpaḥ samuggataḥ su saṅgataḥ ti suṭṭhu saṅgata avayavo aññamañña anurūpa pāsāda avayavo  atīva nijjhāna khamo ti pabhassara bhāve pi ativiya olokana kkhamo manuññaḥ ti manoramaḥ
translated: steadfast. Beautiful: handsome, outstanding. Well-proportioned: well-proportioned in its parts, with the parts of the palaces in harmony with each other.🔽Very fit for looking at: fit for looking at even in its brightness. Delightful: delightful.

original: 1245. Ratanantarasminti ratanamaye, ratanabhūte vā sārabhūte vimānassa abbhantare.
analyzed: rata nantarasmin ti ratana maye ratana bhūte vā sāra bhūte vimānassa abbhantare
translated: In the middle of the jewel: in the middle of the jewel, or in the middle of the mansion which was like a jewel, which was the essence.

original: Bahuannapānanti pesalaṃ pahūtaṃ annañca pānañca vijjati, upalabbhatīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: bahu anna pānam ti pesalam pahūtam annam ca pānam ca vijjati upalabbhati iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: With much food and drink: the meaning is that there was much, plenty, of good food and drink, that it was available.

original: Murajaālambaratūriyaghuṭṭhoti mudiṅgānaṃ ālambarānaṃ avasiṭṭhatūriyānañca saddehi
analyzed: muraja ālambara tūriya ghuṭṭhaḥ ti mudiṅgānam ālambarānam avasiṭṭha tūriyānam ca saddehi
translated: With the sound of drums, flutes, and tabours: with the sound of mudiṅgas, ālambaras, and the remaining tabours.

original: niccaghosito. Abhivanditosīti namassito, thomito vā asi. Tenāha “thūtivandanāyā”ti.
analyzed: nicca ghositaḥ abhivanditaḥ asi iti namassitaḥ thomitaḥ vā asi tena āha thūti vandanāya ati
translated: Constantly resounding: constantly resounding. You are worshipped: you are worshipped, you are honoured. Hence ‘for the purpose of honour and worship’ was said.

original: 1246. Acintiyoti acinteyyānubhāvo. Naḷinyāti evaṃnāmake kīḷanaṭṭhāne yathā vessavaṇo mahārājā, evaṃ tvaṃ modasīti yojanā.
analyzed: acintiyā iti acinteyya anubhāvaḥ naḷinyā ati evaṃnāmake kīḷana ṭṭhāne yathā vessavaṇaḥ mahā rājā evam tvam modasi iti yojanā
translated: “Inconceivable”: of inconceivable might. “In the lotus-pond”: in the pleasure-pool so named. The idea is that just as the Great King Vessavaṇa delights there, so you delight there.

original: 1247. Āsīti asi bhavasi. Devindoti sakko devarājā. Manussabhūtoti manussesu bhūto manussajātiko. Yakkhoti devādibhāvaṃ pucchitvāpi yakkhabhāvaṃ āsaṅkantā vadanti.
analyzed: āsi iti asi bhavasi devindo ti sakkaḥ devarājā manussa bhūtoti manussesu bhūtaḥ manussa jātikaḥ yakkho ti deva ādi bhāvam pucchitvā api yakkha bhāvam āsaṅkantāḥ vadanti
translated: “You were”: you are. “Lord of the gods”: Sakka, king of the gods. “Among men”: among men, born in the human race. “A yakkha”: though they ask about his state as a god, etc., they speak of him as a yakkha, suspecting that he is a yakkha.

original: Idāni so devaputto attānaṃ jānāpento –
analyzed: idāni so deva putto attānam jānāpentaḥ
translated: Now, that god, making himself known, said:

original: “Serīsako nāma ahamhi yakkho, kantāriyo vaṇṇupathamhi gutto;
analyzed: serīsakaḥ nāma ahamhi yakkho kantāriyaḥ vaṇṇu pathamhi gutto
translated: “I am the yakkha named Serisaka, appointed in the forest for protection,

original: Imaṃ padesaṃ abhipālayāmi, vacanakaro vessavaṇassa rañño”ti. –
analyzed: imam padesam abhipālayāmi vacana karaḥ vessavaṇassa rañño ti
translated: I guard this region, and am an obedient servant of King Vessavaṇa.”

original: Āha. Tattha ahamhī yakkhoti ahaṃ yakkho amhi. Kantāriyoti ārakkhaṇatthaṃ kantāre niyutto. Guttoti gopako. Tenāha “abhipālayāmī”ti.
analyzed: āha tattha ahamhi yakkhoti aham yakkhaḥ amhi kantāriyo ti ārakkhaṇa attham kantāre niyuttaḥ gutto ti gopako tena āha abhipālayāmi iti
translated: Herein, I am a yakkha amhi means I am a yakkha. Appointed in the forest means appointed in the forest for the purpose of protection. Guard means guardian. That is why he said “I guard this region.”

original: Idāni vāṇijā tassa kammādīni pucchantā āhaṃsu –
analyzed: idāni vāṇijā tassa kamma ādīni pucchantā āhaṃsu
translated: Now, the merchants asked him about his work, etc., with the verses beginning:

original: “Adhiccaladdhaṃ pariṇāmajaṃ te, sayaṃkataṃ udāhu devehi dinnaṃ;
analyzed: pariṇāma jam te sayaṃkatam udāhu devehi dinnam
translated: “Is it by chance or by transformation that you have come to be? Or are you self-made, or given by the gods?

original: Pucchanti taṃ vāṇijā satthavāhā, kathaṃ tayā laddhamidaṃ manuñña”nti.🔽Tattha adhiccaladdhanti adhiccasamuppattikaṃ, yadicchakaṃ laddhanti attho. Pariṇāmajaṃ
analyzed: pucchanti tam vāṇijā satthavāhā katham tayā laddham idam  tattha adhicca laddhanti adhicca samuppattikam yadicchakam pariṇāma jam
translated: The merchants and caravan leaders ask you, ‘How did you get this good fortune?’

original: teti niyatisaṅgatibhāvapariṇataṃ, kālapariṇataṃ vā. Sayaṃkatanti tayā sayameva kataṃ,🔽deviddhiyā tayā sayameva nibbattitanti attho. Udāhu devehi dinnanti tayā ārādhitehi
analyzed: tā iti niyati saṅgati bhāva pariṇatam kāla pariṇatam vā tayā sayam eva katam  deva iddhiyā tayā sayam eva nibbattitanti attho udāhu devehi dinnanti tayā ārādhitehi
translated: Herein, ‘Not by chance did you get it’ means not by chance occurrence; the meaning is: not by what you wanted. ‘Nor by transformation’ means arisen by the regular process of kamma-result, or else matured by time. ‘Nor by your own making’ means not made by you yourself;🔽the meaning is: not produced by you yourself by your own power. ‘Nor was it given by the gods’ means not given by the gods you satisfied

original: devehi pasādavasena nissaṭṭhaṃ.
analyzed: devehi pasāda vasena nissaṭṭham
translated: by your faith.

original: Idāni devaputto caturopi pakāre paṭikkhipitvā puññameva apadisanto –
analyzed: idāni devaputto caturo api pakāre paṭikkhipitvā puññam eva a padisanto
translated: Now, the god, after rejecting all four alternatives, showed that it was merit alone by saying,

original: “Nādhiccaladdhaṃ na pariṇāmajaṃ me, na sayaṃkataṃ na hi devehi dinnaṃ;
analyzed: na adhicca laddham na pariṇāma jam me na sayaṃkatam na hi devehi dinnam
translated: ‘Not by chance did I get it, nor by transformation, Nor by my own making, nor was it given by the gods;

original: Sakehi kammehi apāpakehi, puññehi me laddhamidaṃ manuñña”nti. –
analyzed: sakehi kammehi a pāpakehi puññehi me laddham idam manuññam ti
translated: By my own deeds that were blameless, By my merits this good fortune was gained by me’ .

original: Gāthamāha.
analyzed: gātham āha
translated: He spoke this verse.

original: Taṃ sutvā vāṇijā puna “nādhiccaladdha”nti gāthāyaṃ puññādhikameva te caturo pakāre āropetvā puññassa ca sarūpaṃ pucchiṃsu –
analyzed: tam sutvā vāṇijā puna gāthāyam puñña adhikam eva te caturaḥ pakāre āropetvā puññassa ca sarūpam pucchiṃsu
translated: On hearing it, the merchants again, in the verse ‘Not by chance did you get it’, after superimposing on him the four alternatives beginning with merit, asked him about the nature of his merit.

original: “Kiṃ te vataṃ kiṃ pana brahmacariyaṃ, kissa suciṇṇassa ayaṃ vipāko;
analyzed: kim te vatam kim pana brahmacariyam kissa su ciṇṇassa ayam vipākaḥ
translated: “What is your vow? What is your holy life? What is the fruit of your well-practiced life?

original: Pucchanti taṃ vāṇijā satthavāhā, kathaṃ tayā laddhamidaṃ vimāna”nti.
analyzed: pucchanti tam vāṇijā satthavāhā katham tayā laddham idam vimānanti
translated: The merchants and caravan leaders ask you: How did you get this mansion?”

original: Tattha vatanti vatasamādānaṃ. Brahmacariyanti seṭṭhacariyaṃ.
analyzed: tattha vatanti vata samādānam seṭṭha cariyam
translated: Herein, vow is the undertaking of a vow. Holy life is the highest life.

original: Puna devaputto te paṭikkhipitvā attānaṃ yathūpacitaṃ puññañca dassento –
analyzed: puna devaputto te paṭikkhipitvā attānam yathā upacitam puññam ca dassento
translated: Then the god, having refused them, showing himself and the merit he had acquired, said:

original: “Mamaṃ pāyāsīti ahu samaññā, rajjaṃ yadā kārayiṃ kosalānaṃ;
analyzed: pāyāsi iti ahu samaññā rajjam yadā kārayim kosalānam
translated: “My name was Pāyāsi, when I ruled over the Kosalans.

original: Natthikadiṭṭhi kadariyo pāpadhammo, ucchedavādī ca tadā ahosiṃ.
analyzed: natthika diṭṭhi kadariyo pāpa dhammo uccheda vādī ca tadā ahosiṃ
translated: I was a materialist, a miser, of evil character, a nihilist.

original: “Samaṇo ca kho āsi kumārakassapo, bahussuto cittakathī uḷāro;
analyzed: samaṇaḥ ca kho āsi kumārakassapaḥ bahu sutaḥ citta kathī uḷāraḥ
translated: “There was a monk called Kumārakassapa, learned, eloquent, and noble.

original: So me tadā dhammakathaṃ abhāsi, diṭṭhivisūkāni vinodayī me.
analyzed: saḥ me tadā dhamma katham abhāsi diṭṭhi visūkāni me
translated: He then gave me a talk on the Dhamma, and removed the darts of my wrong views.

original: “Tāhaṃ tassa dhammakathaṃ suṇitvā, upāsakattaṃ paṭivedayissaṃ;🔽Pāṇātipātā virato ahosiṃ, loke adinnaṃ parivajjayissaṃ;
analyzed: tā aham tassa dhamma katham suṇitvā upāsaka ttam paṭivedayissam  pāṇa atipātā virataḥ ahosim loke adinnam parivajjayissam
translated: “Having heard his talk on the Dhamma, I declared myself his lay follower.🔽I abstained from killing living beings, and in the world I avoided what was not given.

original: Amajjapo no ca musā abhāṇiṃ, sakena dārena ca ahosiṃ tuṭṭho.
analyzed: amajjapaḥ no ca musā abhāṇim sakena dārena ca ahosim tuṭṭhaḥ
