analyzed: upāsakaḥ atthi imamhi saṅghe bahu sutaḥ sīlavatū upapannaḥ
translated: “There is a lay follower in this Community, learned, endowed with virtue,

original: Saddho ca cāgī ca supesalo ca, vicakkhaṇo santusito mutīmā.
analyzed: saddhaḥ ca cāgī ca su pesalaḥ ca vicakkhaṇaḥ santusitaḥ mutīmā
translated: Faithful, generous, and very polite, discerning, contented, and confident.

original: “Sañjānamāno na musā bhaṇeyya, parūpaghātāya na cetayeyya;
analyzed: sañjānamānaḥ na musā bhaṇeyya parūpaghātāya na cetayeyya
translated: “He would not speak a lie with full awareness, he would not intend to harm another,

original: Vebhūtikaṃ pesuṇaṃ no kareyya, saṇhañca vācaṃ sakhilaṃ bhaṇeyya.
analyzed: vebhūtikam pesuṇam no kareyya saṇham ca vācam sa khilam bhaṇeyya
translated: He would not make a slanderous accusation, he would speak gentle and kindly words.

original: “Sagāravo sappatisso vinīto, apāpako adhisīle visuddho;
analyzed: sa gāravaḥ sa patissaḥ vinītaḥ a pāpakaḥ adhi sīle visuddhaḥ
translated: “Respectful, deferential, and disciplined, he is not a wrong-doer, purified in the higher virtue;

original: So mātaraṃ pitarañcāpi jantu, dhammena poseti ariyavutti.
analyzed: saḥ mātaram pitaram ca api jantu dhammena poseti ariya vutti
translated: That person supports his mother and father by right means, he lives the holy life.

original: “Maññe so mātāpitūnaṃ kāraṇā, bhogāni pariyesati na attahetu;
analyzed: maññe saḥ mātā pitūnam kāraṇā bhogāni pariyesati na atta hetu
translated: “I think he seeks wealth for the sake of his mother and father, not for his own sake;

original: Mātāpitūnañca yo accayena, nekkhammapoṇo carissati brahmacariyaṃ.
analyzed: mātā pitūnañca yaḥ accayena nekkhamma poṇo carissati brahmacariyam
translated: And after the passing of his mother and father, he will go forth and live the spiritual life.

original: “Ujū avaṅko asaṭho amāyo, na lesakappena ca vohareyya;
analyzed: ujū a vaṅkaḥ a saṭhaḥ a māyaḥ na lesa kappena ca vohareyya
translated: “Upright, not crooked, not a cheat, not a deceiver, not leading others on by indirect hints,

original: So tādiso sukatakammakārī, dhamme ṭhito kinti labhetha dukkhaṃ.
analyzed: so tādisaḥ su kata kamma kārī dhamme ṭhitaḥ kinti labhetha dukkham
translated: Such a one, a doer of good deeds, established in the Dhamma, how could he get suffering?

original: “Taṃkāraṇā pātukatomhi attanā, tasmā dhammaṃ passatha vāṇijāse;
analyzed: taṃkāraṇā pātukato amhi attanā tasmā dhammam passatha vāṇija āse
translated: “For that reason I have come to you, therefore, merchants, see the Dhamma;

original: Aññatra teniha bhasmī bhavetha, andhākulā vippanaṭṭhā araññe;
analyzed: aññatra tena iha bhasmī bhavetha andha ākulā vippanaṭṭhā araññe
translated: Apart from that you will be turned to ashes, like a blind family fallen on misfortune in the wilderness;

original: Taṃ khippamānena lahuṃ parena, sukho have sappurisena saṅgamo”ti.
analyzed: tam khippamānena lahum parena sukhaḥ have sappurisena saṅgamaḥ uti
translated: Swiftly, quickly, with another, it is good to associate with a good person.”

original: 1266. Tattha saṅgheti sattasamūhe. Vicakkhaṇoti tattha tattha kattabbatāya kusalo. Santusitoti santuṭṭho. Mutīmāti kammassakatañāṇādinā idhalokaparalokahitānaṃ munanato mutimā.
analyzed: tattha saṅghe iti satta samūhe vicakkhaṇo ti tattha tattha kattabbatāya kusalo santusito ti santuṭṭhaḥ mutīmā ati kammassa kata ñāṇa ādinā idhaloka paraloka hitānam munanataḥ mutimā
translated: Herein, in the Community means in the group of seven. Wise means skilled in what should be done here and there. Content means satisfied. Possessed of understanding means possessed of understanding in the sense of remembering the ownership of kamma, etc., and remembering what is beneficial in this world and the world beyond.

original: 1267. Sañjānamāno na musā bhaṇeyyāti sampajānamusā na bhāseyya. Vebhūtikanti sahitānaṃ vinābhāvakaraṇato “vebhūtika”nti laddhanāmaṃ pisuṇaṃ, no kareyya na vadeyya.
analyzed: sañjānamānaḥ na musā bhaṇeyya ati sampajāna musā na bhāseyya vebhūtikanti sahitānam vinābhāva karaṇataḥ vebhūtikanti laddha nāmam pisuṇam no kareyya na vadeyya
translated: Not speaking falsehood knowingly means not speaking a deliberate lie. Divisive means divisive speech, which has the characteristic of causing division among those who are united, and which has the name “divisive” because it causes division. He would not do it, would not say it.

original: 1268. Sappatissoti patissayo garuṭṭhāniyesu nivātavuttikattā soraccaṃ, saha patissenāti sappatisso. Adhisīleti upāsakena rakkhitabbaadhisīlasikkhāya. Ariyavuttīti parisuddhavutti.
analyzed: sappatissaḥ ti patissayaḥ garuṭṭhāniyesu nivāta vutti kattā soraccam saha patissena ati sappatissaḥ adhisīle ti upāsakena rakkhitabba adhisīla sikkhāya ariya vuttī iti parisuddha vutti
translated: “With a sense of social obligation”: he is “socially obliging” because of his being easy to treat in the matter of the duties of respect to those who are venerable and so on. He is “with a sense of social obligation” because he has that sense of social obligation. “The training rule of the superior virtue”: the training rule in the virtue of a lay follower that should be guarded. “The conduct of a noble one”: the conduct of a noble one.

original: 1269. Nekkhammapoṇoti nibbānaninno. Carissati brahmacariyanti pabbajjaṃ sāsanabrahmacariyaṃ carissati.
analyzed: nekkhamma poṇo ti nibbāna ninno carissati brahmacariyanti pabbajjam sāsana brahmacariyam carissati
translated: “Inclined to renunciation”: inclined to extinction. “Will live the life”: will go forth and live the life of the spiritual practice of the dispensation.

original: 1270. Lesakappenāti kappiyalesena. Na ca vohareyyāti māyāsāṭheyyavasena vacanaṃ na🔽nicchāreyya. Dhamme ṭhito kinti labhetha dukkhanti evaṃ vuttanayena dhamme ṭhito
analyzed: lesa kappena ati kappiya lesena na ca vohareyya ati māyā sāṭheyya vasena vacanam na  dhamme ṭhitaḥ kinti labhetha dukkhanti evam vutta nayena dhamme ṭhitaḥ
translated: “In accordance with the rules”: in accordance with what is proper. “He will not transgress”: he will not utter words by way of deceit and fraud.

original: dhammacārī samacārī kinti kena pakārena dukkhaṃ labhetha pāpuṇeyya.🔽1271. Taṃkāraṇāti tannimittaṃ tassa upāsakassa hetu. Pātukatomhi attanāti sayameva
analyzed: dhamma cārī sama cārī kinti kena pakārena dukkham labhetha pāpuṇeyya  tad kāraṇā ati tad nimittam tassa upāsakassa hetu sayam eva
translated: “What will he get by standing on Dhamma?”: what will he get, what will he attain, by way of suffering, in the way stated thus, “What will he get by standing on Dhamma”?

original: tumhākaṃ ahaṃ pāturahosiṃ. “Attāna”ntipi pāṭho, mama attānaṃ tumhākaṃ pātvākāsinti
analyzed: tumhākam aham pātuḥ ahosim pāṭhaḥ mama attānam tumhākam
translated: “For that reason”: for that cause, for that reason, on account of that lay follower. “I have made myself known to you”: I have made myself known to you by myself. “Attāna” is also a reading; the meaning is: I have made my self known to you.

original: attho. Tasmāti yasmā ahaṃ dhammaṃ apacāyamāno taṃ rakkhanto tumhepi rakkhāmi, tasmā
analyzed: attho tasmā iti yasmai aham dhammam apacāyamāno tam rakkhantaḥ tumhe api rakkhāmi tasmā
translated: Therefore. Because I protect you by respecting the Dhamma,🔽Look at the Dhamma. Look at the Dhamma by acting in accordance with it.

original: dhammaṃ passatha dhammameva caritabbaṃ katvā oloketha. Aññatra teniha bhasmī bhavethāti
analyzed: dhammam passatha dhammam eva caritabbam katvā oloketha aññatra tena iha bhasmī bhavetha ati
translated: Without him you would be reduced to ashes here.🔽If you had come without that lay follower, you would have gone to destruction

original: tena upāsakena vinā ce āgatā, imasmiṃ marukantāre anāthā appaṭisaraṇā bhasmabhāvaṃ
analyzed: tena upāsakena vinā ce āgatāḥ imasmin maru kantāre anāthāḥ appaṭisaraṇāḥ bhasma bhāvam
translated: in this desert of death, helpless and without a protector.🔽Quickly. With such quickness, with such haste, with such urgency.

original: gaccheyyātha. Khippamānenāti evaṃ khippantena vambhantena pīḷantena. Lahunti sukaraṃ.🔽Parenāti adhikaṃ, aññena vā. Tasmā sukho have sappurisena saṅgamoti. So hi khantisoracce
analyzed: gaccheyyātha khippamānena ati evam khippantena vambhantena pīḍantena lahunti sukaram  parena ati adhikam aññena vā tasmā sukhaḥ have sappurisena saṅgamo ti saḥ hi khanti soracce
translated: Easily. It is easy.🔽By another. By someone else.

original: niviṭṭho kenaci kiñci vuttopi na paṭippharatīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: niviṭṭhaḥ kenaci kiñci vuttaḥ api na paṭippharati iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: Therefore, it is good to associate with a good person. The intention is that he, being established in patience and self-control, does not retaliate when spoken to by anyone.

original: Evaṃ sāmaññato kittitaṃ sarūpato ñātukāmā vāṇijā –
analyzed: evam sāmaññataḥ kittitam sarūpataḥ ñātu kāmāḥ vāṇijāḥ
translated: The merchants, desiring to know him in his own form, having been praised in this way in a general way, said this:

original: “Kiṃ nāma so kiñca karoti kammaṃ,
analyzed: kim nāma saḥ kiñca karoti kammaṃ
translated: “What is his name? What does he do for a living?

original: Kiṃ nāmadheyyaṃ kiṃ pana tassa gottaṃ;
analyzed: kim nāmadheyyam kim pana tassa gottam
translated: What is his name? What is his clan?

original: Mayampi naṃ daṭṭhukāmamha yakkha, yassānukampāya idhāgatosi;
analyzed: mayam pi nam daṭṭhu kāmamha yakkha yassa anukampāya idha āgataḥ asi
translated: We too desire to see him, O yakkha, for whose sake you have come here;

original: Lābhā hi tassa yassa tuvaṃ pihesī”ti. –
analyzed: lābhā hi tassa yassa tuvam pihesi iti
translated: For he is fortunate who has you for his friend.

original: Gāthamāhaṃsu. Tattha kiṃ nāma soti nāmato so jantu satto ko nāma. Kiñca karoti kammanti
analyzed: gātham āhaṃsu tattha kim nāma saḥ ti nāmataḥ saḥ jantu satto kaḥ nāma kiñca karoti kammanti
translated: They spoke this verse. Herein, who is he? What is his name? What is his kind? What does he do?

original: kasivaṇijjādīsu kīdisaṃ kammaṃ karoti. Kiṃ nāmadheyyanti mātāpitūhi kataṃ pana “tisso🔽phusso”tiādīsu tassa kiṃ nāmadheyyaṃ, “bhaggavo bhāradvājo”tiādīsu kiṃ vā tassa gottaṃ.
analyzed: kasi vaṇijja ādīsu kīdisam kammam karoti kim nāmadheyyanti mātā pitūhi katam pana tisso  phussaḥ ti ādīsu tassa kim nāmadheyyam bhaggavaḥ bhāradvājaḥ iti ādīsu kim vā tassa gottam
translated: What kind of work does he do in agriculture, trade, and so on? What is his name? What is his clan?

original: Yassa tuvaṃ pihesīti yaṃ tuvaṃ piyāyasi.
analyzed: yassa tuvam pihesi iti yam tuvam piyāyasi
translated: Who is he whom you love?

original: Idāni devaputto taṃ nāmagottādivasena dassento –
analyzed: idāni devaputto tam nāma gotta ādi vasena dassento
translated: Now the god, showing him by name, clan, and so on, said:

original: “Yo kappako sambhavanāmadheyyo,
analyzed: yaḥ kappako sambhava nāmadheyyaḥ
translated: He is a barber, his name is Sambhava,

original: Upāsako kocchaphalūpajīvī;
analyzed: upāsakaḥ
translated: A lay devotee who lives on fruit from the forest.

original: Jānātha naṃ tumhākaṃ pesiyo so,
analyzed: jānātha nam tumhākam pesiyaḥ saḥ
translated: You know him, he is your messenger,

original: Mā kho naṃ hīḷittha supesalo so”ti. –🔽Āha. Tattha kappakoti nhāpito. Sambhavanāmadheyyoti sambhavoti evaṃnāmo. Kocchaphalūpajīvīti
analyzed: mā khalu nam hīḍittha su pesalaḥ sa uti  āha tattha kappako ti nhāpito sambhava nāmadheyyaḥ ti sambhavaḥ iti evaṃnāmaḥ kocchaphalūpajīvī iti
translated: Do not despise him, he is a good man.🔽Herein, a barber is one who shaves the head. His name is Sambhava. He lives on fruit from the forest.

original: kocchañca phalañca upanissāya jīvanako. Tattha kocchaṃ nāma āḷakādisaṇṭhāpanatthaṃ
analyzed: koccham ca phalam ca upanissāya jīvanako tattha koccham nāma āḷaka ādi saṇṭhāpana attham
translated: Herein, a barber is one who shaves the head. His name is Sambhava. He lives on fruit from the forest.🔽Herein, a barber is one who shaves the head. His name is Sambhava. He lives on fruit from the forest.

original: kesādīnaṃ ullikhanasādhanaṃ. Pesiyo pesanakārako veyyāvaccakaro.
analyzed: kesa ādīnam ullikhana sādhanam pesiyaḥ pesana kārakaḥ veyyāvacca karo
translated: and the razor is the means of shaving the head. The messenger is the one who sends, the one who does the errand.

original: Idāni vāṇijā taṃ sañjānitvā āhaṃsu –
analyzed: idāni vāṇijā tam sañjānitvā āhaṃsu
translated: Now the merchants, recognizing him, said:

original: “Jānāmase yaṃ tvaṃ pavadesi yakkha, na kho naṃ jānāma sa edisoti;
analyzed: jānāmase yam tvam pavadesi yakkha na kho nam jānāma saḥ edisaḥ iti
translated: “We know the one you praise, Yakkha, but we do not know that he is such as you describe;

original: Mayampi naṃ pūjayissāma yakkha, sutvāna tuyhaṃ vacanaṃ uḷāra”nti.
analyzed: mayam pi nam pūjayissāma yakkha sutvāna tuyham vacanam uḷāranti
translated: We too will honor him, Yakkha, having heard your words of praise.”

original: Tattha jānāmaseti yaṃ tvaṃ vadesi, taṃ mayaṃ sarūpato jānāma. Edisoti guṇato pana yathā tayā kittitaṃ, evaṃ edisoti taṃ na kho jānāma, yathā taṃ aviddasunoti adhippāyo.
analyzed: tattha jānāmasa iti yam tvam vadesi tam mayam sarūpataḥ jānāma edisaḥ iti guṇataḥ pana yathā tayā kittitam evam edisaḥ iti tam na kho jānāma yathā tam a vidda suno ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: Herein, we know means we know him as you describe him in his bodily form. But such as you describe means we do not know him as you describe him in his special qualities, as if we had never seen him before.

original: Idāni devaputto te attano vimānaṃ āropetvā anusāsanatthaṃ –
analyzed: idāni devaputto te attanaḥ vimānam āropetvā anusāsana attham
translated: Now the god, having lifted them up into his own mansion, spoke this verse in order to instruct them:

original: “Ye keci imasmiṃ satthe manussā, daharā mahantā athavāpi majjhimā;
analyzed: ye keci imasmin satthe manussāḥ daharāḥ mahantāḥ athavā api majjhimā
translated: “Whatever people there be in this caravan, young, old, or middle-aged,

original: Sabbeva te ālambantu vimānaṃ, passantu puññānaṃ phalaṃ kadariyā”ti. –
analyzed: sabbe iva te ālambantu vimānam passantu puññānam phalam kadariyā ati
translated: Let them all climb into the mansion and see the fruit of merit that is not barren.”

original: Gāthamāha. Tattha mahantāti vuḍḍhā. Ālambantūti ārohantu. Kadariyāti maccharino adānasīlā.
analyzed: gātham āha tattha mahantā ati vuḍḍhāḥ ālambantu iti ārohantu kadariyā ati mad śarinaḥ a dāna sīlā
translated: Herein, old means aged. Climb means ascend. Barren means stingy, of the habit of not giving.

original: Idāni pariyosāne cha gāthā dhammasaṅgāhakehi vuttā –
analyzed: idāni pariyosāne cha gāthāḥ dhamma saṅgāhakehi vuttā
translated: Now, at the end, six verses were spoken by the Dhamma-proclaimers:

original: “Te tattha sabbeva ahaṃ pureti, taṃ kappakaṃ tattha purakkhatvā;
analyzed: te tattha sabbe iva aham purā iti tam kappakam tattha purakkhatvā
translated: “All of them there, ‘I was before,’ placing that one in front,

original: Sabbeva te ālambiṃsu vimānaṃ, masakkasāraṃ viya vāsavassa.
analyzed: sabbe iva te ālambiṃsu vimānam masakka sāram viya vāsavassa
translated: All of them there clung to the divine mansion, like Sakka’s abode, the Mango Grove.

original: “Te tattha sabbeva ahaṃ pureti, upāsakattaṃ paṭivedayiṃsu;🔽Pāṇātipātā viratā ahesuṃ, loke adinnaṃ parivajjayiṃsu;
analyzed: te tattha sabbe iva aham purā iti upāsaka ttam paṭivedayiṃsu  pāṇa atipātāḥ viratāḥ ahesum loke adinnam parivajjayiṃsu
translated: “All of them there, ‘I was before,’ they announced their state as lay-followers,🔽They abstained from killing living creatures, in the world they avoided what was not given,

original: Amajjapā no ca musā bhaṇiṃsu, sakena dārena ca ahesuṃ tuṭṭhā.
analyzed: a majja pāḥ no ca musā bhaṇiṃsu sakena dārena ca ahesum tuṭṭhā
translated: They did not drink liquor or wine, they were satisfied with their own wives.

original: “Te tattha sabbeva ahaṃ pureti, upāsakattaṃ paṭivedayitvā;
analyzed: te tattha sabbe iva aham purā iti upāsaka ttam paṭivedayitvā
translated: “All of them there, ‘I was before,’ having announced their state as lay-followers,

original: Pakkāmi sattho anumodamāno, yakkhiddhiyā anumato punappunaṃ.
analyzed: pakkāmi satthaḥ anumodamānaḥ yakkhiddhiyai anumataḥ punappunam
translated: The group left, rejoicing, by the power of the yakkha they were repeatedly approved.

original: “Gantvāna te sindhusovīrabhūmiṃ, dhanatthikā uddayaṃ patthayānā;
analyzed: gantvāna te sindhusovīra bhūmim dhanatthikāḥ uddayam patthayānā
translated: “Having gone to the land of Sindhu and Sovira, seeking for profit and hoping for gain,

original: Yathāpayogā paripuṇṇalābhā, paccāgamuṃ pāṭaliputtamakkhataṃ.
analyzed: yathā apayogā paripuṇṇa lābhā paccāgamum pāṭaliputtam akkhatam
translated: Having received as much as they needed, they returned to the city of Pāṭaliputta.

original: “Gantvāna te saṅgharaṃ sotthivanto, puttehi dārehi samaṅgibhūtā;
analyzed: gantvāna te saṅgharam sotthivantaḥ puttehi dārehi samaṅgi bhūtā
translated: “Having gone to Saṅghara, safe and sound, together with their children and wives,

original: Ānandī vittā sumanā patītā, akaṃsu serīsamahaṃ uḷāraṃ;
analyzed: ānandī vittā sumanā patītā uḷāram
translated: Delighted, rich, glad, and elated, They made a great offering to the Elder;

original: Serīsakaṃ te pariveṇaṃ māpayiṃsu.
analyzed: sa irīsakam te pariveṇam māpayiṃsu
translated: And they had a cloister built for the Elder.

original: “Etādisā sappurisāna sevanā, mahatthikā dhammaguṇāna sevanā;
analyzed: etādisā sappurisāna sevanā mahatthikā dhamma guṇāna sevanā
translated: “Such is the service of good men, The service of the qualities of the Dhamma is of great benefit;

original: Ekassa atthāya upāsakassa, sabbeva sattā sukhitā ahesu”nti.
analyzed: ekassa atthāya upāsakassa sabbe iva sattā sukhitāḥ ahesunti
translated: For the sake of one lay follower, All beings became happy.”

original: 1276. Tattha ahaṃ pureti ahaṃ purimaṃ ahaṃ purimanti ahamahaṃkarāti attho. “Te tattha🔽sabbevā”ti vatvā puna “sabbeva te”ti vacanaṃ “sabbeva te yathā vimānassa āruhane
analyzed: tattha aham purā iti aham purimam aham purimanti aham ahaṃkarā ati attho te tattha  sabbe iva ati vatvā puna sabbe iva te iti vacanam sabbe iva te yathā vimānassa āruhane
translated: Herein, I in the past: I in the former time, I in the past: the meaning is, I in the past.

original: ussukkajātā ahesuṃ, tathā sabbeva taṃ āruhiṃsu, na kassaci āruhane antarāyo ahosī”ti🔽dassanatthaṃ vuttaṃ. Masakkasāraṃ viya vāsavassāti “masakkasāra”nti ca tāvatiṃsabhavanaṃ
analyzed: ussukka jātāḥ ahesum tathā sabbe eva tam āruhiṃsu na kassaci āruhane antarāyaḥ ahosi iti  dassana attham vuttam masakka sāram viya vāsavassa ati masakka sāram ti ca tāvatiṃsa bhavanam
translated: And after saying “all of them there” he said “all of them” again in order to show that “just as they were eager to mount the celestial mansion, so all of them mounted it, and there was no obstacle to anyone’s mounting it.”

original: vuccati, sabbaṃ vā devabhavanaṃ, idha pana sakkabhavanaṃ veditabbaṃ. Tenāha “masakkasāraṃ viya vāsavassā”ti.
analyzed: vuccati sabbam vā deva bhavanam idha pana sakka bhavanam veditabbam tena āha masakka sāram viya vāsavassa iti
translated: Like the Masakkasāra Palace of Vāsava: the Masakkasāra is said to be the abode of the Thirty-Three, or it is all the abode of the gods, but here it should be understood as Sakka’s abode. That is why he said “like the Masakkasāra Palace of Vāsava.”

original: 1277-8. Atha te vāṇijā vimānaṃ passitvā pasannacittā tassa devaputtassa ovāde ṭhatvā
analyzed: atha te vāṇijāḥ vimānam passitvā pasanna cittā tassa devaputtassa ovāde ṭhatvā
translated: Then, on seeing the mansion, the merchants, with their minds full of confidence, established themselves in the advice of that god,

original: saraṇesu ca sīlesu ca patiṭṭhāya tassa ānubhāvena sotthinā icchitaṃ desaṃ agamaṃsu.
analyzed: saraṇesu ca sīlesu ca patiṭṭhāya tassa ānubhāvena sotthinā icchitam desam agamaṃsu
